43d8c95718.gt:
Brew coffee using a ratio of about 1 1/2 tablespoons coffee per cup of water.
(We used a single brew coffee maker and used the espresso strength setting that uses less water and brews a stronger coffee.)
Set the coffee aside to reach room temperature or place it in the refrigerator for 10-15 minutes to cool quickly.
Add the room temperature coffee, creamer, raspberry and hazelnut syrups, and the ice into a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour the drink into a tall glass and enjoy!
Optional garnishes: top with whipped cream, shaved chocolate, mint leaves and a raspberry.

54bc08b13e.gt:
Combine cream, milk, water, cocoa powder, corn syrup, and salt in a medium saucepan.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat, whisking until cocoa powder is completely dissolved.
Remove from heat and add chocolate, butter, and vanilla, stirring until chocolate is melted and sauce is smooth.
Serve warm.
54bc08b13e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler over low heat.
Stir in sugar and cocoa powder.
Add a pinch of salt and a dash of vanilla.
Stir in the egg yolk and whisk until smooth.
Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until the top is set.
Cool completely before serving.

0935eaa489.gt:
Microwave chocolate in microwaveable bowl on MEDIUM 2 min.
or until chocolate is almost melted, stirring after 1 min.
Stir until chocolate is completely melted.
Stir in 3/4 cup each of the grahams and marshmallows.
Spread onto waxed paper-covered baking sheet.
Decorate with remaining grahams and marshmallows.
Refrigerate 1 hour or until firm.
Break into 60 pieces.
0935eaa489.pred:
S'more Bark is a dessert made with graham crackers, chocolate, and marshmallows.
In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup of graham cracker crumbs and 1/4 cup of melted chocolate.
Press the mixture into a 9x13 pan.
In a medium bowl, combine 1/2 cup of marshmallows and 1/4 cup of melted chocolate.
Spread the marshmallow mixture over the graham cracker crust.
Refrigerate until set.
Cut into squares and serve.

d3047450d6.gt:
Boil the water and pour a small amount in the teapot, swishing it around to warm the pot.
Combine the mint and green tea and sugar in the teapot, then fill it with the rest of the hot water.
Let the tea brew for three minutes.
Set out glasses for the tea.
A shot-glass is close to the slender glasses used in Morocco.
Fill just one glass with the tea, then pour it back in the pot.
Repeat.
This helps to dissolve and distribute the sugar.
Pour the tea.
You want a nice foam on the tea so always pour with the teapot a high distance above the glasses.
If you do not have at least a little foam on the top of the first glass, then pour it back into the teapot and try again until the tea starts to foam up nicely.
Garnish with the remaining sprigs of mint.
d3047450d6.pred:
Mint leaves, sugar, water, and tea.
Sugar: Place 2 teaspoons of sugar in a cup.
Mint Leaves: Fill the cup with water and add 4-5 mint leaves.
Tea: Add 1 teabag of Moroccan mint tea.
Bring to a boil and let steep for 5 minutes.
Strain and serve.

eef728c6b8.gt:
Lightly coat a nonstick skillet with cooking spray.
Cook the onion and chiles in the skillet over medium heat for 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg substitute, cheese, pepper, and Tabasco (if using).
Pour into skillet and scramble for 3 to 4 minutes, until the eggs are done to taste, but not dry.
Place the egg mixture along one-third of the tortilla, about 2 inches away from the bottom.
Fold up the lower edge, then roll from the side to form a burrito.
eef728c6b8.pred:
Brown eggs, spinach, cheese, and tortillas.
.
.
.

5fff64fad0.gt:
Preheat oven to 375
Melt butter and place in the pan you are using for the cobbler
In a medium Mixing bowl mix together flour, baking powder, 1 cup of sugar and milk ( do not mix while in pan)
On high heat in a medium pot, mix all other ingredients peaches, Lennon juice, Brown sugar, and 2 teaspoons of cinnamon
Poor heated ingredients into pan ( do not mix while in pan)
Sprinkle 2 teaspoons of cinnamon over top
Place in oven
Cook for 30 minutes or until top is golden brown
Serve hot or cool over vanilla ice cream
5fff64fad0.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Serve warm.

e946c009a6.gt:
In a large nonstick skillet, combine mushrooms, chopped onions and 1/2 cup water.
Cook over medium-high heat, stirring often, until liquid has evaporated and vegetables are beginning to brown.
To deglaze, add 1/3 cup of the vegetable broth and stir to scrape any browned bits free from pan bottom.
Continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables begin to brown again.
Repeat deglazing and browning steps 2 more times, using 1/3 cup broth each time.
Onion should be golden brown.
This should take about 15 to 20 minutes total.
Remove pan from heat.
In a large bowl, beat eggs to blend.
Stir in shredded zucchini, mushroom mixture, bread crumbs, cheese, pepper and oregano.
Turn into greased 9x13" baking dish, spreading out evenly.
Bake uncovered at 350 until casserole appears set in center when dish is gently shaken -- about 35 minutes.
Let stand 5 minutes, then serve.
e946c009a6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut zucchini into 1/2-inch slices.
Cut mushrooms into 1/2-inch slices.
Place zucchini and mushrooms in a bowl.
Add 1/4 cup of olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Toss to coat.
Spread zucchini and mushrooms in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until tender.
Serve hot.

df541b69a3.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Coat baking sheet once with cooking spray.
Set aside.
Coat large skillet with cooking spray and place over low heat.
Add onion; cook, stirring often, until just softened, about 3 minutes.
Add garlic and stir 30 seconds.
Add soy meat, breaking it up with a wooden spoon.
Stir in tomatoes, roasted jalapeno, chili powder and cumin.
Mix well.
Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, stack tortillas, wrap in foil and bake until warm and pliable, 8 to 10 minutes.
(Alternatively, using tongs, heat each tortilla over an open flame.)
Place tortillas on work surface and spoon about 3/4 cup meat filling in center of each.
Fold in sides and roll up, jelly-roll style.
Place on prepared baking sheet, seam side down.
Bake until chimichangas are lightly browned, about 30 minutes.
Serve hot with salsa.
df541b69a3.pred:
Chimichangas: 1.
Flatten 12 flour tortillas.
2.
Fill each tortilla with 1/2 cup of shredded cheese.
3.
Fold over the tortilla to enclose the cheese.
4.
Dip the folded tortilla in a beaten egg, then in a mixture of flour and cornmeal.
5.
Fry the tortillas in hot oil until golden brown.
6.
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Fresh Tomato Salsa:
1.
Cut 2 medium tomatoes into small pieces.
2.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped fresh cilantro.
3.
1/2 cup of chopped fresh onion.
4.
1/4 cup of lime juice.
5.
1/4 cup of chopped fresh tomato.
6.
1/2 teaspoon of salt.
7.
1/4 teaspoon of black pepper.
8.
1/4 teaspoon of sugar.
Mix all ingredients together and chill.
Serve with the fried Chimichangas.

f5564fb5c4.gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut cheese slices into quarters, then cut each piece diagonally in half.
Place crackers in single layer on baking sheet; top with ham and cheese.
Bake 4 to 5 min.
or until cheese is melted.
Top with preserves and onions.
f5564fb5c4.pred:
Mix all ingredients together and place in a skillet.
Cook on medium heat until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve on a plate with a side of tomato slices.

05096fc3ad.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Coat a standard (12 cup) muffin tin with cooking spray.
In a large bowl, whisk egg whites, sugar, cocoa and salt until combined.
Add coconut; mix until well coated.
***I would add the sliced almonds in at this point with the coconut.
They didn't want to stick to the tops of the cookies!
***.
Dividing evenly, spoon mixture into muffin tin and pat in gently with moistened fingers.
Sprinkle with almonds and pat on gently.
***See note above***.
Bake until almonds are golden, 20-25 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool in tin for 5-10 minutes.
Run a thin metal spatula around the edges to loosen from pan.
Turn out onto rack to cool completely.
Cookies keep in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.
05096fc3ad.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together coconut, sugar, egg whites, and vanilla.
Add flour and mix well.
Place 1 teaspoon of batter into each of 12 paper-lined muffin cups.
Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
Remove from oven and cool.
In a small bowl, mix together chocolate and coconut.
Place 1 teaspoon of chocolate mixture into each of the cooled cups.
Top with another teaspoon of coconut.
Return to oven and bake for 5 minutes or until chocolate is melted and coconut is toasted.
Remove from oven and cool.

37568c51b9.gt:
Toast the sesame seeds in a frying pan over medium heat until brown, let them cool.
Cut the beef in thin slices.
Mix all marinade ingredients together, add also the sesame seeds, and to this add the beef.
Leave to marinate at least 30 minutes, a few hours is preferred.
Thread the meat on wooden skewers, grill or barbecue a few minutes on each side, using the remaining marinade for basting.

97117994fc.gt:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Beat first 6 ingredients in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Stir in apples.
Pour into greased and floured 12-cup fluted tube pan or 10-inch tube pan.
Bake 50 min.
to 1 hour or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean.
Cool cake in pan 15 min.
Loosen cake from sides of pan; invert onto wire rack.
Gently remove pan.
Cool cake completely.
Transfer to plate.
Microwave caramels and milk in microwaveable bowl on HIGH 1-1/2 min.
or until caramels are completely melted and sauce is smooth, stirring every 30 sec.
Cool 10 min.
or until slightly thickened.
Drizzle over cake just before serving.
97117994fc.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 9x13-inch pan.
In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients (flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt).
In a medium bowl, combine the wet ingredients (eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla).
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool completely before frosting.
To make the frosting, combine the cream cheese, butter, and vanilla in a medium bowl.
Beat until smooth.
Add the powdered sugar and beat until fluffy.
Spread the frosting over the cooled cake.
Garnish with apple slices.

3d413a0413.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. 2.
Wash potatoes well.
3.
Lay each potato on a cutting board.
4.
With a sharp knife, thinly slice each potato, being careful to NOT CUT all the way through.
(TIP: I lay a chopstick on each side of the potato so I dont accidentally cut too far.)
5.
Season each potato.
This is where you can get creative slide a sliver of garlic between the layers, or experiment with different herbs, butter, whatever sounds good to you!.
6.
Place potatoes in a baking dish that has been drizzled with olive oil.
7.
Drizzle potatoes with olive oil.
8.
Bake at 425 degrees for 40 minutes, or until the inside is tender.
9.
Enjoy!
3d413a0413.pred:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Cut potatoes into 1/4 inch slices.
Place potato slices in a large bowl and toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, flip potatoes, and bake for an additional 10 minutes.

d255a02fb6.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Grease 24 muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners.
Whisk 3 cups flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl.
Stir white sugar, applesauce, and eggs together in another bowl.
Add sugar mixture to flour mixture and stir until batter is just combined.
Fold peaches and cranberries into batter.
Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
Stir brown sugar and 2 tablespoons flour together in a small bowl.
Sprinkle brown sugar mixture over the tops of the muffins.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 25 minutes.
Cool for 10 minutes before transferring muffins to a wire rack to cool completely.
d255a02fb6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Stir in cranberries and peaches.
In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, and oil.
Pour egg mixture into dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Do not overmix.
Spoon batter into muffin cups, filling each cup about 2/3 full.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
Cool muffins in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

6e11affa2e.gt:
In a small bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a 1 quart glass container (a mason jar works great!
), layer the flour mixture, sugar, brown sugar, oats, walnuts, cereal and cranberries.
Cover and store in a cool dry place for up to 6 months.
Write this note to go with your gift mix: To Prepare Cookies ~ In a large bowl, beat the softened butter, egg, water and vanilla until blended.
Add cookie mix and mix well.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 350F for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
6e11affa2e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together the oats, cranberries, flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add the butter and mix until the mixture is crumbly.
Stir in the brown sugar and egg.
Mix until the dough is well combined.
Drop the dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cookies are lightly browned.

af6f74da4c.gt:
Cut the enoki mushrooms into 3 even lengths, and shred apart.
Cut the tofu into 2 cm cubes.
Bring the dashi stock to a boil and add the ingredients.
Add the enoki mushrooms and tofu and bring to a gentle simmer again.
Serve in bowls scattered with some chopped green onion.
af6f74da4c.pred:
Wash the tofu and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Boil the enoki mushrooms in water until soft.
Heat the broth in a pot.
Add tofu and enoki mushrooms to the broth and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the soy sauce and sesame oil.
Serve with a side of rice.

91d53e8b2a.gt:
I would use my own brownie recipe but you can use a box mix.
Prepare the brownie mix as directed on package.
Pour into greased 13x9 baking pan.
Beat cream cheese with electric mixer on med.
speed until smooth.
Add sugar, mixing until blended.
Add egg and vanilla; mix just until blended.
Pour cream cheese mixture over brownie mixture; cut through batter with knife several times for marble effect.
Bake at 350F for 35 to 40 minutes or until cream cheese mixture is lightly browned.
Cool; cut into squares.
Note: Do not use brownie mixes that include syrup pouch.
91d53e8b2a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix brownie mix, eggs, and water in a large bowl until well blended.
Pour into a 9x13-inch pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool completely in the pan.
Cut into squares.
Sprinkle with chocolate chips.
Store in the refrigerator.

d46848fda2.gt:
In a medium bowl, add rice flour, all-purpose flour, bread crumbs, turmeric, cumin powder, red chili, mango powder, salt, water and make a thick paste.
Set aside.
Cut 1/2 inch thick round pieces of the eggplant.
This will give total of 10 pieces.
Heat the large nonstick pan on high, dab oil and reduce heat to medium.
Take 1 round piece of eggplant, dip it into the batter, making sure its evenly coated on both sides, and put it on the heated pan.
After 2 minutes, turn to the other side and cook for another 2 minutes.
Check both the sides to make sure they are evenly golden brown.
Continue until all eggplant pieces are cooked.
Serve hot.
d46848fda2.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut eggplant into 1/2-inch slices.
Place eggplant slices in a colander and sprinkle with salt.
Let stand for 30 minutes.
Rinse eggplant slices and pat dry.
In a large bowl, combine eggplant slices, flour, baking powder, salt, pepper, and 1/2 cup of the bread crumbs.
Mix well.
In a small bowl, combine the remaining bread crumbs and parmesan cheese.
Dip eggplant slices in the egg, then roll in the bread crumb mixture.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve hot with ketchup.

18612275da.gt:
Preheat oven to 350
Lightly butter both sides of bread and place on baking sheet
Add all seasonings to taste.
(I like to put them in my hand first and sprinkle them on them on so they don't get overpowered).
Add the cheese and bake for about 5-7 minutes.
18612275da.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut the bread into 1-inch cubes.
Mix the garlic, butter, and parsley.
Spread the garlic butter mixture on the bread cubes.
Place the bread cubes on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown.

59d1144ae9.gt:
Pour 1 quart of hot water into a large saucepan, and dissolve the gelatin.
Allow to cool.
Pour the cooled gelatin into a large punch bowl.
Stir in: pineapple juice, orange juice concentrate, sugar, and 4 1/2 cups of cold water.
Just before serving, pour in the Ginger Ale.
59d1144ae9.pred:
Combine 1 cup of pineapple juice, 1 cup of cranberry juice, 1 cup of green tea, 1/2 cup of orange juice, 1/2 cup of lemon juice, 1/2 cup of sugar, and 1/2 cup of water.
Stir well.
Serve over ice.

ed226be03e.gt:
Heat oil in a small frying pan over low heat until hot, about 1 minute.
Add chile flakes and remove from heat.
Let cool to room temperature.
Strain through a fine mesh strainer if desired, then transfer to a container and cover until ready to use.
Heat half of a gas or charcoal grill to high (about 400 degrees F) and the other half to low (about 300 degrees F).
Divide dough in 1/2 and roll into 2 rounds about 1/4 inch thick and 10 inches in diameter.
Brush the top of 1 round with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Lay dough oiled side down on the hotter half of the grill and brush the top with oil and sprinkle with salt.
Grill without moving until grill marks form on the bottom of the dough, about 2 minutes.
Flip dough with a spatula or tongs to the cooler half of grill.
Spread 1/2 of the sauce evenly over the dough, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the Parmesan cheese over the sauce, then top with 1/2 of the peppers, 1/2 of the sausage, and 1/2 of the mozzarella.
Cover and grill, rotating if necessary to avoid any hot spots, until dough is lightly charred and cheese is melted, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Transfer pizza to a cutting board, sprinkle 1 tablespoon more of the Parmesan over top, drizzle with desired amount of chile oil, slice, and serve.
Repeat with second round of dough and remaining toppings.
ed226be03e.pred:
Roasted peppers, spicy sausage, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and fresh basil.
In a large bowl, combine roasted peppers, spicy sausage, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and basil.
Spread the mixture onto a pizza dough and bake in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.
Serve with a side of garlic bread.

42ab84ef73.gt:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Thaw pastry according to directions on box (about 40 minutes).
Cut pastry into 3 sections along perforated lines.
Lay one section of pastry on a baking sheet to assemble.
Spread 2 tablespoons of pesto onto the pastry.
Next, space 5 shrimp evenly on top of the pesto.
Sprinkle with slivers of sundried tomatoes and pine nuts.
Using your fingers, fold over the sides of the pastry so they meet in the middle, and pinch to form a seal (although it will open while baking).
Bake one roll at a time, at 450 degrees F for 5 minutes, then lower oven heat to 375 degrees F and cook an additional 5-8 minutes until pastry is brown and puffed.
Repeat assembly and baking process with remaining two pastry sheets.
Slice each roll into five pieces (one shrimp in each piece) and serve warm.
Makes 15 appetizers.
42ab84ef73.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine 1 lb. prawns, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1/2 cup bread crumbs, 1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley, 1/2 tsp. dried thyme, 1/2 tsp. dried oregano, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper.
Roll out 1 sheet of puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to 1/8 inch thickness.
Cut into 4 equal squares.
Place 1 square on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Spread 1/4 cup of the prawn mixture on top of the pastry square.
Fold the pastry over the filling to form a triangle.
Press the edges to seal.
Repeat with the remaining pastry and filling.
Brush the tops with egg wash and bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

3cb86cf2f4.gt:
Wash 5 potatoes.
Cut into square pieces.
Preheat oil in skillet on stove top.
I use my iron skillet
Chop up 1/4 white onion on cutting board along with potatoes.
Chop up two green peppers on board.
Dust garlic powder over potato, onion, pepper mix
Place potatoes, onion and peppers in skillet.
Dust with salt and pepper for additional flavor.
Cook until golden brown or potatoes are tender.
Serves about 5, can serve more just cut up more potatoes.
One potato per person want to feed.
3cb86cf2f4.pred:
Sauteed potatoes are a delicious side dish.
To make sauteed potatoes, you will need the following ingredients: potatoes, olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic.
Follow these steps to make sauteed potatoes:
1. Peel and slice potatoes into 1/2-inch thick slices.
2. Rinse potatoes in cold water and pat dry with a paper towel.
3. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
4. Add potatoes and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the edges begin to brown.
5. Add salt and pepper to taste.
6. Add garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
7. Add the sliced potatoes and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
8. Serve sauteed potatoes hot.

71c5c68d5d.gt:
Preheat your oven to 425 F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with a Silpat or parchment paper and set aside.
Place all the ingredients for the meatballs in a large bowl.
Using your clean hands, mix all of the ingredients until well combined.
(Kind of gross, but kind of fun.)
Cover and refrigerate the pork mixture for 20 minutes to allow the chia seeds to work their gelling magic.
Use your hands to mold the pork mixture into 1-inch meatballs, and arrange them on the prepared baking sheet, making sure they arent touching.
You should have approximately 20 meatballs.
Transfer the tray of meatballs to the oven and bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned and cooked through.
In a small bowl, whisk together all of the ingredients for the glaze.
Pour the glaze into a large non-stick pan over medium heat and keep it warm until meatballs are done.
When hot, add the meatballs and toss to coat.
Serve meatballs warm over your stir-fried vegetables or noodles of your choice.
71c5c68d5d.pred:
Chia Seed Pork Meatballs:
In a bowl, combine ground pork, chia seeds, bread crumbs, onion, garlic, and egg.
Form into balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes.
Spicy Ginger-Soy Glaze:
Combine ginger, garlic, soy sauce, and honey in a small bowl.
Set aside.
To serve, place baked meatballs on a serving plate and drizzle with the glaze.

77ec10e4ac.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 350F.
Brush a mini cupcake pan with melted, unsalted butter.
Set aside 2.
In a medium bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and ginger.
3.
In another bowl, whisk oil, sugar, eggs, and vanilla; mix to blend.
(I used an electric mixer out of ease.)
4.
Add flour mixture to the creamed mixture a little at a time, mixing as you add.
5.
Fold in the zucchini and pecans.
6.
Fill the mini cupcake pan, filling each hole a little more than 1/2 way full.
Bake 10-15 minutes.
7.
Cool completely on wire racks.
Enjoy them plain or add a little cream cheese frosting to the tops!
77ec10e4ac.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease 12 muffin cups.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
In a separate bowl, combine eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla.
Stir wet ingredients into dry ingredients just until moistened.
Fold in the zucchini.
Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
Sprinkle each muffin with chopped pecans.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

75465ac6f9.gt:
Heat grill to medium-high heat.
Toss meat with 2 Tbsp.
A.1.
; let stand 10 min.
Meanwhile, mix remaining A.1., barbecue sauce and mustard until blended.
Thread meat onto 8 skewers.
Grill 6 min.
or until meat is done, turning after 3 min.
and brushing occasionally with barbecue sauce mixture.
75465ac6f9.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Cut beef into 1-inch cubes.
Thread beef onto skewers.
Grill over medium heat for 10 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve with caramel sauce.

d3a8a169dd.gt:
For crust, preheat oven to 275F; crumble ingredients together until well mixed; Press into a greased 9x13 pan and bake in a slow oven (275F) for 8 minutes; increase temp to 375F and top with second mixture and continue baking.
For topping: Mix all ingredients well; spread mixture over the partially baked crust and continue baking in a moderate oven (375F) until well set and slightly browned, about 30 minutes; cool and cut into squares.
d3a8a169dd.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the butter and sugar.
Mix until light and fluffy.
Add the egg and vanilla extract.
Mix well.
Add the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Mix until just combined.
Fold in the walnuts.
Press the dough into a 9x9 inch baking pan.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and allow to cool.
Cut into squares.

952ff059c4.gt:
In medium bowl, mix cocoa, sugar and oil.
Beat in the egg replacer; stir in vanilla.
Combine flour, baking powder and salt.
Stir into cocoa mixture.
Cover and chill 4 hours (or put in the freezer for about 30 minutes).
Preheat oven to 350.
Lightly grease cookie sheet.
Roll dough into 1-inch balls.
Using your finger, poke a hole into the ball and place 2 marshmallow pieces inside.
Form dough back into a ball, making sure marshmallow is completely covered; coat with powdered sugar.
Bake in preheated oven for 10-12 minutes.
Leave on cookie sheet for 1 minute and then transfer to a wire rack or brown paper.
EGG REPLACER 1 egg = 2 TBSP water + 1 TBSP oil + 2 tsp baking powder
Make sure you mix these together before adding to the recipe (dont just throw them all into the batter they must be mixed together first).
952ff059c4.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, mix together sugar, butter, and vanilla.
Add the egg-free and milk-free egg substitute to the butter mixture.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly browned.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Store in an airtight container.

259241dc1b.gt:
Drain the tuna, reserving 1 tablespoon of the liquid.
Put the tuna in a serving bowl and mash with a fork until it's as mushy as you can get it.
Stir the reserved liquid, the salad dressing, honey mustard, relish, celery, carrot, sugar, and salt into the tuna.
Adjust seasoning to taste.
259241dc1b.pred:

a4c28c7c57.gt:
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the olive oil and after the oil is hot, stir in the eggplant.
Cook for 3-5 minutes, turning occasionally, until the eggplant is seared.
Stir in the onions, ginger and garlic, and then cook for about 1 minute, or until soft.
(If the pan is too dry from the eggplant absorbing all the oil, add a touch more olive oil when stirring in the onions.)
Reduce heat to low and stir in the coconut milk, fish sauce, curry powder, brown sugar, black pepper and optional chilies.
Simmer for about 2 minutes or until heated through and eggplant has absorbed some of the sauce.
a4c28c7c57.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut eggplant into 1/2 inch slices.
Place eggplant slices on a baking sheet and brush with olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until eggplant is tender.
While eggplant is baking, prepare coconut milk.
Combine coconut milk, curry paste, and 1/2 cup water in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes.
Add eggplant and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in the lime juice and serve.

8c7a346bad.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Lightly grease a cookie sheet.
Unroll dough on lightly floured surface and press seams together.
Sprinkle one side of block of cream cheese with enough dill to cover.
Place cream cheese, dill side down, in center of dough.
Sprinkle with more dill to cover.
Bring sides of dough up around cheese block and seal to completely enclose.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for approximately 15 minutes.
Serve warm.
8c7a346bad.pred:
Dill, cream cheese, and wrappers.
Cut the cream cheese into small cubes and wrap each cube in a piece of dill.
Place the wrapped cream cheese cubes on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.
Serve with crackers or bread.

af9fb785aa.gt:
Preheat oven to 275F/135C.
In a large bowl toss oatmeal, coconut, nuts, and sunflower seeds together.
In a separate bowl whisk together oil, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla.
Pour liquid mixture over oats and stir until everything is coated.
Pour mixture into a large rimmed baking sheet.
I also cover the baking sheet with baking paper but it's not necessary if you have a non-stick pan.
Bake for approximately 20-25 minutes, stirring once or twice.
Keep an eye on it so it doesn't burn.
Let it cool completely.
Blend in cornflakes if using.
Store in an airtight container.
af9fb785aa.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine oats, almonds, walnuts, and sunflower seeds.
In a small bowl, whisk together honey, oil, and vanilla.
Pour honey mixture over oat mixture and stir to coat.
Spread mixture on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Store in an airtight container.

6f1343402a.gt:
Heat cumin seeds and mustard seed in hot dry skillet over high heat, swirling pan, until seeds start to pop.
Reduce heat to medium; add onions, chilies, and add a small amount of water; cook until onion is tender, adding more water as necessary to prevent sticking.
Add potatoes, ground cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt (to taste), and cayenne pepper, stirring to mix well.
Add 2/3 cup water, cover, reduce heat and cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until spices are absorbed and potatoes are tender.
Add a small amount of water at a time if all liquid evaporates.
Fold in cilantro just before serving.
6f1343402a.pred:
Boil potatoes in salted water until tender.
Drain and set aside.
Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds.
When mustard seeds start to pop, add onions and cook until soft.
Add ginger and garlic and cook for a few seconds.
Add potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Add salt, turmeric, and red chilli powder.
Mix well and cook for 5 minutes.
Serve hot.

193bc22f43.gt:
Microwave broccoli and CHEEZ WHIZ in microwaveable bowl on HIGH 1 min.
or until heated through, stirring after 30 sec.
Lightly smash each potato half with fork or spoon; place on crackers.
Top with broccoli mixture and bacon bits.
Serve warm.
193bc22f43.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Place potatoes in a pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil and cook until tender.
Drain and mash potatoes.
Add in the remaining ingredients and mix well.
Form into 1/2 inch thick patties.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes.

f3d6579000.gt:
Combine milk and mustard in bowl; add cheese.
Microwave, stirring every minute, 2-4 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Serve with desired dippers.
f3d6579000.pred: Mix all ingredients together and serve with crackers.

f537025690.gt:
Mix chili sauce, lime juice, fish sauce, and cilantro; set aside.
Divide shrimp into 4 equal portions.
Lay each portion of shrimp in a neat row with tails pointed in the same direction.
Thread 2 thin wood or metal skewers (8 to 10 inches long) about 1 1/2 inches apart through center of each row of shrimp, pushing the shellfish close together.
Place shrimp on an oiled grill above a solid bed of hot coals or high heat on a gas barbecue (you can hold your hand at grill level only 2 to 3 seconds); close lid on gas grill.
Cook, turning once, until shrimp are pink, 2 to 3 minutes a side.
Brush tops of shrimp with the chili sauce mixture, turn over, and cook just until glaze bubbles and browns slightly, about 30 seconds (watch closely; glaze burns easily).
Brush tops with more chili mixture, then turn glaze down and cook just until it darkens slightly, about 30 seconds more.
Transfer shrimp to plates or a platter.
Season to taste with remaining chili mixture and juice from lime wedges.
f537025690.pred:
Chop the shrimp into bite-sized pieces.
Combine the shrimp with the chili powder, garlic, and lime juice.
Thread the shrimp onto skewers.
Grill the skewers over medium heat until the shrimp are cooked through.

7a6c6f2959.gt:
Dressing:.
Place the almonds and water into a blender or food proccesor and turn on high speed to puree.
Add remaining ingredients, except for oil, and run to blend and whip thoroughly.
With the motor running, slowly pour in oil and run until the dressing is thick and creamy.
(dressing can be prepared and refrigerated for up to 1 week.
).
As stated in the description, you may use 3/4 cup oil and 1/4 cup water or apple juice(or liquid of choice) and get a little thinner dressing.
Let sit for a few minutes to thicken up.
Salad:.
Put 1/2 cup of the dressing in the bottom of your salad bowl.
Add all ingredients, except lettuce, and toss to coat.
Serve:.
Put several lettuce leaves on each plate and add dressed salad.
Serve extra dressing on the side.
Enjoy!
7a6c6f2959.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the spinach, broccoli, cauliflower, carrots, and red pepper.
In a small bowl, whisk together the almond butter, almond milk, honey, and lemon juice.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Spread the salad onto a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes.
Serve immediately.

c6b05c501b.gt:
Spread 1 bread slice with peanut butter, then spread other bread slice with jam; close to make sandwich.
Cook in skillet sprayed with cooking spray on medium heat 3 min.
on each side or until sandwich is golden brown on both sides.
Let stand 1 min.
; cut into quarters.
c6b05c501b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Spread 1 side of each slice of bread with butter.
Place 1 slice of bread, butter side up, on a cookie sheet.
Top with 1/2 cup of cherries.
Place another slice of bread, butter side down, on top of the cherries.
Top with 1/2 cup of chocolate chips.
Place another slice of bread, butter side up, on top of the chocolate chips.
Top with 1/2 cup of cherries.
Place another slice of bread, butter side down, on top of the cherries.
Top with 1/2 cup of chocolate chips.
Place in the oven and bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
Cut in half and serve.

1b81060720.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Partially bake the pie crust for 5 minutes according to package (or your recipe) instructions.
Whisk together the sugar, flour, salt and cocoa powder in medium mixing bowl.
Blend in melted butter.
Add the eggs and vanilla and stir until well blended.
Pour into the pie crust and bake 45 minutes.
The filling will be soft in the center but not runny; do not overbake, as it will set up some as it cools.
If crust gets too brown, cover with a pie shield or aluminum foil.
Allow to cool to room temperature (this allows the fudge to set up.)
I think it is best served warmed.
I micowave a slice for about 20 seconds on high.
Top with your choice of ice cream, fudge sauce, whipped cream, nuts and cherries.

83d2a64e21.gt:
Heat greased barbecue to medium heat.
Grill wings 7 to 8 min.
on each side or until done.
Meanwhile, mix Miracle Whip and Sriracha sauce in large bowl until blended.
Add wings to Miracle Whip mixture; toss to evenly coat.
Transfer to platter.
Sprinkle with onions.
83d2a64e21.pred:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a small bowl, combine Sriracha sauce, soy sauce, and garlic.
Season chicken wings with salt and pepper.
Place chicken wings in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Brush chicken with Sriracha mixture.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

05ef07d575.gt:
In small bowl, toss cheese and flour.
In small saucepan, heat buttermilk and cider.
Add cheese and caraway seeds.
Stir til melted.
Keep warm while serving.
Serve with chunks of rye bread for dipping.

1bf5668c79.gt:
Brown ground beef and onion powder in a large skillet over medium heat, drain off fat.
Mix together eggs, cream, mayonnaise, garlic powder, pepper and shredded cheddar cheese.
Put browned beef into a 9 inch pie plate, pour remaining ingredients over the beef.
Place in a preheated 350 degree oven and bake for 40-45 minutes.
1bf5668c79.pred:
1.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2.
In a large bowl, mix together the eggs, milk, cheese, onion, and salt and pepper to taste.
3.
Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch pie plate.
4.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until the quiche is set.
5.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes before serving.
6.
Serve with a side salad or sandwich.

f51e8fb184.gt:
Cook dry beans according to instructions on packet.
(No need with canned beans).
Saute onions until they are soft and clear.
Add tomato paste, coconutcream and seasonings, stirring over a gentle heat until they form a smooth and creamy sauce.
Drain beans and add to sauce.
Allow to simmer gently for 15 minutes or so, stirring from time to time.
Serve on brown or white rice accompanied by a salad.
f51e8fb184.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Wash beans and place in a large pot.
Add enough water to cover beans by 2 inches.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 1 hour.
Drain beans and place in a large bowl.
Add salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper to taste.
Mix well and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomatoes and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add beans and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Add 1/2 cup of water and cook until the liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Spread beans evenly in the dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes.
Serve with rice or bread.

08d0d4295c.gt:
Wash the sweet potato well and use a paper towel to dry.
Heat the oil.
Cut the parts of the potato that you are going to fry into long strips.
If you aren't going to be washing in water, you should fry it quickly or it'll change color.
Fry slowly at about 170C for a nice color.
Sandwich between paper towels to remove the oil, shake some salt over all of them.
Repeat steps 2 - 4.
08d0d4295c.pred:
Mix all ingredients together, except for the oil.
Pour oil into a deep fryer and heat to 350 degrees F.
Roll the potatoes in the mixture and drop them into the hot oil.
Fry until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Drain on paper towels and serve immediately.

874ce55813.gt:
Put all marinade ingrediantsin a large ziplock bag.
Mix well.
Add chicken breasts.
For a mild flavour, leave for 30 minutes.
For more intensity, leave up to 4 hours but no longer.
Heat up grill to medium high.
Cook breasts, with lid closed for about 7 (7 1/2) minutes per side.
874ce55813.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Marinate chicken pieces in the mixture for at least 1 hour.
Grill or bake chicken pieces until cooked through.

163b52a061.gt:
Cut broccoli and cauliflower into smaller pieces.
Heat water in a large wok to boiling and add broccoli and cauliflower.
Let sit for 2-3 minutes, then remove from wok, drain and rinse with cold water.
In same wok, heat 1-2 T oil on high.
Add ginger, garlic, carrot, and green onion.
Cook until garlic starts to turn brown.
Be careful not to overcook!
Add broccoli and cauliflower and stir.
Add sauce, stir, and let simmer for several minutes.
Serve immediately!
163b52a061.pred:
Broccoli, cauliflower, onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, olive oil, and salt.
Broccoli and Cauliflower Stir Fry:
Ingredients:
1. Broccoli and cauliflower florets (about 1 pound each)
2. Onions, finely chopped (about 1/2 cup)
3. Garlic, minced (about 1/4 cup)
4. Ginger, minced (about 1/4 cup)
5. Soy sauce (about 1/4 cup)
6. Olive oil (about 1/4 cup)
7. Salt (to taste)
Preparation:
1. Cut the broccoli and cauliflower into bite-sized pieces.
2. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
3. Add the onions, garlic, and ginger and cook until the onions are translucent, about 3 minutes.
4. Add the broccoli and cauliflower and cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender but still crisp, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the soy sauce and cook, stirring, until the liquid has evaporated and the vegetables are coated with a glaze, about 2 minutes.
6. Remove from the heat and season with salt to taste.
Serve immediately, or let cool and refrigerate for up to 2 days.

283c2400cb.gt:
Transfer cream to bowl of 5-quart electric stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment.
Tightly cover top of bowl and mixer with plastic wrap.
Beat cream at moderately high speed until it holds soft peaks, 10 to 12 minutes.
Increase speed to high and beat until mixture separates into thick, pale-yellow butter and thin, liquid buttermilk, about 5 minutes more.
Strain mixture through colander into large bowl.
Using hands, vigorously knead butter in colander, squeezing out remaining buttermilk, until dense and creamy, about 5 minutes.
Transfer butter to large bowl, reserving buttermilk.
Using hands, knead salt into butter.
Roll into logs and wrap in plastic wrap or transfer to airtight container and refrigerate.
(Butter will keep up to 1 week refrigerated or 1 month frozen.)
Strain buttermilk through fine-mesh sieve, then cover and refrigerate up to 1 week.
283c2400cb.pred:
Butter and buttermilk are two ingredients that are often used together in cooking.
Butter is a solid fat that is made from cream and is available in different grades.
Buttermilk is a liquid made from milk that has been soured with lactic acid.
A good way to make butter is to churn cream in a butter churn.
To make buttermilk, you can either buy it at the store or make it at home.
To make buttermilk at home, you can add a tablespoon of vinegar or lemon juice to a cup of milk and let it sit for 10 minutes.
Once the buttermilk is ready, you can add it to your favorite recipes.
A good way to use butter and buttermilk is to make a butter and buttermilk pancake or waffle batter.
You can also use them in soups, stews, and dressings.
In a butter and buttermilk dish, you can saute some vegetables in butter and then add buttermilk and seasonings.
You can also use butter and buttermilk in a sauce for chicken or fish.
In a butter and buttermilk biscuit, you can add butter and buttermilk to the dough and then bake.
In a butter and buttermilk cake, you can use buttermilk in the batter and then bake.
In a butter and buttermilk muffin, you can use buttermilk in the batter and then bake.
In a butter and buttermilk pudding, you can use buttermilk in the pudding and then bake.
In a butter and buttermilk pie, you can use buttermilk in the filling and then bake.
In a butter and buttermilk biscuit, you can use butter and buttermilk in the dough and then bake.
In a butter and buttermilk cake, you can use butter and buttermilk in the batter and then bake.
In a butter and buttermilk muffin, you can use butter and buttermilk in the batter

217d8f645b.gt:
Preheat oven to 375F degrees.
Put a sheet of tinfoil on a cookie sheet.
Spray cookie sheet with lite olive oil or other veggie oil.
In a small bowl combine; onion flakes,oregano, garlic, paprika, salt& pepper, mix well.
Brush cut sides of the potato wedges with olive oil and sprinkle with the spice mixture.
Place potato pieces cut side down on the prepared cookie sheet.
Bake until underside are golden brown, about 30 minutes.
Gently turn the wedges so the other side is on the cookie sheet.
Bake for another 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and golden.
Serve while they ar piping hot.
217d8f645b.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch thick slices.
Place potato slices on a baking sheet, and drizzle with olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until potatoes are crispy and golden brown.
Serve hot.

093fcaf5a6.gt:
Start by heating a medium-sized pot (you will cook everything in this pot) on medium heat, then add the oil.
Once oil comes to temperature, add cubed pork belly.
Cook pork belly, turning as it cooks, until all sides are browned.
Once pork is browned, add onions, garlic, and ginger.
Give a good stir, and continue to cook for about 3 minutes or so.
Add the shrimp paste.
Turn on your vent on high as this stuff has some funk (good funk), and continue to stir.
Toss in chilies, stir again, then add coconut milk.
Bring to a simmer and cook for about 1 hour, on low, stirring along the way.
Before serving, taste and season with salt or pepper.
Now you are ready to dig in.
I like to serve with a small bowl of rice to the side, along with a soup bowl of the Bicol Express.
This dish is rich, creamy, spicy, funky, and overall totally comforting and right up my alley.
093fcaf5a6.pred:
1.
In a large skillet, heat oil and saute onion, garlic, and ginger.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Add the tomato sauce, coconut milk, and seasonings.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the eggplant, bamboo shoots, and green beans.
Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the shrimp and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve over steamed rice.

5765949efb.gt:
Combine sugar, pecans and orange peel in small bowl.
Melt butter in small bowl in microwave.
Cut cream cheese into 20 pieces the size of butter pat.
Seperate each biscuit in half part way and place cream cheese piece in and pinch edges back together.
Do all 20 biscuits.
Then dip in melted butter and dredge in sugar, pecan mixture.
Stand upright in lightly greased 12 cup bundt pan, space evenly.
Drizzle any remaining butter over and sprinkle with any remaining sugar,pecan mixture.
Bake at 350-375F for 45 minutes or until golden brown.
Immediately invert onto plate.
Combine powdered sugar, cinnamon and water, stir well.
Drizzle over hot bread.
Serve warm.
5765949efb.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut orange in half and squeeze juice into a small bowl.
Mix in sugar and set aside.
Cut bread into 1/2 inch cubes.
Mix bread cubes with orange juice mixture.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm.

5bcb6c7ba1.gt:
Heat oven to 350F (325F for dark or nonstick pans).
Place paper baking cup in each of 24 regular-size muffin cups.
In small bowl, mix 1 1/2 cups pretzel, 2 T sugar and 1/4 cup melted butter or margarine until blended.
Spoon about 1 tablespoon mixture in each cup.
3In large bowl, beat cake mix, margarita mix, water, oil, egg whites and 3 tsp zest with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds, then on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally.
Divide batter evenly among cups (two-thirds full).
Bake 18 to 23 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan to cooling rack.
Cool completely.
In medium bowl, fold whipped topping, yogurt and 2 tsp lime zest until blended; add food coloring if desired and frost cupcakes.
Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup coarsely crushed pretzels.
Store loosely covered in refrigerator.
5bcb6c7ba1.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together the cake mix, margarita mix, and water until well combined.
Pour the batter into cupcake liners, filling them about 2/3 full.
Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cupcake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool completely.
Once cooled, frost the cupcakes with a layer of margarita frosting.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream and a slice of lime.
Serve and enjoy!

9c5602c4ae.gt:
In large bowl, combine first 6 ingredients.
Mix next 3 ingredients; mix well.
Pour over salad and toss well.
Chill.
9c5602c4ae.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Cut broccoli into small florets.
Cut cauliflower into small florets.
Rinse and drain.
Place florets in a large bowl.
Add olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Toss to coat.
Spread florets on a baking sheet and roast for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
When cool enough to handle, add florets to the bowl.
Add remaining ingredients and toss to combine.
Serve immediately or chill for up to 24 hours.

0ddb710349.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
In a small bowl, beat egg with milk.
In a shallow plate or bowl, mix bread crumbs with Italian seasonings.
Dip each piece of chicken into the egg/milk mixture, then into the bread crumb mixture to coat thoroughly.
Place coated chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, depending on how thick the chicken breasts are (bake until chicken is done and juices run clear).
In the last 3 to 4 minutes of baking, sprinkle the top of the chicken pieces with cheese.
Remove from oven and serve!
0ddb710349.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the chicken breasts, cheese, bread crumbs, and seasonings.
Mix well to coat the chicken.
Place the chicken in a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
Serve with a side of your favorite dipping sauce.

b4fd5e004b.gt:
Drain the yogurt to 1 1/2 cups: Line a strainer w/a coffee filter, add yogurt & set aside about 1 hour.
Cut off all but 1 inch of the beet stalks and leave the roots intact.
Rinse the beets well but do not peel.
Cook the beets in boiling salted water until tender, 25 to 35 minutes.
Drain, slip off the skins under cold running water, and cut away the root ends and stalks.
Coarsely grate the beets, using the shredding disk of a food processor or the large holes of a hand grater (latex gloves are recommended for the latter or you'll look like an axe murderer!
).
Combine the garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a medium bowl.
Add the beets and yogurt and blend well.
Taste and add a pinch of sugar if desired.
Transfer to a serving dish, cover and refrigerate until well chilled, about 1 hour.
Garnish with sprigs of fresh mint just before serving.
b4fd5e004b.pred:
Shredded beets, thick yogurt, garlic, salt, pepper, olive oil, and lemon juice.
In a large bowl, combine the shredded beets, yogurt, garlic, salt, pepper and olive oil.
Mix well and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Just before serving, add a squeeze of lemon juice and serve.

9efd6dc9bd.gt:
Preheat broiler.Combine minced garlic, olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and asparagus in a large bowl, tossing gently to coat.Combine 1/4 teaspoon salt, pepper, brandy, and garlic powder; rub evenly over steaks.
Place steaks on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray; broil 6 minutes.
Turn steaks over; add asparagus to pan.
Broil 5 minutes or until desired degree of doneness.
9efd6dc9bd.pred:
Spice blend, pepper, filet mignon, asparagus, and oil.
Spice blend:
Combine all ingredients and store in an airtight container.
Pepper:
Crush 1/2 teaspoon of peppercorns in a mortar and pestle or with a rolling pin.
Filet Mignon:
Thinly slice the filet mignon and season with salt and pepper.
Asparagus:
Trim the asparagus and cut into 2-inch pieces.
Oil:
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the filet mignon and cook for 3 minutes on each side, or until medium-rare.
Remove from the skillet and set aside.
Add the asparagus to the skillet and cook for 2 minutes, or until tender.
Add the peppercorns and 1/4 teaspoon of the spice blend to the skillet.
Stir and cook for 1 minute.
Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil and stir until the spices are fragrant.
Return the filet mignon to the skillet and cook for 1 minute, or until heated through.
Serve immediately.

fba1dcbbd2.gt:
Sift dry ingredients.
Cut in 1/4 cup of butter.
Add the cream.
Roll out on a floured board.
Cut with a 2-inch cutter.
Bake on an ungreased pan in a hot oven of 400F (200C) for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve with butter, whipped cream, and jam if desired.
fba1dcbbd2.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in milk and egg until dough comes together.
Turn dough onto a floured surface and knead until smooth.
Roll dough out to 1/2 inch thickness.
Cut dough into 3 inch rounds.
Place rounds on a greased baking sheet.
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden brown.

8121dfc152.gt:
Cut herring into small cubes.
Mix herring with onion, eggs, apple and lemon juice.
Combine sour cream, garlic, salt and pepper; add to herring mixture and mix well.
Sprinkle with dill or parsley.
Serve with rye bread.

a67add462f.gt:
Place diced carrots, onion, peppers, and garlic (not the peas yet) in a kettle with a small amount of water and curry powder.
Simmer about 5 minutes until tender.
Add zucchini, cover, and simmer 5 more minutes.
Blend all the remaining ingredients, except the peas and garboanzos or lentils, in a blender until smooth.
Add the blended ingredients, the peas, and the garbanzos or lentils to the rest of the vegetables.
Heat and serve over rice.
a67add462f.pred:
Place a large pot over medium heat.
Add the oil and saute the onion, garlic, and ginger until the onion is translucent.
Add the curry paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the coconut milk and water, and bring to a boil.
Add the chicken, potatoes, carrots, and green beans.
Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the fish sauce, sugar, and lime juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve over rice.

5c9b0f1426.gt:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
Rinse asparagus and snap off the tough ends.
Spray a cookie sheet and lay asparagus on it then sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Cook in a preheated oven for 8-10 minutes.
Sprinkle the blue cheese and walnuts on HOT asparagus.
Return the asparagus to the oven for an additional 1-2 minutes.
5c9b0f1426.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Wash and trim asparagus.
Cut asparagus into 1-inch pieces.
Toss asparagus with olive oil, salt and pepper.
Spread asparagus on a baking sheet.
Roast asparagus for 15 minutes, or until tender.
Serve hot.

82cd89c4d9.gt:
To steam the chicken tenders: Arrange the chicken on a plate and sprinkle on the ingredients marked with in order.
Place the rosemary (or other herb) on top, wrap it with plastic wrap and cook it at 700W for 1 minute and 30 seconds.
Turn the chicken over and cook it for another 1 minute.
The cooking time depends on the size of the chicken.
Check the chicken when you turn it over, and adjust the cooking time if necessary.
Leave the chicken, with the plastic on, until they are cool.
Shred the chicken from Step 2 with your hand.
Onions: Thinly slice the onion and soak it in water for about 10 minutes.
Drain in a colander and pat dry with paper towels.
Daikon sprout: Cut in half lengths.
In a bowl, mix the ingredients marked with to make the dressing.
Mix the chicken from Step 3 and onion from Step 4 with the dressing.
Add the daikon sprout and toss them evenly.
Serve it on a plate and garnish with the bonito flakes.
I used Cinzano Dry Vermouth; a blend of white wine with essences of herbs and spices, instead of white wine.
This flavorful drink is good for cooking and drinking.
82cd89c4d9.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Microwave the chicken tenders for 2 minutes.
Steam the daikon sprouts for 1 minute.
Serve immediately.

495600903f.gt:
Heat oven to 300 degrees F.
Place 2-L casserole dish in oven to warm.
Melt butter in large skillet on medium heat.
Add onions and garlic; cook 2 to 3 min.
or until crisp-tender, stirring frequently.
Add rice; cook and stir 2 min.
Stir in wine; cook and stir 1 min.
or until absorbed.
Add chicken and broth; stir.
Bring just to boil.
Spoon into warmed casserole dish; cover.
Bake 30 min.
or until rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.
Add spinach; stir just until wilted.
Add cheese; stir until melted.
495600903f.pred:
Chicken, spinach, and risotto.
Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Wash spinach and dry thoroughly.
Cook risotto according to package directions.
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place chicken in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
While chicken is cooking, saute spinach in a little olive oil until wilted.
When chicken is done, remove from oven and set aside to cool.
When cool enough to handle, shred chicken into bite-sized pieces.
While risotto is cooking, saute spinach in a little olive oil until wilted.
When risotto is done, add chicken and spinach to the risotto and stir to combine.
Serve immediately.

915df993a5.gt:
put it all in the pan on high stir as needed
cook until tender and dark carmalization is apparent
915df993a5.pred:
Slice squash in half lengthwise.
Scoop out the seeds and pulp.
Place squash halves cut side down on a baking sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Scoop out the flesh and place in a bowl.
Mash with a fork.
Add salt, pepper, and butter.
Mix well.
Serve.

4f38968f4b.gt:
In a large bowl, using a fork, mix the Gorgonzola with the yogurt, olive oil, vinegar, shallot, lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Fold in the chicken and celery and season with salt and pepper.
To serve, fill the baguette with the chicken salad, snap peas, radishes and lettuce, then cut the baguette crosswise into 4 sandwiches.

31f21b4147.gt:
In a large saucepan, mix all ingredients together.
On medium heat, bring mixture to a boil.
Continue to simmer (on low-medium) heat for one hour, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and allow to cool.
Pour into mason jars and refrigerate for 12-24 hours before serving.
Enjoy cold!
31f21b4147.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut pumpkin into 1/2-inch slices.
Place pumpkin slices on a baking sheet.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Mix pumpkin butter and milk.
Spread pumpkin butter mixture over pumpkin slices.
Sprinkle with additional cinnamon and sugar.
Bake for 10 minutes.

063b119d92.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees .
Cook the broccoli until tender-crisp; drain very well.
Put in a greased 2-quart casserole.
Mix in the cream cheese, cheddar, green onion, salt, pepper and bacon.
Bake for 20-30 minutes, until bubbly.
063b119d92.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine broccoli florets, cheddar cheese, and cream cheese.
Mix well.
Spread into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with bacon.
Bake until bacon is crispy, about 15 minutes.

0ce043fd75.gt:
in small dry skittle, toast pine nuts over med heat, shaking pan often until light golden 3-5 minutes, transfer to food processor and let cool.
in heatproof bowl, cover tomatoes with 1/2 cup boiling water, soak until softened, about 10 minutes.
drain, reserving 2 tablespoons soaking liquid.
add tomatoes and reserved liquid to food processor.
add tomato paste, pepper and salt, finely chop, with motor running add oil in thin steady stream until pureed.
pulse in Parmesan cheese and garlic.
To Make again:.
Refrigerate in air tight container for up to 5 days, or freeze for up to 6 months.
0ce043fd75.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a food processor, combine 1 cup of sun-dried tomatoes, 1/2 cup of pine nuts, 1/4 cup of Parmesan cheese, 1/4 cup of basil, 1/4 cup of olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper.
Process until smooth.
Spread the pesto on 4 slices of bread.
Place the bread slices on a baking sheet and bake in the oven for 10 minutes.
Serve with a salad or as a sandwich.

09c7610724.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with Reynolds Parchment Paper and set aside.
Whisk together flour, kosher salt, baking powder and baking soda; set aside.
Mix butter, light brown sugar and granulated sugar together with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs, one at a time.
Add vanilla and beat.
Slowly add flour mixture, mixing gently until incorporated.
Fold in caramel filled chocolate candies and chocolate chips.
Roll 2 tablespoons of dough into a ball, covering any candies with dough so they are not exposed.
Place dough balls on parchment lined baking sheets.
Bake cookies for 1012 minutes.
Cool cookies on baking sheet for 5 minutes and transfer parchment paper with cookies onto wire racks to cool completely.
Drizzle cooled cookies with melted chocolate and sprinkle with sea salt.
Chill cookies until chocolate sets.
09c7610724.pred:
In a large bowl, mix together the butter, sugar, brown sugar, and eggs.
Add the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Mix well.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack.
Mix together the salted caramel sauce and cream.
Drizzle over the cookies.
Store in an airtight container.

b9e5fe6154.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
In small bowl, gently stir blue cheese crumbles into mashed potatoes.
Fill each pepper half with potato mixture.
Wrap each with a slice of cooked bacon and place onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.
Pop into oven and bake for 5-8 minutes until bacon crisps.
Watch so that the filling doesn't ooze out.
Remove to appetizers plates and serve with sriracha sauce for dipping.
*My recipe title has less than 64 characters, but for some reason it cut off the required hashtag #SP5.
b9e5fe6154.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut potatoes into 1/4-inch slices.
Mix together cheese, chives, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Dip potato slices in beaten egg, then roll in cheese mixture.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes.
Serve warm.

8220c924d4.gt:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain.
While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Cook onion just until softened, about 3 minutes.
Stir in the curry powder and garam masala.
Stir in the pumpkin.
Slowly pour in the chicken broth and heavy cream.
Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until thickened slightly, 3 5 minutes.
Add pasta to the sauce and toss to coat.
Stir in salt.
Add more if desired.
Transfer pasta to a serving dish, sprinkle with green onions and serve.
8220c924d4.pred:
Pumpkin, curry, and pasta.
Pumpkin Curry Penne:
Ingredients:
1 can of pumpkin
1/2 cup curry powder
1/2 cup coconut milk
1/2 cup water
1/2 cup pasta
1/2 cup pumpkin seeds
1/2 cup chopped onion
1/2 cup chopped celery
1/2 cup chopped carrots
1/2 cup chopped tomatoes
1/2 cup pumpkin puree
1/2 cup coconut oil
Salt and pepper to taste
Heat coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion, celery, carrots, and tomatoes and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add curry powder, pumpkin, pumpkin seeds, coconut milk, water, and salt and pepper to taste.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain pasta and add to curry mixture.
Toss until pasta is coated with the curry sauce.
Serve hot.

78d578c5e4.gt:
heat oven to 400, using a oven safe bowl, it can be a casserole dish to bake ur dip in.
it just needs to bake for 13 minutes
in a bowl put all ingredients, except 1 tablespoon of almonds, reserved till later.
mix well together, put in oven safe dish.
now sprinkle the reserved almonds on top.bake and use crackers to serve.enjoy
78d578c5e4.pred:
Combine the lobster meat with the cream cheese, onion, bell pepper, jalapeno, and cilantro.
Mix well.
Add the spices and salt.
Chill for 1 hour.
Serve with tortilla chips.

38b480c606.gt:
Make the cake mix as directed
Make cookie mix as directed
Pour some cake mix in cake pan.
About an inch
Place as many cooked cookies as you can in the middle
Pour remaining cake mix and bake as directed
Eat and be Fat & Happy

f15f7c9832.gt:
Cut the chicken into thin diagonal slices, then into 1 cm strips.
Finely julienne the peppers.
Rub the shio-koji into the chicken.
Add the ingredients and rub to flavor the chicken.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Spread the chicken and cook over high heat until the edges turn white.
Flip over, and brown both sides.
Add the peppers and shio-konbu and stir fry quickly.
Swirl in the sake and it's done!
f15f7c9832.pred:
Stir fry chicken breast, shio-koji, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and sesame oil.
Add the chicken breast to a hot pan and cook until browned.
Add the shio-koji and soy sauce and stir fry until the chicken is cooked through.
Add the garlic and ginger and stir fry until fragrant.
Finally, add the sesame oil and stir fry until the chicken is coated with the oil.

57f1deb064.gt:
Heat oven to 400F.
In a large bowl, combine the mustard, vinegar, 2 tablespoons of the oil, the garlic, tarragon, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Add the chicken and toss to coat.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast until cooked through, about 45 minutes.
During the last 15 minutes of roasting, cook the noodles according to the package directions.
Drain and return to the pot.
Add the parsley and the remaining oil and toss to coat.
Transfer the chicken to individual plates.
Place the pan containing the drippings over medium-high heat.
Add the wine and cook, stirring and scraping the bits from the bottom of the pan, until the wine reduces slightly, about 5 minutes.
Divide the noodles among the plates and spoon the sauce over the top.
57f1deb064.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut chicken into 8 pieces.
Season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, combine mustard, tarragon, and 1/2 cup of the chicken broth.
Pour over chicken and toss to coat.
Place chicken in a roasting pan.
Roast for 1 hour, or until juices run clear.
Meanwhile, cook egg noodles according to package directions.
Drain noodles and toss with 1/4 cup of the chicken broth.
Serve noodles with chicken.

0f717fcce7.gt:
Bring a pot of water to the boil, add the oranges, cover and simmer for one hour.
Stain off the water.
Cool the oranges.
If you are in a hurry, I suggest you partly cool them -- (this will still work).
While they are cooling, food process the sugar with the eggs until the sugar is dissolved and pour into a bowl.
Cut the oranges in half and de-seed them and put the oranges (with peel and pith) into a food processor and pulp until reasonably smooth.
Pour the pulp into the sugar/egg mix and add the almond meal.
Gently mix together.
Pour mix into baking paper lined 24 - 26cm springform tin and bake for 50 - 60 minutes at 185C.
Serve with creme fraiche, whipped cream, or vanilla ice-cream -- makes an awesome dessert.
You could drizzle a little citrus liqueur around the plate.
Added thoughts -- This cake DOES NOT need any syrup poured over it.
NB.Simply double this recipe to get two large cakes.
It is just as successful.
Occasionally, I will add a slurp of Grand Marnier, Contreau, or Galliano; however, try it plain initially.
0f717fcce7.pred:
Preheat oven to 350F.
In a large bowl, mix together almond flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, orange juice, and orange zest.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Pour batter into a greased 9x9 baking pan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Allow cake to cool completely before frosting.
For the frosting: In a medium bowl, whisk together almond butter, orange juice, and orange zest.
Spread frosting over the cooled cake.
Garnish with orange slices and almonds.

62bf8025cc.gt:
Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium high heat.
Add the onion and saute for three minutes, then add the garlic.
Continue cooking until the onions are soft, 1-2 minutes more.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Add the jalapenos and carrots and cook for 5 minutes, until slightly softened.
Add the cider vinegar, 1 tbsp pickling salt, oregano and bay leaves and simmer for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and allow to cool completely.
Transfer the jalapenos, carrots and onions with slotted spoon or tongs into sterilized glass quart-sized jars.
Throw away the bay leaves.
Cover the vegetables with the cooking liquid until the jars are three-quarters full.
Add 1 tbsp pickling salt to each jar and fill to the top with white vinegar.
Cap each jar tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to several months.
The pickled vegetables can be used starting one week later.
62bf8025cc.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Remove from refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place a rack in the middle of the oven.
In a large roasting pan, place the chicken and cover with foil.
Roast for 1 hour.
Remove foil and continue roasting until the chicken is cooked through, about 15 minutes more.
Remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes.
Cut into pieces and serve.

3af2ae11f5.gt:
Combine salt, pepper, chili powder and bay leaves.
Rub meat completely with liquid Smoke.
Place meat, fat side up, in a large roasting pan.
Sprinkle dry seasoning mixture on top.
Cover tightly.
Bake for 3 1/2 to 4 hours at 325 degrees.
Scrape seasoning off meat and cut in very thin slices across the grain.
Serve with barbecue sauce.
To make sauce, combine all ingredients.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Cook for 10 minutes.
Serve with sliced brisket.
3af2ae11f5.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place brisket in a roasting pan and season with salt and pepper.
Cover with foil and place in oven.
Cook for 3 hours.
Remove foil and cook for 1 hour more.
Remove brisket from oven and let rest for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, make barbecue sauce.
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and simmer over medium heat until thickened.
Cut brisket into slices and serve with barbecue sauce.

db5fd3bd93.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 F.
In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the bacon until almost cooked, but not too crisp.
Remove bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon and place it in a large bowl.
Drain all but about 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease from the skillet and discard it or use it for another purpose.
Add the onion and green pepper into the skillet, if using.
Saute for a few minutes to soften.
Add them into the large bowl with the bacon.
Into the large bowl add the undrained pork and beans, the 2 cans of rinsed and drained beans and the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish.
Cover the dish with a sheet of foil and bake at 325 F for 45 minutes.
Uncover and continue baking for 20-25 more minutes.
Cooks Notes: Sometime I will add a chipotle chile with a little of the adobo sauce that has been finely diced.
You know I cant get enough of those!
It is also delicious to turn them into cowboy beans (what Nanny called them) and add cooked ground beef or sausage.
db5fd3bd93.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large saucepan, combine the beans, onion, garlic, bacon, and 1/2 cup of water.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour.
Stir in the tomato sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, and chili powder.
Simmer for 15 minutes.
Transfer the beans to a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup of water and bake for 10 minutes more.
Serve hot.

85b79cc54f.gt:
In a large skillet over medium heat, add meatless ground burger, water and spices.
Mix well and let simmer for 10-15 minutes until heated through and water is absorbed.
Use this mixture to replace the seasoned ground beef in any of your favorite Mexican recipes!
Another note* One can use 1 cup of TVP in place of the soy crumbles or Boca.
You might need a bit more that 1 cup of water to keep mixture from getting too dry.
85b79cc54f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients and mix well.
Spread mixture onto a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes.
Serve with taco shells and your favorite toppings.

1432c540ac.gt:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. In a bowl, whisk the canola oil, vinegar, miso, ginger, sesame oil, honey, lime zest, and lime juice until smooth.
Season with salt.
On a rimmed baking sheet, toss the tomatoes with 3 tablespoons of the miso dressing and season with salt.
Roast for 20 minutes, stirring, until the tomatoes are charred in spots.
Scrape into a large bowl.
Cook the soba noodles in boiling water just until al dente, 4 minutes.
Drain and cool the noodles under cold running water.
Add the soba noodles, scallions, and half of the remaining dressing to the tomatoes and toss well.
Season with salt, transfer to a platter, and garnish with the sesame seeds.
Serve with the remaining dressing.Looking for vegetable recipes?
Try our best asparagus recipes, eggplant recipes, or zucchini recipes.

44b3907e95.gt:
Combine all the cupcake ingredients in a bowl and mix until smooth.
If you want them to be more pink, add a bit of red food coloring.
Fill lined cupcake tin 2/3 of the way full.
Bake cupcakes at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes.
Combine Frosting ingredients and beat until smooth.
When cupcakes are cooled, topped with frosting.
Top them off with a maraschino cherry.
44b3907e95.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix together the cake mix, pink food coloring, and water.
Pour into cupcake liners and bake for 15-20 minutes.
Remove from oven and allow to cool.
Once cooled, frost with pink frosting.
Decorate with pink sprinkles.

72d89ed4de.gt:
Place all of the ingredients in a medium bowl; stir until they are combined, and transfer to an airtight container for storage.
Season popcorn to taste.
72d89ed4de.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup of kernels and 1/2 cup of oil.
Spread popcorn in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes, shaking pan occasionally.
Remove from oven and set aside to cool.
In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup of kernels, 1/2 cup of oil, 1/4 cup of brown sugar, 1/4 cup of salt, and 1/4 cup of butter.
Stir until well blended.
Spread popcorn on a baking sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes, shaking pan occasionally.
Remove from oven and set aside to cool.
Store in an airtight container.

856a830dc7.gt:
Soak cucumber in cold salted (1 tsp) water for 5 minutes.
Drain and squeeze well.
Bring the water to a boil, add beanstarch vermicelli and cook according to the directions on the package.
Cut into bite sized pieces.
Mix all ingredients and marinate.
856a830dc7.pred:
Marinated Vermicelli: vermicelli noodles, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, green onions, cilantro, lime juice, and peanuts.
