8198c69331.gt:
Place all ingredients in your bread machine in the order given.
Set bread machine to dough cycle.
IMPORTANT!
CHECK YOUR MACHINE WHILE IT IS KNEADING and ADD MORE WATER IF NEEDED 1 TABLESPOON AT A TIME.
The dough should not be too dry - it should look smooth and satiny after kneading for a few minutes.
When dough cycle is complete, remove dough from machine and shape into long loaf (like french bread).
Place on a cookie sheet and let loaf rise for about 45 minutes or until doubled in size.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until nicely browned.
You can also just cook this in your bread machine on the regular bread cycle if you want.
It still tastes great, you just don't get the cuban shaped loaf.
8198c69331.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the following ingredients:
1 cup warm water
1 tsp. active dry yeast
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup salt
1/2 cup vegetable oil
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 1/2 cups whole wheat flour
2 tsp. baking soda
1/2 tsp. baking powder
1/2 tsp. cinnamon
1/2 tsp. nutmeg
1/2 tsp. cloves
1/2 tsp. black pepper
1 egg
2 cups cubed bread machine dough
1/2 cup raisins
1/2 cup chopped nuts
In a small bowl, combine the yeast, sugar, and 1/4 cup warm water.
Let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes.
Add the remaining ingredients to the large bowl and mix well.
Knead the dough on a floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
Place in a greased bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and divide into 2 equal portions.
Shape each portion into a ball and place in a greased 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Cover with plastic wrap and let rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Bake the loaves for 30 minutes, or until golden brown.
Cool on a wire rack.
Makes 2 loaves.

96a66bd364.gt:
Whisk the milk and oil together.
(The key to making this good and not tasting like oil is using a little less oil and a little more milk.)
Add flour, salt, and sugar.
Press on bottom of pie plate.
With a fork, poke holes in bottom and sides of crust.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
So easy and so good.
See Amazing Blueberry Cream Cheese Pie for ideas on what to make this with.
96a66bd364.pred:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, and salt.
Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add 1/4 cup ice water and stir until dough just comes together.
Gather dough into a ball, flatten into a disk, and wrap in plastic wrap.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface to a 12-inch circle.
Fit dough into a 9-inch pie pan.
Trim excess dough and crimp edges.
Prick bottom and sides of crust with a fork.
Bake for 10 minutes, then reduce heat to 375 degrees F and bake for an additional 20 minutes, or until crust is golden brown.
Remove from oven and cool completely.
In a large bowl, combine eggs, sugar, flour, and salt.
Add in cream and mix until smooth.
Pour into cooled pie crust.
Bake at 375 degrees F for 35-40 minutes, or until filling is set.
Cool completely before serving.

6a6db8c9e3.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
Add the water and mix until a soft dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and divide into 12 equal pieces.

8590091d29.gt:
Lightly oil grill and preheat to high.
Loosen skin on chicken pieces with fingers, by sliding hand between skin and flesh.
In a small skillet, saute green onion and 2 cloves garlic in butter or margarine for 1 minute.
Stir in breadcrumbs and parsley.
Push this seasoning under chicken skins, working it down well.
Combine 1 cup butter or margarine with mustard, 1 clove garlic and curry powder.
Spread this seasoned butter or margarine over chicken and put on preheated grill.
Cook 10 to 15 minutes each side, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.
Brush with remaining seasoned butter while grilling.
8590091d29.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together the chicken pieces, parsley, garlic, onion, salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Set aside.
In a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the parsley, chives, and tarragon.
Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and add the chicken mixture.
Toss to coat the chicken pieces evenly.
Place the chicken in a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and serve.

baa571bacd.gt:
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400F.
Drain 1 can tomatoes, reserving juice, then break up tomatoes into 1/2-inch pieces with a spoon if necessary; puree the second can of tomatoes,including juice and reserved juice (from other can), 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon allspice in a blender OR use hand blender, until smooth.
Transfer tomato puree to a 2-quart heavy saucepan and boil uncovered, stirring occasionally, until reduced to about 1/2 cup, about 20 minutes, remove from heat.
Heat a dry 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot, then brown lamb with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon allspice, stirring and breaking up lumps (but leaving meat slightly chunky), about 5 minutes; add drained tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until juices are absorbed, about 1 minute.
Cut polenta into 1/4-inch-thick slices with a sharp knife and cover bottom of a 9-inch glass pie plate with half of polenta slices (overlapping slightly); scatter half of lamb mixture over polenta, then top with half of mozzarella, then remaining polenta; scatter remaining lamb on top and spread tomato sauce over meat, then top with remaining mozzarella.
Bake, uncovered, until bubbling and beginning to brown, about 20 minutes; let stand, loosely covered with foil, 15 minutes before serving, Enjoy.
baa571bacd.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the lamb, eggplant, zucchini, onion, garlic, tomato sauce, and 1 cup of water.
Let sit for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
Add the polenta and cook, stirring constantly, until golden brown.
Remove from heat and stir in the cheese.
Spread 1/3 of the polenta mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
Layer 1/3 of the lamb mixture on top of the polenta.
Repeat with another 1/3 of the polenta and 1/3 of the lamb mixture.
Top with the remaining 1/3 of the polenta.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

b5c909ba3f.gt:
Heat grill.
Slice onion into slightly larger than 1/4-inch slices and brush both sides of each slice with olive oil.
Place onion on grill and cook 4-5 minutes per side or until brown and tender.
Let onion cool and then chop.
Place potatoes into boiling salted water for about 20-25 minutes or until just tender; drain.
When cool enough to handle, peeled and cut into 3/4 inch pieces.
In a large bowl, stir milk and vinegar together and let sit 1-2 minutes to thicken.
Whisk in mayo, salt and pepper.
Stir in onions.
Add potatoes to bowl, stir and then add celery.
Stir gently.
Cover and refrigerate for several hours before serving.
b5c909ba3f.pred:
Put the onions in a bowl of cold water and let them soak for 1 hour.
Drain the onions and pat dry with paper towels.
Peel the potatoes and cut them into 1/2-inch cubes.
Place the potatoes in a large bowl and toss with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and 1 teaspoon of salt.
Spread the potatoes out on a baking sheet and roast in a 400 degree oven for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool.
When cool enough to handle, cut the potatoes into 1/2-inch pieces.
Add the onions to the bowl with the potatoes and toss to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, 1/4 teaspoon of pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper.
Add the dressing to the onion and potato mixture and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

6cb33feaa0.gt:
Preheat oven to 375F Lightly grease cookie sheets.
Combine dry ingredients.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugars together.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time.
Stir in the vanilla.
Stir in the dry ingredients until well mixed, then stir in the chocolate chips, coconut and almonds.
Drop by rounded tablespoons onto the prepared cookie sheets.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
6cb33feaa0.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture, mixing well.
Stir in chocolate chips and almonds.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

ed047c7fd8.gt:
Add the milk, and small pieces of torn up cheese into a small saucepan.
Heat it up over medium-low heat until right before it starts to boil.
When the cheese has melted, mix well with a wooden spatula.
Let the mixture cool down.
Separate the egg yolks and egg whites.
Add the egg whites, 1/2 of the sugar into a bowl, and whip into a firm meringue.
Add the egg yolks and the remaining sugar into a separate bowl, and mix with a whisk.
Add the Step 1 mixture, and mix well.
Sift the cake flour into the Step 4 bowl, and mix well with the whisk.
Add the lemon juice as well, and mix well.
Add 1/3 of the Step 3 meringue into the Step 5 bowl, and mix well with the whisk.
Add the remaining meringue, and mix well with a spatula.
Pour the batter into a cake pan lined with parchment paper.
Place it in a baking sheet filled with hot water in the preheated oven, and bake for about 50 minutes at 160C.
Cover with aluminium foil halfway through so that it won't get burned.
If you don't mix the mixture really well during Step 6, it will separate into 2 layers, so please be careful.
If you are using a cake pan with removable bottom, the hot water will come into the pan while steam-baking in a water bath during Step 8, so please cover the bottom with aluminium foil and bake.
ed047c7fd8.pred:
Put the cheese in a bowl and mix with the eggs.
Add the sugar and mix well.
Add the flour and mix.
Add the milk and mix.
Pour into a greased cake pan and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
When done, remove from the oven and let cool.
Serve with a dollop of whipped cream.

0f248f2042.gt:
In a large frying/saute pan add oil, butter and garlic, saute on low flame until oil starts to bubble.
Add tomatoes, salt and pepper.
Cook covered on a low flame for about 30 minutes.
Add vodka.
Cook uncovered for 25 minutes.
Add prosciutto-- cook 5 more minutes.
Add basil and heavy cream-- cook just 5 more minutes.
SERVE IT NOW!
I like this over penne pasta.
I only use Barilla.
0f248f2042.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large saucepan, saute onions and garlic in olive oil until soft.
Add in tomatoes, tomato paste, and seasonings.
Simmer for 15 minutes.
Add in vodka and simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in cream and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add in prosciutto and simmer for 2 minutes.
Pour sauce into a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve over pasta.

3c84706338.gt:
Preheat oven to 400?.
Spray a 2 qt casserole dish, or 9x9 baking pan with non-stick cooking spray.
In this order, layer the chicken, broccoli, 1 1/2 cups cheddar cheese and 2/3 of the bacon-bits in prepared baking dish.
Reserve the remaining cheese and bacon for topping.
Blend the eggs, milk, Bisquik, and 1/8 tsp.
fresh ground pepper until well combined.
Pour evenly over chicken mixture.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Sprinkle remaining cheese and bacon evenly on top.
Let cool 5 minutes before serving.
3c84706338.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, cook chicken until no longer pink.
Drain and set aside.
In the same skillet, saute broccoli in butter until tender.
In a bowl, mix together bacon, cheddar cheese, and soup.
Spread half of the chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Top with half of the broccoli and half of the cheese mixture.
Repeat layers.
Bake for 30 minutes.

022318dd52.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Spray a large casserole dish with cooking spray.
(I have a 4 quart casserole dish I use for this.)
In a large skillet, brown together ground beef and onion; drain grease and return to pan.
Add tomato sauce, mushroom soup, 1/2 cup of the cheese, salt, pepper, and garlic.
Simmer uncovered.
While meat mixture is simmering, cook the pasta according to package directions.
Combine the pasta and the meat mixture together in the casserole dish; mix well.
Sprinkle remaining cheese on top.
Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.
022318dd52.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup of milk, 1/2 cup of water, 1/2 cup of grated cheese, 1/2 cup of chopped seafood, and 1/2 cup of chopped vegetables.
Pour into a 9x13 baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve with crusty bread.

565fbfd08a.gt:
NB: I like to use a fairly strong flavoured, but creamy blue cheese, like Gorgonzola, but Stilton is also nice.
Stock-wise, you may need a little more or less than in the ingredients list.
Bring stock up to a simmer.
Halve the leeks and remove any gritty bits from inside the rings.
Cut the leek into fine strips rather than semi-circles, of approx 1-2 inches in length.
Melt half the butter with the olive oil and cook the leeks for approx 10 minutes over a low-medium heat until soft and tinged with brown.
Add bacon to pan and cook for about 5 minutes.
Stir in garlic and rice, cook for a further minute or two, stirring the rice until it's coated in the butter and oil and starts to go slightly translucent.
Add the wine to the pan, turning up the heat to bubble most of it away.
Add a ladleful of hot stock to the leek and rice mixture at a time, stirring more or less constantly.
Add more stock each time that most of the liquid has been absorbed.
Add the fresh sage.
Keep doing this for approximately 15 - 25 minutes, until the risotto is creamy, but the rice grains still have a slight bite.
You'll need to start testing the rice after about 15 minutes, but it may take a little longer.
Turn off the heat.
Stir in the lemon juice, zest, remaining butter, parmesan and blue cheese.
Leave the risotto for another 2 minutes until rich, creamy and luscious.
Season to taste with black pepper and salt if needed.
565fbfd08a.pred:
Heat oven to 350F.
In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add rice and stir to coat with butter.
Add white wine and cook until absorbed.
Add 1 cup of chicken stock, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring frequently.
When the stock is absorbed, add another 1/2 cup.
Continue adding stock until the rice is tender, about 20 minutes.
Add the blue cheese and stir until melted.
Add the remaining 1/2 cup of stock and stir until absorbed.
Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a baking dish and bake until the top is golden brown, about 10 minutes.
Serve immediately.

7b4784ea40.gt:
Slice the body of the prepped squid into rounds, then cut into 1cm dice.
Combine the flours, dashi stock granules, and water, and mix until it's slightly sticky (meaning the gluten in the flour has formed).
Add the squid to the batter, and leave for at least 30 minutes.
If the batter becomes too firm, add a little water so that it's the consistency of crepe batter.
Add oil in a pan, and pour in the batter (You can add an egg here to upgrade the pancake to a deluxe version.)
When one side is browned, turn the pancake over.
Cook the other side while pressing down hard on the pancake with your spatula.
When the pancake is cooked, spread the combined okonomiyaki and takoyaki sauces, fold in half and press.
If you add too much squid, the pancakes will be hard to cook.
I'm not too good at cooking these myself.
If you're not used to making pancakes, try cooking one with just a little squid added to the batter.
7b4784ea40.pred:
1.
Preheat the grill to medium heat.
2.
Cut the squid into bite-sized pieces and put them in a bowl.
3.
Add the ingredients marked with a red circle to the squid.
4.
Mix well and let sit for 10 minutes.
5.
Put the squid mixture on a plate and spread it out evenly.
6.
Place the plate on the grill and cook for 10 minutes.
7.
Turn the plate over and cook for 5 minutes more.
8.
Serve hot.

58c85cf057.gt:
Mix 2 Tbsp flour and the salt and pepper in a ziptop bag.
Add chicken; shake to coat.
Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet.
Add chicken; saute 5 minutes, or until cooked through.
Remove to a plate.
In a cup, mix remaining flour, the broth and garlic.
Add asparagus to skillet and saute 1 minute until bright green.
Stir chicken broth mixture, add to pan and cook 1 minute until thickened slightly and asparagus are tender.
Add chicken back to pan.
Stir in tomatoes; remove from heat.
Stir in scallions and dill.
58c85cf057.pred:
Chop chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Cut asparagus into 2-inch pieces.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until browned, turning once, about 5 minutes.
Add asparagus and cook until tender, about 3 minutes.
Add a splash of water to the pan and cover.
Cook until the chicken is cooked through and the asparagus is tender, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

613e75a520.gt:
In a large bowl, mix mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, sugar and salt until combined.
Add cabbage mix, apples, celery and raisins to bowl with dressing, toss well.
Cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes to allow cabbage to soften.
To serve, sprinkle with walnuts.
Garnish with radishes.
613e75a520.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Cut up the vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
Add the dressing and toss.

4b92540ad2.gt:
heat oven to 425
line 9in pie plate with pastry
combine lemon juice with flour,sugar,nutmeg,cinnamon,lemon rind
place half of apples in plate, sharp edges inward
sprinkle with half of sugar mixture
top with rest of apples, heaping in center sprinkle with rest of sugar mixture
dot with butter
adjust top crust as directed and glaze
bake 40-50min or until apples test tender with fork and crust is brown
4b92540ad2.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix flour, sugar, salt, and butter in a bowl.
Add water and mix until dough forms.
Roll out dough on a floured surface and use to line a 9-inch pie pan.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and set aside to cool.
While the crust is cooling, prepare the filling.
Combine apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a bowl.
Pour filling into the cooled crust and bake for 45 minutes.
Remove from oven and allow to cool.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

f7ca0c32fa.gt:
Place greens on serving plate.
Top with chicken and corn.
Drizzle with salsa, then dressing.
f7ca0c32fa.pred:
1.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2.
In a large bowl, combine chicken, onion, bell pepper, tomato, cilantro, jalapeno, and avocado.
3.
Add dressing ingredients, mix well, and season to taste.
4.
Pour into a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes.
5.
Serve on a bed of lettuce.

0509ec4c83.gt:
Mix milk and vinegar together, and set aside.
Mix flour and salt.
Cut in shortening with fork.
Add milk and vinegar.
0509ec4c83.pred:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, salt, and shortening.
Using a pastry blender, cut in the shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing with a fork until the dough just comes together.
Do not overwork the dough.
Divide dough into 2 equal portions.
Roll out 1 portion on a lightly floured surface to a 1/8-inch thickness.
Fit into a 9-inch pie plate.
Trim excess dough.
Repeat with remaining dough.
Prick bottom and sides of crust with a fork.
Bake for 10 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack.
In a medium bowl, combine sugar, flour, and cinnamon.
Add milk and vanilla.
Pour into cooled crust.
Bake at 425 degrees F for 15 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F.
Bake for 30 minutes longer or until filling is set.
Cool on a wire rack.

83b98d7ee9.gt:
Saute diced onion in olive oil, add to crock pot.
Pour canned ingredients into crock pot, do not drain beans.
Add spices.
And the diced chicken.
(I used bagged chicken breast that was still partially frozen).
Heat on medium heat for 6 hours.
Microwave cream cheese for 45 seconds until it is easy to stir and pour.
Add the the soup.
Using a blender or immersion blender, blend until smooth.
Add 1 cup of favorite shredded cheese.
I used Colby Jack.
Hollow out your bead bowl if you so desire and pour soup into it.
Top with remaining shredded cheese.
83b98d7ee9.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large crockpot.
Add 1/2 cup of water.
Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.
Stir occasionally.
Add more water if needed.
Serve with your favorite toppings.

9980565108.gt:
Wash fruit and discard any skin (from peaches or the like).
Cut fruit into pieces no larger than 1 inch each.
In a large heavy-duty saucepan add the sugar and stir over medium heat while the sugar melts and the fruit softens.
Cook, stirring constantly until the jam thickens.
this may take an hour or more.
Cool, then spoon into very clean jars, cover with clean lids and refrigerate up to 3 weeks.
9980565108.pred:
Put the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Put the bowl in the refrigerator and let it sit for 24 hours.
Take the bowl out of the refrigerator and mix the jam again.
Put the jam in a jar and store in the refrigerator.

08c1e0e854.gt:
break the banana into small pieces.
crush the cereal into big pieces
sieve flour and salt, beat in eggs, milk, vanilla, cream cheese, cereal and banana
heat a teaspoon of oil in a nonstick frying pan on a medium heat
depending on how big you like your pancakes depends on how big a spoon you use.
drop some batter in so its about 1/4 inch thick.
when the edges dry start to work a spatula around the edges and flip.
leave for a few mins.
check by lifting on end with the spatula
repeat steps 3 and 4 until all mixture is used up.
during cooking keep the ready pancakes warm in the oven
08c1e0e854.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together the bananas, eggs, milk, flour, sugar, and baking powder.
Pour the batter into a greased 10-inch nonstick skillet.
Cook over medium heat until bubbles form on the surface of the pancake and the edges are dry.
Flip the pancake and cook for 1 minute.
Transfer the pancake to a baking sheet and place in the oven.
Bake for 10 minutes or until the pancake is golden brown.
Serve with syrup and banana slices.

8b434331f6.gt:
Heat oven to 425F.
Cook broccoli according to pkg directions.
Mix margarine, onion salt, parsley, onion powder in saucepan.
Heat until melted.
Set aside.
Mix baking mix, wine, & chicken until soft dough forms.
You can add a little extra wine if there is still some of the baking mix not mixed in.
Press into bottom of baking dish.
Pour butter mixture over biscuit mixture.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Pour broccoli over biscuit mix.
Cut into squares & serve.
8b434331f6.pred:
Chicken, broccoli, biscuits, and baking powder.
Bake the chicken in the oven.
Cut the broccoli into small pieces.
Mix the biscuits with baking powder.
Prepare the baking dish.
Put the chicken in the baking dish.
Put the broccoli on top of the chicken.
Sprinkle the baking powder over the broccoli.
Bake in the oven until the chicken is cooked through and the broccoli is tender.

582a1779fb.gt:
Put all ingredients into a blender or food processor.
Process until smooth.
Pour into glass.
Enjoy!
582a1779fb.pred:
Peanut butter, bananas, blueberries, milk, and ice.
Peanut butter, bananas, blueberries, milk, and ice.
Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and enjoy!

e65b0ff688.gt:
Combine chicken strips, orange juice, and 1 teaspoon cornstarch in a medium bowl; cover and chill 1 hour.
Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add cashews; cook, stirring constantly, 30 seconds.
Remove from skillet; set aside.
Add chicken mixture to skillet.
Cook, uncovered, over medium-high heat 8 minutes or until chicken is lightly browned, stirring constantly.
Add water chestnuts and next 3 ingredients; cook 5 minutes.
Combine broth, soy sauce, and 1 tablespoon cornstarch; add to chicken mixture.
Bring to a boil; reduce heat, and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Remove from heat; stir in oranges.
Spoon chicken mixture over rice, and sprinkle with cashews.
Serve immediately.
e65b0ff688.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine chicken, cashews, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, and cornstarch.
Stir until well mixed.
Spread the mixture in a baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
Serve with rice.

fa898117da.gt:
These few potatoes weighed about 1 kg this time.
Peel them, cut into pieces, and soak in water.
Bring the butter to room temperature.
Boil the sweet potatoes until they become soft.
When finished boiling, drain the water.
Mash with a masher while they are still hot.
Add the butter, sugar, and heavy cream into a pot, and mix over medium heat, without burning the mixture, until the butter melts.
When the butter is melted, add the Step 3 potatoes and evaporate the water while kneading and mixing.
Add vanilla extract, as well.
Preheat the oven to 200C.
Form into your desired shapes and brush with the egg yolk and water mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 ~ 20 minutes at 200C.
fa898117da.pred:
Sweet potatoes, sugar, butter, eggs, flour, milk, and vanilla.
.
.
.

143f7e5182.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix bread dough following the directions on the box (or use your favorite recipe).
Wrap the dough around the smokies, one at a time.
Place on a greased cookie sheet, or use Silpat or parchment paper.
Bake for 15 minutes.
143f7e5182.pred:
Sausage, Cheese, Onions, and Bread.
I.
Brown sausage in a frying pan.
Add onions and cook until soft.
Add cheese and cook until melted.
Place sausage in a bun and top with onions and cheese.
Serve with a side of bread.

27f4409414.gt:
In a large bowl, combine chicken broth with 3 cups ice.
Add chicken; chill 1 hour.
Meanwhile, in a resealable bag, combine bread crumbs, flour, salt, cayenne, oregano, garlic, parsley, and pepper; shake.
Preheat oven to 400F Coat a large baking sheet with vegetable or olive oil spray; set aside.
Place yogurt in a medium bowl.
Remove chicken from broth.
One piece at a time, dip chicken into yogurt, then place in bread crumb mixture and shake.
Place breaded chicken on baking sheet.
Spray tops of chicken with vegetable spray.
Bake 45 to 50 minutes, until golden brown.
Serve hot or at room temperature.
27f4409414.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large bowl, mix together the flour, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Dip chicken pieces in the egg, then dredge in the flour mixture.
Place chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
Flip chicken pieces over and bake for another 10 minutes.

9f341bf6c9.gt:
Preheat oven to 350.
Grease a 9x9" pan.
Melt white chocolate and butter in the top of a double boiler, or in microwave on med power.
Set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, beat eggs until foamy.
Gradually add the sugar and vanilla, mixing constantly.
Drizzle in the melted white chocolate mixture.
Combine the flour and salt and fold into the white chocolate mixture.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Do not over-bake.
4.
Serve heated.
Top with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, some real whipped cream and a drizzle of chocolate sauce.
9f341bf6c9.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, mix together the brownie mix, eggs, water, and oil.
Pour the batter into a 9x13 inch baking pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool completely before cutting into squares.

555c73c04a.gt:
Thoroughly combine seasoning mix ingredients in a small bowl and set aside.
Cook pasta according to package directions and set aside.
Heat a skillet over high heat until it is hot, about 4 minutes.
Meanwhile, stir chicken pieces into seasoning.
Mix well.
Add 2 oz butter to pan.
Add chicken pieces and brown them.
Add the green onions, parsley, garlic and stock.
Cook two minutes or until the sauce is at a rolling boil.
Add the remaining butter (cut into pats) stirring to incorporate.
Cook for 3 minutes and add the cooked pasta.
Mix well.
Serve immediately.
I like to add parmesan on top.
555c73c04a.pred:
Chicken, onions, mushrooms, and cream.
Chicken: Cut into 1/2 inch cubes.
Onions: Peel and slice into 1/2 inch rings.
Mushrooms: Clean and slice into 1/4 inch slices.
Cream: Measure 1/2 cup.
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, saute chicken in 2 tablespoons of butter until browned.
Add onions and mushrooms and saute until tender.
Add 1/2 cup of cream and cook until reduced by half.
Add 1/2 cup of water and bring to a boil.
Add 1/2 cup of chicken broth and cook until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper.
Place chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish and pour sauce over top.
Bake for 30 minutes.

5c4e65b3c5.gt:
Preheat oven to 200F.
Place flour for dredging in a shallow bowl; coat each fillet with seasoned flour and shake off excess.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat for 3-4 minutes; add butter/olive oil combination then add the fillets, without crowding.
Increase heat to high and saute, shaking the pan from time to time, until bottom of the fish is nicely browned, about 3 minutes; turn and brown the other side.
Remove fish to a plate and keep warm in the oven; repeat with remaining fillets.
Deglaze the pan with white wine; cook, stirring over high heat until reduced by about 1/3; stir in remaining butter and drained capers.
Place fillets on individual serving plates and drizzle sauce around each fillet.
5c4e65b3c5.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut the chile peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membranes.
Place the chile peppers on a baking sheet and roast until they are charred and soft, about 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool.
Cut the chile peppers into strips.
Place the chile peppers, garlic, and olive oil in a small bowl and toss to combine.
Place the fish in a baking dish and season with salt and pepper.
Pour the chile pepper mixture over the fish.
Bake until the fish is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Serve with rice and a green salad.

b6f5004817.gt:
Combine all together, cook on low in crock-pot 6-8 hours.
Serve with brown rice.
b6f5004817.pred:
Place a large crock-pot on the stove and fill it with water.
Add chicken, pineapple, onions, and garlic.
Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.
Remove chicken and shred.
Add the juice from the can of pineapple, and stir.
Return chicken to the crock-pot and cook for 1 hour.
Serve with rice.

708886aaca.gt:
Heat oil in a five to six quart pot over moderately high heat.
Add garlic and pepper flake, saute until golden.
Be careful not to burn the garlic.
Stir in tomatoes and salt.
Simmer uncovered for 35 minutes.
Serve with pasta.
708886aaca.pred:
Spicy Red Pasta Sauce is a delicious and flavorful pasta sauce.
It is made with a blend of spices and tomato paste, which gives it its distinctive red color.
To make Spicy Red Pasta Sauce, you will need the following ingredients: tomato paste, red pepper flakes, garlic, onion, olive oil, salt, pepper, and pasta.
Mix all ingredients together in a saucepan and simmer over medium heat until the sauce has thickened.
You can then add the pasta and cook according to the package directions.

bfebd12211.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with foil (enough to go up the sides) then spray the foil with cooking spray.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat butter until smooth and creamy.
Add the sugars and salt and beat until well incorporated.
Beat in the egg and vanilla extract until smooth.
With the mixer on low speed, slowly add the flour, baking powder, and baking soda, stirring until incorporated.
The mixture will be thick.
Scoop the mixture into the prepared pan and use your fingers to press it into an even layer.
Bake in the preheated oven for 22 minutes, or until golden, puffed, and slightly cracked.
Remove the cookie layer from the oven and immediately spread the chopped chocolate evenly over the top.
Return to the oven for 2-3 minutes or until chocolate begins to melt.
Remove from the oven and use a spatula to smooth the chocolate over the top.
Cover the chocolate with the chips and marshmallows (or other toppings like toasted coconut or chopped nuts, peppermints, or other candies) and gently press them into the chocolate.
Allow bars to cool, then use the foil to pull them from the pan.
Slice and serve.
Recipe adapted from Bon Appetit.
bfebd12211.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together melted butter, brown sugar, and white sugar.
Add cereal and mix until evenly coated.
Press mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 25 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix together chocolate chips and peanut butter.
Spread over cooled crust.
Sprinkle with pretzels.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Cool completely before cutting into bars.

f951ae3f61.gt:
Light the grill.
In a food processor, puree the butter and olives with the anchovy paste, orange zest, orange juice, garlic, and pepper.
With a rubber spatula, scrape the butter into a small bowl and refrigerate.
Rub the hens with oil and cook over moderate heat for 12 minutes.
Turn and cook until just done, about 12 minutes longer.
Remove the hens from the grill and serve with the rice.
Top each serving with 2 tablespoons of the flavored butter, letting the butter melt over both the hen and the rice.
f951ae3f61.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Clean and rinse the cornish hens.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Place in a baking dish.
Bake for 45 minutes, or until the hens are cooked through.
Remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare the rice.
In a saucepan, combine 2 cups of water, 1 cup of rice, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover.
Simmer for 15 minutes, or until the rice is tender.
Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork.
In a small saucepan, melt 1/2 cup of butter over medium heat.
Add 1/2 cup of minced garlic and 1/2 teaspoon of dried oregano.
Cook for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
Remove from heat and stir in 1/2 cup of chopped fresh parsley.
Set aside.
To serve, slice the cornish hens and place on a serving platter.
Top with rice and butter sauce.

4ca2ec2109.gt:
In a heavy bottomed saucepan, combine the heavy cream, sugar and basil and bring to a simmer.
Remove from heat and let steep for half an hour.
Place this mixture in a blender and puree.
In a large stainless steel bowl place the egg yolks.
Add the half and half mixture while constantly whisking.
Place entire mixture back onto heat.
Add the vanilla bean and the half and half and heat for one to two more minutes, stirring constantly until the mixture has thickened and coats the back of a spoon.
Do not boil!
Remove from heat and strain the entire mixture through a fine mesh sieve.
Cool over an ice bath.
Freeze in an ice cream machine according to manufacturers instructions.
4ca2ec2109.pred:
Place the ice cream in a bowl and add the basil.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and freeze for at least 2 hours.
Remove the basil from the ice cream and serve.

e9acd2e2b9.gt:
Cook couscous in well-salted boiling water, uncovered, until tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in sugar snaps 3 minutes before couscous is done.
Drain and transfer to a bowl, then stir in 1/2 tablespoon butter and salt and pepper to taste.
While couscous and sugar snaps cook, toss shrimp with 1/8 teaspoon each of salt and pepper.
Heat remaining tablespoon butter in a 10-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until foam subsides.
Saute shrimp, turning once, until just cooked through, about 3 minutes total.
Transfer shrimp with a slotted spoon to a plate.
Add wine, tomato, and sugar to skillet and boil until tomato starts to fall apart, about 4 minutes.
Return shrimp to skillet and stir in tarragon.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve shrimp and pan sauce on top of pearl couscous.
e9acd2e2b9.pred:
Shrimp, pearls, and a creamy sauce.
In a large pot, boil water and add shrimp.
When the shrimp are cooked, remove them from the water and set aside.
In a separate pot, boil water with pearls.
When the pearls are cooked, drain them and set aside.
In a saucepan, heat cream and add butter.
When the butter melts, add garlic and cook for a few seconds.
Add the shrimp and pearls and cook until the sauce thickens.
Serve with rice or pasta.

bce4690032.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a baking sheet (or 2) with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, chile powder and salt.
With a stand mixer, beat the butter and reserved bacon fat drippings on medium-high until smooth, about 1 minute.
Beat in the white and brown sugar until creamy, about 4 minutes.
Then add the egg and vanilla and beat until fluffy for about 2 minutes.
Reduce the speed of the mixer to low and add the flour.
Mix until just combined and then add in the chocolate chips and crispy bacon.
Form the cookie dough into 12 even-sized balls and arrange them on the cookie sheet about 2 inches apart from each other.
Flatten the cookie balls with your fingers and then bake for 12-14 minutes until golden brown.
Let the cookies cool for about 2 minutes on the baking sheet before transferring to a cooling rack.
bce4690032.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar.
Add egg and vanilla extract.
Mix well.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture, mixing well.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool on wire racks.

e10d62e4d9.gt:
To make the crust, preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Crust cookies in a food processor (or smash in a Ziploc bag with a rolling pin).
Stir in melted butter until all combined.
Pour into a regular pie pan and press crumbs all over the pan and up the sides.
Bake for 3 to 4 minutesjust long enough for it to set.
Cool crust completely.
Place raspberries on a plate or in an empty pan.
Smash them with a fork, then sprinkle on 3 tablespoons of sugar.
Stir together and allow to sit for 15 minutes.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, combine raspberry yogurt with the instant vanilla pudding mix (just the powder itself.)
Beat on low until combined, about 1 minute.
Pour in heavy cream and whip on low for 30 seconds.
Stop the mixer and scrape down the bowl with a rubber spatula.
Turn mixer on medium-high speed and beat for two minutes, or until mixture is thick.
Turn off mixer, then fold in raspberries until just combined.
Pour into cooled pie pan and spread evenly.
Freeze for two hours, or until very firm.
Cut into slices and top each slice with cookie crumbs, dollops of whipped cream, and extra raspberries.
Keep in freezer, allowing time to thaw before serving.
e10d62e4d9.pred:
Raspberry Cream Pie is a delicious dessert that combines the sweetness of raspberries with the creaminess of custard.
In this recipe, we will cover the basics of making a Raspberry Cream Pie.
To make the pie, you will need the following ingredients:
1. 1 cup raspberries, fresh or frozen
2. 1/2 cup sugar
3. 1/2 cup water
4. 1/2 cup raspberry jam
5. 1/2 cup heavy cream
6. 1/2 cup cornstarch
7. 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
8. 1 tsp salt
9. 1/2 tsp lemon juice
10. 1/2 tsp butter
11. 1 tsp flour
12. 1 tsp baking powder
13. 1/2 tsp cinnamon
14. 1/2 tsp nutmeg
15. 1/2 tsp allspice
16. 1/2 tsp ground cloves
17. 1/2 cup whole milk
18. 1/2 cup whole eggs
19. 1/2 cup egg yolks
20. 1/2 cup sugar
21. 1/2 cup butter
22. 1/2 cup cream cheese
23. 1/2 cup whipping cream
24. 1/2 cup chilled water
25. 1/2 cup sour cream
26. 1/2 cup confectioners sugar
27. 1/2 cup chopped nuts (optional)
28. 1/2 cup coconut (optional)
29. 1/2 cup shredded coconut (optional)
30. 1/2 cup chopped chocolate (optional)
31. 1/2 cup chopped nuts (optional)
32. 1/2 cup coconut (optional)
33. 1/2 cup shredded coconut (optional)
34. 1/2 cup chopped chocolate (optional)
35.

50ad0077cb.gt:
Put all ingredients except the olive oil with the tuna steak to marinade.
Leave it for approximately 30 minutes to marinade (if you leave it longer it with take more in flavor but not necessary for this type.)
After marinating the tuna do not throw away the marinade you will use it as cooking liquid.
Start with a pan and place the olive oil to heat up, place in the tuna 1 minute per side to sear.
Return to low heat and leave it for 8 minutes per piece when the cooking liquid is getting low put some of the marinade.
It will enhance the taste and give it a great taste.
I decorated the plate with some coleslaw, tomatoes, lemon and deep fried potato shavings.
50ad0077cb.pred:
Tuna Steak: Tuna steaks are a great source of lean protein and are easy to cook.
Ingredients: Tuna steaks, olive oil, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and fresh herbs.
Preparation:
1. Season the tuna steaks with salt and pepper.
2.
In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, and herbs.
3.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
4.
Add the tuna steaks to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side.
5.
Remove the tuna steaks from the skillet and place on a plate.
6.
Pour the olive oil mixture over the tuna steaks and serve.

d34f8abc06.gt:
Saute pepper and onion in skillet with Pam.
Add soup, Rotel tomatoes and chicken.
Alternate layers of tortillas and soup mix.
Sprinkle cheese on top.
Bake at 325F for 40 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
Serves 4.
WW Points: 5 pt.

b7705a9251.gt:
Saute -- In a large pan, heat the oil.
Add the garlic, onion and red pepper and saute for 2-3 minutes on medium until slightly soft.
Beans and spinach -- Add the beans, seasoning and saute on medium high to high until cooked through, about 5 minutes.
As they cook I like to take a fork and slightly mash the beans a bit to get a good consistency.
I like to get them a little crisp and browned but not fried dark brown.
Just a light browning is good.
Add the spinach and break up as it cooks.
If too dry you can use a little white wine, chicken broth or just water to loosen the sauce if necessary.
Garnish with some good olive oil and ground pepper.
b7705a9251.pred:
Cannellini beans, spinach, garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Cannellini beans: Place 1 can of drained and rinsed cannellini beans in a bowl.
Spinach: Rinse 1 bunch of spinach and place in a bowl.
Garlic: Peel 3 cloves of garlic and place in a bowl.
Olive oil: Pour 1/2 cup of olive oil into a small bowl.
Salt and pepper: Add 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and pepper to the bowl.
Mix all ingredients together and store in a covered container in the refrigerator.
To make Sauteed Cannellini With Spinach and Garlic, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add 1/2 cup of the spinach mixture and saute for 2 minutes.
Add 1/2 cup of the garlic mixture and saute for 1 minute.
Add the drained and rinsed cannellini beans and saute for 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

db15adcf9f.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut tops off of heads of garlic in a straight line across.
Rub extra virgin olive oil all over heads; wrap loosely in foil and place on a baking sheet.
Roast garlic at 400 degrees F until caramelized and soft, approximately 30-35 minutes.
Leave oven at 400 degrees F and line large baking sheet with nonstick foil for easy cleanup.
In a large bowl, add ground turkey breast, chopped baby spinach, chopped fresh parsley, beaten egg, melted palm shortening (or olive oil), salt, pepper, and carefully squeeze roasted garlic heads to release the roasted garlic into the bowl.
With your hands, mix everything together well until all ingredients are incorporated evenly.
Roll balls by hand in uniform sizes to ensure even cooking in the batch.
Place on nonstick foil-lined (or parchment paper) baking sheet.
Bake at 400 degrees F for about 25-30 minutes or until thoroughly cooked.
db15adcf9f.pred:
Spinach & Roasted Garlic Meatballs:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine ground beef, spinach, bread crumbs, egg, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Form into 1-inch balls.
Place on a baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through.
Serve with marinara sauce.

70b786a095.gt:
Preheat the oven to gas 4 / 180C / 350F with and line 2 baking trays with foil and have 2 spare baking trays handy
Peel the beets and slice very thinly, 1/16 inch thick with a mandolin but be careful of your fingers.
In a large bowl, toss the sliced beets with the extra virgin olive oil
Arrange the beets in a single layer on each tray and sprinkle with a small amount of the salt.
You can use plain sea salt or any flavoured salt of preferrence.
Stack an extra baking tray on top of each layer of beetroot.
This keeps the crisps flat.
Put one tray on the oven top shelf and the other on the bottom
Bake until the edges of the beets begin to dry out, about 20 minutes.
Peek around 17 minutes to check!
Remove the extra trays that are on top of the beets and rotate the trays so the top one now goes in the bottom and the bottom one goes to the top
Bake a further 17 - 20 minutes.
Remove the crisps as they become lighter in color.
Transfer to a wire rack, they will crisp up as they cool
Keep in a lidded container for up to a week
70b786a095.pred:
Preheat oven to 200C.
Cut beetroot into 1cm slices.
Place in a bowl and cover with a little water.
Leave for 10 minutes.
Drain and pat dry with kitchen paper.
Place on a baking tray and drizzle with olive oil.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Bake for 20 minutes, until crisp.
Serve warm.

d5926ad471.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 F. Lightly grease and flour a pie dish.
Rub the seasoning on the chicken breasts.
Place in a medium saucepan and add enough water to cover.
Bring to a simmer and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Drain and dice chicken.
In a large bowl, combine chicken, cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, mixed vegetables, and salt and pepper.
Mix thoroughly.
Lay one sheet of pastry in the bottom of the greased and floured pan.
Pour chicken mixture over pastry.
Cover with second sheet of pastry.
Seal edges of the top and bottom pastries by pinching them together.
Cut steam vents in the top crust.
Bake in preheated oven for 50 minutes, until pastry is golden brown.
d5926ad471.pred:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large skillet, brown chicken and onions.
Add carrots, celery, and potatoes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir in flour and cook until thickened.
Add chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in 1/2 cup of the chicken broth.
Place 1/2 of the chicken mixture in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Cover with a layer of puff pastry.
Top with the remaining chicken mixture.
Cover with another layer of puff pastry.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes.
Cut into squares and serve.

830e83ffb1.gt:
Halve your bread crosswise.
Hollow out the inside of the bread halves to make the pockets.
Do your best to keep from putting holes in the roll.
Fill with your favorite pasta!
Note: Push the pasta mixture down into the bread pocket to allow more spaghetti to fit inside.
Once hollowed out, you can stuff your bread with any pasta.
Try it with a butter sauce, olive oil, pesto, tomato sauce or anything you like.
Go all out and add sausages and peppers, chicken, or mini meatballs.
You can even throw in a Caesar or mixed green salad tossed with dressing.
You are only limited by your imagination.
830e83ffb1.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine 1 cup of all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese, 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese, 1/2 cup of ricotta cheese, 1 egg, 1/2 cup of milk, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper.
Knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic.
Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a thickness of 1/4 inch.
Cut the dough into 4 equal pieces.
Place 1 piece of dough on a lightly floured surface and spread 1/4 cup of pasta sauce over the dough.
Sprinkle 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Top with the remaining 3 pieces of dough, pressing the edges to seal.
Cut the dough into 4 equal squares.
Place the squares on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve with additional pasta sauce and mozzarella cheese.

0dddf99191.gt:
Trim pork tenderloin removing fat and sinew, slice thinly across the grain (1/4" thickness), place in a bowl.
Add marinade ingredients (soy sauce, white wine, sriracha sauce, honey and ginger), mix to distribute sauce evenly and set aside.
Chop veggies.
Heat wok on high heat for a few minutes, add sesame oil, when oil just starts to smoke, add pork slices, turning frequently.
Stir-fry until pork is mostly cooked and opaque, about 5 - 8 minutes.
Remove pork from wok into a clean bowl/plate, set aside.
In the juices left in the wok, stir in chopped garlic, then add broccoli & carrots.
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, adding more sesame oil if desired.
Add baby corn and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.
Return pork to wok and stir into veggies, add more soy sauce, sriracha, and honey if needed to create a liquid gravy of about 1/2 cup in volume.
Push food to the outer edges so liquid is settled in the bottom of wok.
In a seperate bowl combine cool water & corn starch.
Add mixture to liquid gravy in the wok and stir until thickened.
Mix everything together and voila!
Serve immediately with cooked rice.
(Basmati/wild blend cooked in chicken stock and nutmeg is nice!)
0dddf99191.pred:
Place all ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Pour into a frying pan and cook over medium heat until meat is cooked through.
Serve with rice or noodles.

7d493176df.gt:
In a large saucepot, combine the potatoes, coleslaw, carrots, and chicken stock.
Add 4 cups water; the liquid should barely cover the vegetables.
Bring to a boil, then cover halfway and reduce the heat to simmer until tender, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, whisk the beer and mustard.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to simmer and add the bratwurst.
Simmer gently until cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the bratwurst to the vegetable mixture; discard the beer mixture.
Divide the stew among dishes and serve with mustard.
7d493176df.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large pot, brown the brats on all sides in a little oil.
Add the onions, carrots, celery, and potatoes.
Cook until the onions are translucent.
Add the beer, tomato sauce, and seasonings.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Add the cabbage and cook for 15 minutes.
Serve with crusty bread.

8237def972.gt:
1.
Preheat oven to 375.2.
To prepare cake, combine rhubarb and 2 tablespoons flour in a medium bowl; toss well to coat.3.
Place brown sugar and 5 tablespoons butter in a large bowl; beat with a mixer at medium speed until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add sour cream, rind, and vanilla; beat until well combined.4.
Lightly spoon 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour and whole wheat flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife.
Combine flours, baking soda, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and salt, stirring with a whisk.
Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture, beating at low speed just until combined.
Fold in rhubarb mixture.
Spread batter into a 9-inch square baking pan coated with cooking spray.5.
To prepare streusel, combine turbinado sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in a small bowl.
Cut in 2 tablespoons butter with a pastry blender or 2 forks until mixture is crumbly; stir in nuts.
Sprinkle streusel evenly over batter.
Bake at 375 for 50 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8237def972.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, mix together the egg, milk, sour cream, and vanilla.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Fold in the rhubarb and walnuts.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes, then turn out onto the rack to cool completely.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

de5ceb6ef3.gt:
Put yogurt in a bowl.
Stir in ginger, diced chile and salt.
Put oil in a small skillet over medium heat.
Add mustard and cumin seeds and let sizzle until seeds begin to pop, about 1 minute.
Carefully stir hot contents of skillet into yogurt.
Add chopped mint, cover and let flavors mingle for at least 15 minutes.
Raita may be prepared several hours before serving.
de5ceb6ef3.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the yogurt, chile, mint, and salt.
Stir until the yogurt is smooth and the flavors are well blended.
Serve immediately.

c577db5950.gt:
Squeeze the lime wedges into a small glass; add wedges and mint to glass.
Crush with the back of a spoon for 30 seconds.
Add soda, rum, Simple Syrup, and nectar; stir gently.
Serve over ice.Note: Nutritional analysis includes Simple Syrup.
c577db5950.pred:
Mix all ingredients in a blender until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

2069c35857.gt:
Bring water to a boil in a covered saucepan.
Add butter, cumin, raisins, currants, zest, and rice.
Stir the rice and return to a rolling boil.
Cover and reduce heat to low.
Cook 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and add chives.
Fluff rice with fork and transfer to a serving dish.
Cover rice liberally with toasted sliced almonds or smoked almonds.
2069c35857.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place rice in a medium saucepan with 1 1/2 cups water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover.
Cook for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the remaining 1/2 cup water with the soy sauce, garlic, and ginger.
Set aside.
Place the chicken in a baking dish.
Pour the soy sauce mixture over the chicken.
Bake for 45 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes.
Cut into thin slices.
Serve over the rice.

e55ff056b8.gt:
1.
Mix soy sauce, lime juice, vegetable oil, chili garlic sauce and ketchup.
2.
Add chicken breasts to mixture and refrigerate for at least 6 hours.
3.
Remove from refrigerator and season chicken with salt and pepper.
4.
Place on a hot grill or bake in a 400 degree oven until cooked completely through.
A meat thermometer should read at least 155-160 degrees.
5.
Mix mayonnaise and Thai chili sauce.
Both the Thai chili sauce and the chili garlic sauce should be available in the Asian food section of the grocery store.
4.
Brush 1 Tbl of the mayonnaise-Thai chili sauce mixture over each hamburger bun.
5.
Place chicken on the bun and serve with lettuce and tomato.
e55ff056b8.pred:
Thai Chicken Sandwich:
In a bowl, combine the chicken, coconut milk, curry paste, fish sauce, and lime juice.
Let marinate for at least 1 hour.
Grill the chicken until cooked through.
Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Toast the bread.
Spread the mayonnaise on the bread.
Layer the chicken, lettuce, tomato, cucumber, and red onion on the bread.
Serve with sweet chili sauce.

f1211da4d4.gt:
In a serving dish, add quinoa, watermelon, red onion, feta and mint.
Gently toss to combine.
Drizzle in olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Toss to combine.
Top with mint garnish.
Serve chilled.
f1211da4d4.pred:
Wash and cut up the watermelon into bite-sized pieces.
Cut the feta cheese into cubes.
Cook quinoa according to package directions.
Combine watermelon, feta, and quinoa in a large bowl.
Add a drizzle of olive oil, salt and pepper to taste.
Mix well.
Serve immediately.

ee5c4e9487.gt:
Arrange cauliflower and carrots in four half-pint canning jars; set aside.
Heat remaining ingredients to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat, cook 10 minutes.
Turn off heat; let steep 5 minutes.
Pour mixture over the vegetables to cover.
Cover jars tightly; cool to room temperature, about 1 hour.
Refrigerate at least three days before serving.
ee5c4e9487.pred:
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl.
Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours.
Drain and rinse the vegetables.
Pack the vegetables into jars, leaving 1/2 inch headspace.
Bring the jars to a boil and process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes.
Let cool, then store in the refrigerator.

97b16dfccd.gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain and set aside in a large bowl.
Cook bacon.
When cool enough, crumble into bite-size pieces.
Set aside.
In a small bowl, stir together the ranch dressing, green onions, cheddar cheese and black pepper.
Pour mixture over the pasta and add chopped bacon.
Stir together and serve.

f78a4f2c70.gt:
Preheat oven to 425F.
Coat baking sheet with cooking spray.
Heat large, deep skillet over medium heat.
Add 1 Tbs.
oil, and swirl to coat pan.
Add onion and cook 5 minutes, or until onion becomes translucent, stirring often.
Stir in button mushrooms, garlic, and salt, and cook 8 to 10 minutes, or until mushrooms are soft and most of liquid is evaporated, stirring frequently.
Stir in rice, and cook 1 to 2 minutes longer, or until heated through.
Remove from heat, and stir in goat cheese.
Fill each portobello with about 1/3 cup filling mixture.
Toss tomatoes with lemon juice in bowl, and lay tomato halves cut-side up over tops of filled portobellos.
Place stuffed portobellos on baking sheet greased with remaining 1 Tbs.
oil, and sprinkle each with 1 tsp.
breadcrumbs.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes, or until mushrooms are cooked through and breadcrumbs are golden.
Sprinkle with parsley.
f78a4f2c70.pred:
Melt butter in a skillet.
Add mushrooms and cook until tender.
Add wild rice and cook until rice is tender.
Add goat cheese and stir until melted.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot.

d1d3e72257.gt:
Dice the tomato into 2-3 cm cubes.
Thinly slice the garlic.
Salt and pepper the cod.
Prep the shrimp.
Put the olive oil, red chili pepper, and garlic into a frying pan and saute over low heat.
Add the cod and cook both sides over medium heat.
Add the shrimp.
Quickly cook both sides, and add the water and tomatoes.
When it comes to a boil, simmer for 4 minutes over medium to high heat as you pour the broth over the fish.
Add the olive oil, and season with herb salt once the acqua pazza comes to a boil.
Dish it up, and scatter parsley on top.
d1d3e72257.pred:
Cod, shrimp heads, tomatoes, garlic, basil, and parsley.
.
.
.

a0e261ef2d.gt:
Stir liquid soap into baking soda.
Add the water, and stir to be as smooth as possible.
Add the vinegar and stir again.
Pour into a squeeze bottle.
(A clean, empty ketchup or syrup bottle works well.)
Shake well before using, and keep tightly closed between uses.
a0e261ef2d.pred:
Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Mix well.
Pour into a 9x13 baking dish.
Bake for 45 minutes.
Remove from oven and allow to cool.
Once cool, cut into squares.
Store in airtight containers.

8afb34ca7c.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Quarter the large strawberries and halve the smaller ones.
Place the strawberries in a 9-inch pie plate or 8x8 baking dish.
Sprinkle the sugar over the strawberries and toss several times.
Roast the strawberries for 15-20 minutes, stirring once during the baking time.
The strawberries are done when they have softened and the juices are thick and bubbly.
Cool completely and store in the fridge.
8afb34ca7c.pred:
Strawberries, honey, and olive oil.
Roasted Strawberries: 1 cup strawberries, 1/2 cup honey, 1 tbsp olive oil.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Place strawberries in a bowl, toss with honey and olive oil.
Spread strawberries in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until strawberries are soft and juicy.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

bbff2a5297.gt:
Clean the shrimp and pat dry.
Slice and toast the baguette.
Peel all the garlic and mince finely.
Add to a pan over medium low heat with the olive oil.
We have a clay pot from Spain, but any pan will work.
Keep stirring, allowing the garlic to sizzle lightly (you want to make sure not to burn the garlic) for a few minutes.
Add the paprika, salt and pepper, and stir.
Bring the heat up to medium and add the shrimp to the pan.
Let the shrimp cook for 90 seconds, flip, and add the white wine.
Let everything cook together for another 2 minutes, or until the shrimp is just cooked through.
Place shrimp on toasted bread, drizzle with garlic oil, and garnish with parsley.
bbff2a5297.pred:
In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Stir until the shrimp are coated with the garlic mixture.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Thread the shrimp onto skewers.
Grill the shrimp skewers for 2 to 3 minutes per side, or until they are cooked through.
Serve with lemon wedges and a simple salad.

53ee6640d1.gt:
Using an espresso machine or cappuccino maker, prepare 2 shots espresso.
Fill a large serving glass 2/3 with ice.
Do not use extract or ice cream topping in place of syrup (use types specially made for beverages).
Add vanilla syrup, sugar (if desired), and espresso to glass and top up with cold milk.
Stir or shake briskly until syrup and sugar is nicely blended in the drink.
53ee6640d1.pred:
Coffee, milk, ice, and chocolate powder.
Coffee:.
Brew coffee in a coffee maker.
Milk:.
Pour milk into a pitcher.
Ice:.
Fill a large bowl with ice.
Chocolate powder:.
Add chocolate powder to a small bowl.
Combine coffee, milk, ice, and chocolate powder in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a cup and enjoy!

b3eb381c7e.gt:
Finely grind almond paste in processor.
Add softened butter, flour, and egg; blend until smooth.
Preheat oven to 400F.
Roll out puff pastry on floured surface to 13x11-inch rectangle.
Fold 3/4 inch of edges over; press to adhere to make 11 1/2x9 1/2-inch rectangle.
Transfer to rimmed baking sheet.
Pierce surface evenly with fork, avoiding folded edges.
Spread almond paste mixture evenly over crust within folded edges.
Arrange pear slices atop filling, overlapping slightly.
Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon sugar.
Bake until crust is deep golden and pears are tender, about 38 minutes.
Cool slightly.
Meanwhile, stir vinegar and remaining 1/4 cup sugar in heavy small saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves.
Increase heat; boil until syrup is reduced to 1/4 cup, about 6 minutes.
Place tart on platter.
Drizzle syrup over.
Sprinkle lightly with peppercorns and serve warm.
b3eb381c7e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and salt.
Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add the egg yolk and 1 tablespoon of water.
Mix until the dough comes together.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth.
Pat into a 10-inch circle.
Prick the dough with a fork and bake for 20 minutes, until golden brown.
Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack.
In a small bowl, combine the raspberry vinegar and 1 tablespoon of water.
Whisk until smooth.
Spread the jam over the cooled crust.
Sprinkle the frangipane over the jam.
Bake for 15 minutes, until the frangipane is set.
Cool completely before serving.

048c81274c.gt:
in small sauce pan boil chiles and tomatillos.
when tender add to blender with onion and garlic.
blend on high until smooth.
in large fry pan melt butter/margerine and add cooked pasta.
cooke mixing every few minutes to prevent burning.
the color ur looking for is about 1/4-1/2 of the pasta turning golden brown.
add salsa from blender to pasta and mix thoroughly.
Then add sour cream/ crema mexicana and mix thoroughly.
salt to taste at this time.
lower heat to low and let simmer and obsorb juices.
crumble cheese on top and cover with lid to allow some melting...
serve right away and enjoy..goes well with any meat dish or even just a salad...
048c81274c.pred:
Spaghetti mexicana verde is a Mexican dish that is easy to make.
The first step is to cook the spaghetti according to the package directions.
Once the spaghetti is cooked, drain it and set aside.
The next step is to heat up a little bit of oil in a large skillet.
Then add the chopped onion and cook until it is soft.
Add the tomatoes and cook for a few minutes.
Add the spaghetti and mix well.
Add the green chiles and season with salt and pepper.
Cook for a few minutes more.
Serve immediately.

18f9bb7f6e.gt:
Mix all ingredients except the Romaine and the whole croutons in a small bowl or a "cruet".
Toss with Romaine and croutons.
Serve with a sprinkle of fresh shredded parmesan.
18f9bb7f6e.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Serve with garlic bread.

5f080b5a48.gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Cream together eggs, butter, both sugars, crisco, and vanilla.
In separate bowl mix dry ingredients and slowly add to the wet.
Spoon on to cookie sheets.
You can roll each dough ball in sugar or icing them later if desired.
Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes.
5f080b5a48.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar.
Add eggs and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture and mix until combined.
Roll dough into 1-inch balls and place on a greased cookie sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges are golden brown.
Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack.

ede4b858c3.gt:
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil over both sides of each mushroom.
Sprinkle the mushrooms with salt and pepper.
Grill until the mushrooms are heated through and tender, about 5 minutes per side.
Meanwhile, add the extra-virgin olive oil and garlic in a medium bowl, and whisk until well blended.
Toss the tomatoes, cheese, and basil until evenly coated.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Place 4 hot grilled mushrooms gill side up on 4 individual plates.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper if needed.
Fill up the mushroom cap with the bruschetta and cheese mixture.
Drizzle a little bit more extra-virgin olive oil over if needed.
Serve and enjoy!
ede4b858c3.pred:
Preheat grill to medium heat.
Clean and slice the mushrooms.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Brush with olive oil and place on grill.
Grill until tender and slightly charred.
Slice the mushrooms into 1/2-inch thick slices.
Cut the Bruschetta into 1/2-inch thick slices.
Place the mushrooms on the grill and cook until slightly charred.
Place the Bruschetta on the grill and cook until lightly toasted.
Top each mushroom with a slice of mozzarella.
Place the mushrooms and Bruschetta on a platter and serve.

b65ea7e6a7.gt:
Boil the pasta according to the instructions on the package.
In a large frying pan, heat the oil and over a medium heat, soften the garlic.
After a couple of minutes, add the tomatoes, tomato puree and sugar, and leave to stew over medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
Add the mascarpone and stir until it has melted into the sauce.
Add the parsley or basil and season to taste with salt and pepper.
When it is ready, drain the pasta and add it to the pan with the sauce.
Mix well and then serve.
b65ea7e6a7.pred:
1.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2.
Cook pasta according to package directions.
3.
While pasta is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat and add olive oil.
4.
Add onions and cook until soft.
5.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
6.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
7.
Drain pasta and return to pot.
8.
Add tomatoes, salt, and pepper.
9.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
10.
Add mascarpone cheese and stir until smooth.
11.
Add beef mixture and stir until combined.
12.
Spoon pasta into a 9x13 baking dish.
13.
Top with sauce and bake for 20 minutes.
14.
Serve with additional Parmesan cheese, if desired.
15.
Essential ingredients: pasta, tomatoes, ground beef, mascarpone cheese, olive oil, onions, garlic, salt, pepper.

fcb625ec64.gt:
Cut the carrot into thin strips.
Rehydrate the kanpyo in water.
Place the pork into the kombu, and then place the carrots on top.
Roll it up from the front with the carrot, and tie in two places with the kanpyo.
Add the A condiments and Step 2 to a pot, cover with a drop lid, and boil for at least 40 minutes until the kombu softens.
Stick with a toothpick, and cook until it pierces straight through.
After it has softened, turn off the heat, let cool, cut into half, and arrange on a plate.

6206f8059f.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Lightly grease a 9 x 5 loaf pan.
In a large bowl, combine butter, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, baking soda, baking powder and salt, beating till smooth.
Add the mashed bananas, jam, honey and eggs, again beating until smooth.
Add the flour, then the walnuts, stirring just until smooth.
Spoon batter into the prepared loaf pan, smoothing the top.
Let rest at room temperature for 10 minutes.
Bake bread for 45 minutes.
Gently lay a piece of aluminum foil across the top, to prevent over-browning.
Bake for an additional 20 to 25 minutes.
Remove the bread from the oven; a long toothpick or cake tester inserted into the center should come out clean, with the most a few wet crumbs clinging to it.
The tester shouldn't allow any sign of uncooked batter.
If it does, bake the bread an additional 5 minutes, or until it tests done.
Allow the bread to cool 10 minutes in the pan.
Remove it from the pan, and cool it completely on a rack.
6206f8059f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mash bananas and add sugar, eggs, and vanilla.
Mix well.
Add flour, baking soda, and salt.
Mix until just combined.
Pour into a greased loaf pan.
Bake for 1 hour.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack.

fd96b8b1a7.gt:
Heat about 1-2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium low heat.
Add the mushrooms.
Cook them with the lid on for about 9 minutes or until golden brown, stirring occasionally.
Transfer to a food processor and pulse until finely ground.
In the same saucepan (add a little more oil if needed), over medium low heat, combine the minced mushrooms and onions.
Saute until onions are nice and soft and then add the ground turkey.
As it cooks, break up the turkey.
After a few minutes add all of the remaining ingredients (except the buns).
Continue to cook until the turkey is browned and no longer pink.
Spoon mixture onto buns and top with shredded cheddar cheese, if desired.
(Recipe adapted from Pass The Sushi, who in turn adapted it from Americas Test Kitchen.)
fd96b8b1a7.pred:
Cut the meat into small pieces.
Add the meat to a large pot.
Add the tomatoes, onions, and garlic.
Add the beans and the rest of the ingredients.
Cook over medium heat for 1 hour.
Serve with a side of rice.

643060cd52.gt:
Throw all ingredients into a bowl and combine!
(You can add 3tsp of Cacao powder for a slight chocolatey flavour)

84fd3c9208.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees, cut top off of squash and remove pulp and seeds, place upside down on cookie sheet and fill pan 1/2 way up with water, cover with foil and bake 45 minutes, remove and make sure it is fork tender, if not continue cooking in 10 minute intervals, leave on pan to cool.
While it is baking, in rice cooker cook rice with 2 cups vegetable broth, diced zucchini, 1 diced carrot, chopped parsley, and about 1/2 cup water.
When rice is done cooking, stir it well and add the raw tomato, pepper and 1/2 of the onion diced.
In a Large skillet add olive oil and brown 1/2 of the diced onion, when brown add the ground turkey, sage, garlic and mushrooms -- continue cooking until meat is done -- add the rice mixture to the meat mixture and stir well, use the remaining vegetable broth to deglaze pan and get moisture level up for oven baking.
Remove about 3/4 of the squash meat and puree for pie or freeze for later use.
Fill squash with the rice/meat mixture about 1/2 full then add 1/2 the cheese, then layer remaining rice mixture on top and top it all with the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes just to get the cheese melted and the flavors melded.
Makes a great presentation to the table with the squash full of the meal!

0f967b0694.gt:
In a large bowl, toss together the spinach, cranberries, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado and red onion; set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together jam, vinegar, walnut oil, pepper and salt.
Taste, and adjust amounts to suit your liking.
Pour over the salad and toss to coat.

ec81905a61.gt:
Place the dry pancake mix into a large bowl.
Add the eggs, club soda and melted shortening.
Use a wire whisk to mix carefully until there are no lumps (dont over mix).
Allow the batter to rest while you preheat your griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
Use about 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the preheated skillet for each pancake; use 1/2 cup batter for each pancake.
Flip pancake only once when you see open bubbles appear on the surface and the edges appear dry around the pancake.
Makes about 10 pancakes 8 inches in diameter.
ec81905a61.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine 1 cup of pancake mix, 1 cup of milk, 1 egg, and 1/2 cup of melted butter.
Stir until just combined.
Pour the batter into a 12-inch nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray.
Cook over medium heat until bubbles form on the surface of the pancake and the edges are dry, about 2 minutes.
Flip the pancake and cook until golden brown, about 1 minute.
Transfer the pancake to a baking sheet and place in the oven.
Bake until the pancake is golden brown and the center is set, about 10 minutes.
Repeat with remaining batter.

e531d7ab07.gt:
Cut the fat cap side off of the beef.
Rinse meat in water, then place in a slow cooker.
Sprinkle all sides of meat with salt generously.
Add up to 4 cups of baby carrots to the slow cooker.
Fill a large measuring cup with 4 cups of hot water.
Pour contents of seasoning envelope into the water and stir until blended.
Pour water and seasoning into the slow cooker.
Set slow cooker to cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
If you only have 6 to 8 hours for cooking, set slow cooker on high for the last 3 hours, or all of the cooking time.
Additional ingredients can be added to the slow cooker during preparation, such as: quartered red potatoes, sliced celery, sliced onions, green peas.
If adding these extra ingredients, you may need to use a smaller meat portion in order to fit everything in your slow cooker.
My preference is to cook the largest meat portion I can and prepare mashed potatoes just before serving.
This option provides enough meat for pot roast leftovers the next night and two nights of beef enchiladas through the week.
Check out my recipes for Easy Extraordinary Mashed Potatoes and Pot Roast Turned Enchiladas.
e531d7ab07.pred:
Put the meat in a crock pot.
Add in the onions, carrots, celery, and garlic.
Cover with water.
Add in the tomatoes, beef broth, and bay leaves.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.
Remove the meat and vegetables from the crock pot and place on a serving platter.
Slice the meat and serve with the vegetables.
Serve with mashed potatoes.

c78e924f69.gt:
Whisk mayonnaise, yogurt, vinegar and crushed red pepper to taste in a medium bowl.
Add pineapple and coleslaw mix and stir to combine.
Place cornmeal in a shallow dish.
Sprinkle both sides of fish with Cajun seasoning and salt.
Dredge the fish in the cornmeal.
Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add half the fish and cook until golden, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate and repeat with the remaining 2 teaspoons oil and fish, adjusting heat as needed to prevent burning.
Top toasted bread with the fish and pineapple slaw to make sandwiches.
Serve immediately.
