4ea5a98674.gt:
For the crust: combine the graham cracker crumbs, butter and sugar in a bowl and then press into an ungreased 13x9x2 dish.
Chill for 1/2 hour.
In a mixing bowl, cream butter, confectioners sugar, milk & vanilla.
Spread over crust, chill for 1/2 hour.
Layer strawberries, bananas, pineapple, and coconut (if desired).
Any fruit can be substituted and chocolate syrup can be added also.
Spread Cool Whip over the fruit.
Top with nuts or toasted coconut.
Keep refrigerated.
4ea5a98674.pred:
Strawberry Banana Split Cake:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Line a 9-inch round cake pan with parchment paper.
Mix together the cake ingredients in a large bowl.
Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Allow to cool completely before frosting.
Frosting:
Mix together the frosting ingredients in a large bowl.
Spread over the cooled cake.
Top with strawberries and bananas.
Garnish with whipped cream and a cherry.
Serve and enjoy!

08647377e3.gt:
Soak the kiriboshi daikon in water and then squeeze it to remove the excess water.
If there is water in the canned soybeans, drain them well.
Julienne the carrots.
Cut the bacon into thin strips.
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan.
Add the ingredients and stir-fry.
Season with salt and black pepper.
All done.
My recipe for quiche, "Easy!
Kiriboshi Daikon Quiche with Homemade Crust" uses this as a filling!
08647377e3.pred:
Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Cook in a pan with a little oil.
Stir fry until the daikon is tender.
Serve with a side of rice.

57a8e4271c.gt:
Pour ingredients into empty gallon container or empty gallon milk jug.
Fill the rest of the container with water.
Put into spray bottle and refill as needed.
57a8e4271c.pred:
Place all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour into a spray bottle and shake well before use.
Store in a cool, dry place.

579917be2c.gt:
Light the grill or heat the broiler.
Coat the chicken with 1 tablespoon of the oil and season with 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper.
Grill or broil until just done, 4 to 5 minutes per side.
Let the chicken rest for 5 minutes and then cut crosswise into 1/4-inch slices.
In a large pot of boiling, salted water, cook the fusilli until just done, about 13 minutes.
Drain, rinse with cold water, and drain thoroughly.
In a large bowl, toss the pasta with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
Add the chicken, artichoke hearts, scallions, parsley, the remaining 5 tablespoons oil, the vinegar, the remaining 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and the Parmesan to the pasta and toss well.
579917be2c.pred:
Chicken breast, pasta, artichokes, tomatoes, and olive oil.
Prepare the chicken breast by seasoning it with salt and pepper.
Boil the pasta according to the package directions.
While the pasta is cooking, cut the chicken breast into bite-sized pieces.
Remove the stems from the artichokes and cut them into quarters.
Cut the tomatoes into small pieces.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook until it is no longer pink.
Add the artichokes and tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes.
Drain the pasta and add it to the skillet.
Toss the pasta, chicken, artichokes, and tomatoes together.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

b653472a7b.gt:
In soup pot dissolve curry paste with water , add cherry tomato ,bring to the boil on medium heat
Prepare banana blossom while soup is boiling ,cut half on runny water or in water bowl
Cut into 4 pieces ,now select only white leaves,take off small young banana inside
Cut to small pieces, this always soak in water to prevent from color change
Add to soup pot,increase to high heat ,stir to let all sink in hot boil soup ,let it simmer about 15 mins
Add fishsauce,add green leaves ,stir to mix,heat off ,serve hot with sticky rice by northern thai way or with steamed jasmine rice
b653472a7b.pred:
Wash the banana blossoms, cut off the ends, and cut into 2-inch pieces.
Cut the onion into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the tomato into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the chilies into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the curry leaves into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the coconut into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the potato into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the pumpkin into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the garlic into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the ginger into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the cumin into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the coriander into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the turmeric into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut the salt into 1/2-inch pieces.
Heat a little oil in a pan.
Add the onion, tomato, chilies, curry leaves, coconut, potato, pumpkin, garlic, ginger, cumin, coriander, and turmeric.
Cook until the onion is soft.
Add the banana blossoms and salt.
Cook for 10 minutes.
Serve with rice.

fd91c2f3e6.gt:
Sift maizena and flour together
Add castor sugar
Rub butter into the dry ingredients and knead until a stiff dough its formed
Press dough into a 20 x 29cm greased baking tray
Mark the slices lightly and prick with a fork
Bake at 150C for 50 minutes
Once baked, drench the shortbread with castor sugar
Cut the shortbread into squares
Allow to cool and then enjoy
fd91c2f3e6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix together flour, sugar, butter, and cream cheese.
Knead dough until smooth.
Roll dough out to 1/4 inch thickness.
Cut into 2 inch squares.
Place squares on a greased cookie sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes.

89a10ab4d0.gt:
Soak chiles in hot water 15 min.
or until softened.
Drain chiles, reserving 1/4 cup of the soaking water; place chiles and reserved water in blender container.
Cover.
Blend on medium speed until smooth; set aside.
Heat dressing in large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add pork; cook and stir 5 min.
or until evenly browned.
Remove pork from skillet; set aside.
Add alcaparrado condiment, cloves and chile puree to skillet; cook 2 min.
Return pork to skillet.
Stir in broth; bring to boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat to medium-low; cover.
Simmer 30 min.
Add potatoes and peanuts; cover.
Cook 45 min.
until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally.
Top each serving with egg slices.
89a10ab4d0.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large pot, saute onions, garlic, and peppers in olive oil until soft.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Add potatoes, carrots, and tomatoes.
Add water and seasonings.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Cover and cook for 1 hour more.
Serve with rice.

54ea4ac023.gt:
Place the eggs into a saucepan in a single layer and fill with water to cover the eggs by 1 inch.
Cover the saucepan and bring the water to a boil over high heat.
Remove from the heat and let the eggs stand in the hot water for 15 minutes.
Drain.
Cool the eggs under cold running water.
Peel and chop the cooled eggs.
Cook the bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate; crumble once cool.
Combine the eggs, bacon, mayonnaise, mozzarella cheese, paprika, sugar, white wine vinegar, and mustard in a bowl to make a chunky dip.
Garnish with paprika.
54ea4ac023.pred:
Combine the yolks and mustard in a small bowl.
Add the mayonnaise, sour cream, and horseradish.
Mix well.
Add the remaining ingredients and mix until well blended.
Serve with crackers or chips.

59f0023fcf.gt:
Cut tops off peppers and remove insides
Mix ground beef, rice, and taco seasoning in mixing bowl
Fill peppers with mix.
You shouldn't have any left over.
Stuff them!
Place filled peppers in crock pot
Spoon a little rotel on top of each pepper.
Pour remainder into bottom of crockpot (gives a little extra juice)
Cook on low 6-8 hours and high 3-4 hours.
(The uncooked meat will cook the pepper.
No need to precook the beef or add any liquid)
20-30 minutes before meal time add cheese on top of each pepper.
Enjoy!
59f0023fcf.pred:
Cut peppers in half, remove seeds and membranes, and place in crockpot.
Add in the onion, garlic, ground beef, and seasonings.
Top with cheese.
Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.

b500700d75.gt:
Pre-heat oven
In a bowl, grate the carrots and apple
Mix flour, baking soda, baking powerd , sugar , salt ,cinnamon and walnuts
Add the eggs, oil , milk ,vanilla extract
Add the carrots and apple
Spoon equal amount into the muffin tray
Bake for 20-30 min
b500700d75.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine carrots, sugar, eggs, oil, and vanilla.
Stir in flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt.
Fill muffin cups 2/3 full with batter.
Bake 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

01483cc0de.gt:
Place the water and asparagus in a saucepan, and bring to a boil over medium heat.
Cook covered 5 minutes.
Remove cover and cook 1 or 2 minutes, until tender.
Drain and set aside, but keep warm.
Melt the margarine in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the turkey cutlets 2 to 3 minutes on each side, or until browned and no longer pink on the inside.
Remove turkey from the pan and set aside.
Add the garlic and shrimp to the already heated skillet.
Cook over medium-high heat 1 or 2 minutes, stirring constantly until the shrimp is heated through.
Prepare hollandaise sauce according to package directions.
Place each turkey cutlet on a plate.
Top with the asparagus and shrimp.
Spoon hollandaise sauce over all.
01483cc0de.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut 1 pound of boneless turkey into 1-inch cubes.
Season with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, saute onion, celery, and carrots in 1 tablespoon of butter until tender.
Remove from heat.
Add 1/2 cup of flour and stir until smooth.
Add 1/2 cup of chicken broth and stir until smooth.
Add 1/2 cup of white wine and stir until smooth.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir until smooth.
Add 1/2 teaspoon of thyme, 1/2 teaspoon of sage, 1/2 teaspoon of rosemary, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
Add 1/2 teaspoon of pepper.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped mushrooms and 1/2 cup of chopped green pepper.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped tomatoes.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped onion.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped celery.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped carrots.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped zucchini.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped squash.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped bell pepper.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped olives.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped artichoke hearts.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped pimientos.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped sun-dried tomatoes.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped capers.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped anchovies.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped pine nuts.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped pecans.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped hazelnuts.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped almonds.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped macadamia nuts.
Add 1/2 cup of chopped cashews.

0121dfda05.gt:
Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat.
Add shallots, ginger, and garlic and let cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Stir in peanut butter, turmeric, cumin, and curry paste and let cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Whisk in water, coconut milk, lime zest, brown sugar, and salt until combined.
Add tofu, sweet potato, and kale, and bring to a boil.
Let simmer, covered, for 30 minutes, or until sweet potatoes are fork tender.
Stir in lime juice and adjust seasoning to taste.
Garnish with cashews and serve over rice or quinoa.
0121dfda05.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large skillet, saute onion, garlic, and ginger in oil until onion is translucent.
Add curry paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add coconut milk, broth, and potatoes.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add carrots and peas and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add tofu and cook until heated through.
Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a casserole dish and bake for 30 minutes.

5b23053aa4.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Combine flours, Splenda, cocoa, and baking soda.
Add bananas, yogurt, egg whites, vanilla, and 1/2 cup walnuts.
Stir.
Coat a 9" x 13" cake pan with cooking spray.
Pour batter into pan, spreading evenly.
Bake about 35 minutes.
Cool.
Raise oven to 375F.
Toast remaining 1/4 cup walnuts 6 minutes.
To make frosting, pour 1/4 cup milk into a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Stir in Splenda, cocoa, and cornstarch.
Slowly add remaining 3/4 cup milk and bring to a low boil, stirring continuously until thick.
Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla.
Cool and spread over cake.
Sprinkle walnuts over cake.
5b23053aa4.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking pan.
Mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.
Add eggs, milk, and melted butter and mix well.
Add bananas and walnuts and mix until just combined.
Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool cake in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
Remove cake from pan and cool completely.
For the frosting, combine butter, cocoa powder, and milk in a small saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Cool frosting slightly.
Spread frosting over cooled cake.
Garnish with walnuts.

8fdec3f08f.gt:
Bring a saucepan of water to the boil, begin to cook the spaghetti
Prepare the topping.
Finely slice garlic, cut red pepper into thin strips, cut olives in half, cut crab sticks into cubes, slice salmon into small slices.
Shallow fry garlic, red pepper and olives until softened.
Add the crab sticks, salmon and shrimps and cook until it's pretty much there.
Throw in a dash of white wine and a dash of lemon juice.
Season to taste with salt, pepper, basil.
Drain spaghetti and combine with topping.
Generously slash it with olive oil.
Boom.
8fdec3f08f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain pasta and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and saute for 1 minute.
Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook until heated through.
Add cooked pasta and toss to combine.
Add cheese and toss to coat.
Transfer pasta to a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until heated through.
Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

669da1896f.gt:
Peel the pears, cut them into quarters and remove the cores.
Cut each quarter in half and put them in a bowl.
Shave the cheese with a vegetable peeler and mix three-quarters of it with the pears.
Beat the oil and the lemon juice together and add salt and pepper to taste.
Spoon about half this dressing over the pears and leave for 1 hour.
Spoon the pears into a deep dish and shower with the remaining cheese.
Surround with the rocket and drizzle the rest of the dressing over it.
Serve immediately.
Serves 4.
669da1896f.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Cut the pear into 1/2-inch slices.
Cut the cheese into 1/2-inch cubes.
Add the pear and cheese to the salad.
Serve with a light dressing.

dde6859b7c.gt:
1.
Brown turkey in a nonstick skillet over medium high heat.
After about 7 minutes, drain the liquid off and return the meat to the pan.
Cook another 3 to 5 minutes or until browned.
Drain and set aside.
2.
Add bell pepper, mushrooms, and onion to the skillet and cook about 3 minutes.
The onions and/or mushrooms should be softened.
Add the garlic and cumin; cook another minute.
3.
Add the turkey back to the veggies, then stir in the BBQ sauce, ketchup, hot sauce, and Worcestershire sauce.
Cook, stirring often, until heated through (about 5 minutes).
4.
Spoon mixture into hollowed out rolls (makes it a bit less messy) and serve with your favorite baked chips!
dde6859b7c.pred:
Brown turkey, BBQ sauce, onions, peppers, and mushrooms.
The Spicy BBQ Turkey Joes dish is a great way to spice up a traditional turkey joes.
To make the Spicy BBQ Turkey Joes, follow these steps:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2. Season the turkey with salt and pepper.
3. In a large skillet, brown the turkey on both sides.
4. Add BBQ sauce and cook until the turkey is fully coated.
5. Add onions, peppers, and mushrooms.
6. Cover and cook until the turkey is cooked through, about 15 minutes.
7. Serve over rice or noodles.
Enjoy!

aff56897c3.gt:
Combine all ingredients and stir.
Serve with sprinkled Parmesan cheese on top.
aff56897c3.pred:
Rice and Peas is a popular Caribbean dish.
To cook this dish, you will need the following ingredients: rice, black pepper, salt, water, and black-eyed peas.
Place the rice in a saucepan and add water to cover the rice.
Bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer.
Cover the saucepan and cook for 20 minutes, or until the rice is tender.
Drain the rice and set it aside.
In a separate pan, heat some oil and saute the black pepper and salt.
Add the black-eyed peas and cook for 5 minutes, or until they are heated through.
Add the rice to the pan and mix well.
Serve hot.

646d990717.gt:
Cut the chicken breast into thin slices.
Soak dried shiitake mushrooms in lukewarm water until soft.
Cut off hard stems and cut in halves.
Cut onion into thin slices.
Chop cilantro.
In a large skillet with a lid, mix all the simmering sauce ingredients and bring to a boil.
Add chicken, mushrooms and onion and cook over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes, or until chicken is done and onion is tender.
Beat eggs in a small bowl, then pour over the chicken and cover with a lid.
Cook until the egg is set, about 1 minute on low heat.
Sprinkle cilantro on top.
To serve: put about 1 1/4 cup of rice in a large, deep bowl and gently lay 1/4 of the chicken and egg mixture on top.
Pour simmering sauce over and serve immediately.

33b543f946.gt:
Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
Fry mustard seeds in oil until they begin to pop.
Add red pepper flakes and shallot and saute until shallot is soft.
Add garbanzos, turmeric, cumin, ginger, salt and enough water to prevent sticking.
Simmer for 15 minutes.
Sprinkle with cilantro and serve.
33b543f946.pred:
Chickpeas, onions, garlic, curry powder, salt, pepper, olive oil, and water.
I.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large pot, combine chickpeas, onions, garlic, curry powder, salt, and pepper.
Cook over medium heat until onions are translucent.
Add olive oil and stir to coat.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in more water if necessary.
Cover and cook for 30 minutes, or until chickpeas are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.

e827f8e8c3.gt:
In a medium bowl, combine the soy sauce, dark soy and cornstarch.
Whisk to blend well, and add the chicken to the sauce.
Toss to evenly coat the chicken and set aside for 15 to 20 minutes.
In a medium bowl, combine the ketchup, stock, chili garlic sauce and sugar.
Stir to combine and set aside until ready to use.
Place a wok over high heat and add the vegetable oil to the pan.
Swirl the wok to be sure to coat well with the oil.
Add the ginger, garlic, green onions, dried chilies and jalapenos to the wok.
Cook, stirring often until the garlic is fragrant and the chilies begin to brown, about 20 to 30 seconds.
Add the chicken, bell peppers and onions to the pan and stir-fry until the chicken is no longer pink, about 4 to 5 minutes.
Add the sauce to the pan and bring to a boil, being sure to toss well in order to coat all the chicken and vegetables evenly, about 1 to 2 minutes.
Sprinkle the sesame seeds, sesame oil and cilantro into the pan and toss to combine.
Remove from the heat and serve on a platter with steamed white rice.
e827f8e8c3.pred:
Sichuan pepper chicken is a popular Chinese dish.
It is made with chicken, Sichuan pepper, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and sometimes red pepper flakes.
To make the dish, first marinate the chicken in a mixture of soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and Sichuan pepper.
The chicken should be left to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Next, heat a wok or frying pan with oil and fry the chicken until it is cooked through.
The chicken should be stir-fried until it is golden brown.
Once the chicken is cooked, add the marinade and cook for a few minutes.
The sauce will thicken as it cooks.
Serve the chicken with rice or noodles.

903a5e2cd4.gt:
Pop Trader Joe's frozen brown rice in the microwave, or make a batch of rice the traditional way.
While rice is cooking, make the dressing by whisking together half of the chopped garlic, tahini, lemon zest, lemon juice, and 3 tbs.
olive oil.
Add the hot water to thin a bit, and then 2 teaspoons salt.
Set aside.
Add 3 tbs.
olive oil to a big skillet over medium-high heat, swirling to coat the pan.
Be sure the chickpeas are completely dry, or they'll spit at you during this next step!
Add the chickpeas and a sprinkling of salt.
Let the beans saute for a couple minutes, until they get a toasty little crust on them.
Add remaining garlic and onions.
Stir for a minute.
Stir in the asparagus with another pinch or two of salt, then cover with a lid for a minute to steam until the asparagus softens a touch.
Uncover and stir in the rice and almond slivers, reserving a few almonds for garnish.
Adjust seasonings, adding more salt if needed.
Serve family-style in a big bowl drizzled with a few tablespoons of the tahini dressing, letting each person add more dressing to their tastes.
Watch as this magical concoction disappears before your eyes!
903a5e2cd4.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil.
Add 1 cup of rice, 1/2 cup of asparagus, and 1/2 cup of chickpeas.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork.
In a small bowl, mix 1/2 cup of almonds, 1/2 cup of olive oil, 1/4 cup of lemon juice, 1/4 cup of honey, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt.
Pour over rice and asparagus mixture.
Stir to combine.
Spread in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve warm.

1690800ec2.gt:

Meanwhile put butter, lemon and garlic in a saucepan over very, very low.
Let it simmer for 20-30 minutes.
Discard lemon and garlic.
When potatoes are done, drain and mashed to your liking.
Fold in avocado and butter.

Place haddock and water in a dutch oven and heat to boiling.
Cover and reduce heat to low and simmer approximately 10-15 minutes or until the fish is white and flakes easily.

Slice bananas and lay them out on cookie sheets, put into freezer for about 2 hours.

It does take a lil while but once it reaches the creaminess u like you can serve it as is and it will be more like a custard or put into a container and put into freezer til nice and thick like ice cream.

That's it!!!
Enjoy!!

Salt the zucchini lightly and let it sit for 15 minutes.
Squeeze out all the excess moisture using your hands.
I usually put enough into my palm and and squeeze.
Repeat as necessary.
Combine all crust ingredients except the olive oil, and spread into an olive oiled 9 x 13 inch baking pan.
Bake 20-25 minutes until the surface is dry and firm.
Brush the top with olive oil and broil it, under moderate heat for 5 minutes.
Do not let it burn.
Spread the pizza or tomato sauce evenly over the crust and scatter olives, green peppers, onions, mushrooms, artichoke hearts, mozzarella cheese, Swiss cheese, and Parmesan cheese over the crust or use your own topping of choice and bake in a 350 F oven for about 20-25 minutes.
Remove from oven and scatter fresh basil leaves.

Serve hot, cut into squares.
Eaten with fork and knife.

79efd7e435.gt:
Grate 1 teaspoon zest from 1 orange and reserve.
Cut peel, including white pith, from oranges with a sharp knife.

Add escarole, endive, and orange segments to vinaigrette and gently toss.

Serve immediately.

Place the potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water.

Stir in onion and cook until transparent, about 5 minutes.
Add meats and brown until no longer pink, 10 to 12 minutes; stir in Cajun seasoning and garlic powder; drain fat.
Cool to room temperature.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of 1/4 inch.
Use a 5 inch diameter round cookie cutter or cut around a saucer to make a round of dough.
Place a heaping tablespoon of meat filling in the center of each round.
Fold dough over filling and seal edges closed by pressing with a fork or fingers.
Repeat to make 15 pies, re-rolling dough scraps as needed.
Heat oil for frying in deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Drain on paper towels.
Or bake pies on greased cookie sheets in preheated 350 degree F (175 degrees C) oven 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden brown.

Stir just until moistened (batter should be lumpy).

Line twelve 2-1/2-inch muffin cups with paper bake cups.
Fill the cups 3/4 full with batter.
Bake in a 400 degree F. oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until muffins are golden.
Remove the muffins from the pans.
In a small bowl, combine powdered sugar, orange peel and enough orange juice (2 to 3 teaspoons) to make a drizzling consistency.
Drizzle over warm muffins.
4ff0a3ff39.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, orange juice, and vanilla.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Fold in chopped nuts.
Spoon batter into greased muffin tins and bake for 20 minutes.

243f0c78f6.gt:
In a small bowl, combine dressing ingredients, whisk and set aside.
In a really large salad bowl, combine cabbage, lettuce, cilantro and green onions and toss gently.
Sprinkle in the sesame seeds and peanuts.
Add the chicken.
Pour in the dressing and toss.
Enjoy!
243f0c78f6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and carrots.
In a small bowl, whisk together the dressing ingredients.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Spread the salad on a large baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool.
Slice the chicken breasts into strips.
In a large bowl, combine the chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, carrots, and dressing.
Toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

608984ae45.gt:
Melt butter in 1-quart saucepan until sizzling; add onion.
Cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, 2-3 minutes or until softened.
Stir in flour, thyme and pepper.
Reduce heat to medium; stir in chicken broth and half & half.
Cook, stirring occasionally, 2-4 minutes or until smooth and bubbly.
Serve gravy over chicken, biscuits and/or potatoes.
608984ae45.pred:
Cream, flour, butter, and milk.
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve over meat or potatoes.

ccc0ef6d85.gt:
Melt butter in large skillet over medium-low heat.
Add leeks; saute until tender, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir in parsley.
Cool.
Spread leek topping evenly over pizza shell; sprinkle tomatoes over.
Top with cheese.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon oil over.
Bake about 10 minutes at 450 F.
Remove from oven and brush crust with olive oil.
ccc0ef6d85.pred:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
Place pizza dough on a lightly floured surface and roll out to a 12-inch circle.
Spread pizza sauce evenly over the dough.
Arrange leeks, tomatoes, and goat cheese on the pizza.
Bake for 10 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

b85277a635.gt:
In a large bowl, mix together the ginger, soy sauce, sake and mirin.
Add the sliced pork, cover, and marinate for about 1 hour.
Heat the oil in a skillet or wok over high heat.
Add the pork, and fry until brown.
The pork should have a dark crispy look to it.
Do not cook on low or medium heat, as the juices will not cook fast enough to get a crispy texture.
Discard leftover marinade.
b85277a635.pred:
Place the pork in a large pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes.
Remove the pork from the water and set aside to cool.
Once cooled, cut the pork into bite-sized pieces.
In a small bowl, mix together the ginger, soy sauce, and sake.
Pour the mixture over the pork and marinate for 10 minutes.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the pork and cook for 5 minutes, turning occasionally.
Add the onions and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the carrots and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the ginger and garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the marinade and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve over rice.

b8e018f7cd.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Spray lined baking sheet with cooking spray.
Remove eyes and scrape away bruises and dice potatoes.
Add olive oil, salt, pepper and any other seasonings you like and toss to coat.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, turn and bake for another 15-20 minutes.
b8e018f7cd.pred:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch thick slices.
Place potatoes on a baking sheet.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Bake for 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
Serve hot.

d4627b79b5.gt:
Line a 4 1/2-by-8 1/2-inch loaf pan with 2 sheets of plastic wrap, leaving a 3-inch overhang on long sides.
In a blender, puree raspberries and sugar, scraping down sides as needed.
Strain through a fine-mesh sieve, pressing on solids; discard solids.
In a large bowl, whip cream until soft peaks form.
With a rubber spatula, fold in lemon curd.
Spoon 2 cups cream mixture into pan and smooth top.
Dip ladyfingers in raspberry puree and arrange in pan, parallel to long edges.
Pour remaining raspberry puree on ladyfingers.
Top with remaining cream mixture and smooth top.
Wrap pan with overhanging plastic and freeze 8 hours (or up to 2 weeks).
To serve, invert onto a serving platter, remove plastic, and slice.
Looking for more dessert ideas?
Check out our homemade chocolate chip cookie recipes, apple pie recipes, and chocolate cake recipes.
d4627b79b5.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup of raspberries and 1/2 cup of sugar.
Cook over medium heat until the raspberries have softened and the sugar has dissolved.
Remove from heat and let cool.
In a large bowl, beat 1 cup of heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Fold in the cooled raspberry mixture.
Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish and chill in the refrigerator until firm.
In a small bowl, whisk 1 egg yolk with 1 tablespoon of sugar.
Pour over the chilled raspberry mixture and chill until firm.
Slice into 1-inch squares and serve.

eec8247b03.gt:
Bring water to a boil in a saucepan; add rice and red pepper flakes.
Cover saucepan with a lid and remove from heat; let stand until water is absorbed, about 5 minutes.
Fluff rice with a fork and cool, about 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir rice until coated in oil, 15 to 20 seconds.
Add egg to wok; cook and stir until scrambled and cooked through, 1 to 2 minutes.
Stir green onions and garlic into rice mixture and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add cabbage, pineapple, cilantro, and bean sprouts to rice mixture; cook and stir until cabbage starts to wilt, about 5 minutes.
Stir soy sauce into rice mixture and cook for 30 seconds more.
eec8247b03.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the rice, eggs, and vegetables.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the oil and cook the rice and vegetables until the rice is tender and the vegetables are crisp-tender.
Pour the egg mixture into the rice and vegetable mixture and stir to combine.
Transfer the mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until the egg mixture is set.
Serve hot.

2d86850b18.gt:
Mix all ingredients thoroughly and turn out onto a floured board, knead lightly and then roll out gently and cut into biscuits.
Brush lightly with melted butter or margarine.
Place of greased cookie sheet and bake at 450 degrees for about 15 minutes.
2d86850b18.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in the milk and egg until dough comes together.
Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth.
Roll dough out to 1/2 inch thickness.
Cut dough into 2 inch squares.
Place squares on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

fbb3258d67.gt:
In a very large skillet, heat 3 tablespoons of the olive oil.
Season the shrimp with salt and pepper, add to the skillet and cook over moderately high heat until lightly browned, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate.
In the same skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
Add the garlic and chiles and cook over moderately low heat, stirring, until softened, about 1 minute.
Add the clam juice and bring to a boil, then simmer over moderate heat until the broth has reduced by one-fourth, about 3 minutes.
Whisk in the butter a few cubes at a time until incorporated.
Add the shrimp and cherry tomatoes, season with salt and pepper and simmer until the shrimp are just cooked through, about 2 minutes longer.
Stir in the lemon juice, cilantro and chives and serve.

Shrimp, garlic, butter, and chile.

The sauce is cooked until it is reduced and thickened.
I serve the shrimp with the sauce.

Pour oatmeal into a bowl and top with avocado.
e8a204dd36.pred:
Miso, oats, milk, and honey.
Miso Oatmeal Bowl:
In a small pot, combine 1 tablespoon of miso paste, 1 cup of oats, and 1 cup of milk.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and stir in 1 tablespoon of honey.
Serve immediately.
Miso is a Japanese seasoning made from fermented soybeans, and it is salty and earthy in flavor.
Oats are a whole grain that is high in fiber, protein, and complex carbohydrates.
Milk is a good source of calcium and vitamin D.
Honey is a natural sweetener that adds a touch of sweetness to the dish.

02f021290a.gt:
Cream butter & sugar, add eggs (1 at a time) beating after each one.
Dissolve baking soda in buttermilk.
Add to creamed mixture.
Add dates and orange slice to flour to coat.
Add coconut.
Combine the two mixtures.
Makes stiff dough that should be mixed with your hands.
Bake in a greased and floured 13x9x3 pan at 250* for 2 1/2 hours.
Combine orange juice and powered sugar and our over the hot cake.
Let it stand over night before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.

2cf467b3f7.gt:
Season all sides of the beef with a fair amount of salt and pepper.
In a large Dutch oven, or other heavy pot that has a tight cover, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over moderately high heat.
Add the garlic and the beef to the pot, browning the meat on all sides, taking the time to get a nice crust on the outside.
Add the onion and allow to lightly brown, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the crushed tomatoes, plus 1 tomato can of water, spices, season with salt and pepper, to taste, and add enough water to cover the meat.
Bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer with a lid for 3 hours, or until the meat is fork tender.
Let meat cool some in the liquid.
Shred meat and place in store bought taco shells, make your own taco shells, or even roll up in warm flour tortillas.
Garnish with lettuce, cheese and chopped tomatoes--if desired.
2cf467b3f7.pred:
Put the pot roast in a large pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer.
Cook for 2 hours, or until the meat is tender.
Remove the meat from the pot and let it cool.
When the meat is cool enough to handle, shred it into bite-sized pieces.
Put the pot back on the stove over medium heat and add the onions, garlic, and chiles.
Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes.
Add the shredded meat, beans, tomatoes, and chicken broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer.
Cook for 1 hour, or until the sauce is thick and flavorful.
Serve the pot roast in tacos with the sauce on top.

9141916c8a.gt:
Cream butter and flour together, add to hot juice.
Stir quickly or use egg beater to smooth.
Cook until it thickens.
Heat milk until slight scum forms, lower heat, add tomato mixture slowly, stirring constantly.
Salt to taste.
Serve hot with buttered popcorn or crackers.

Cut tomatoes in half, put them in a pot with water, add a little salt and sugar, and cook for 10 minutes.
Add a little butter, then blend until smooth.
Serve hot.

acbf7b5cb9.gt:
Combine flour, salt and pepper in a bag.
Add ribs and coat well.
In skillet, brown ribs in butter; place in slow cooker.
To same skillet add all remaining ingredients.
Cook and stir until mixture boils.
Pour over ribs.
Cover and cook on low for 9 hours.

a004c9c6ff.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F Butter 8x8x2-inch glass baking dish.
Cook sausage in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat until brown, breaking into small pieces with back of spoon, about 5 minutes.
Mix in flour, then milk.
Cook until mixture thickens and comes to boil, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
Layer potatoes in prepared dish.
Top with 1/3 of green onions, 1 cup cheese, 1/3 of green onions, sausage mixture, sprinkle the herbs on top, and the remaining 1/4 cup cheese.
Bake casserole until potatoes are tender, about 45 minutes.
Sprinkle with remaining green onions and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cook sausage in a skillet over medium heat until browned.
Drain fat and set aside.

Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Top with browned sausage and hash browns.
Bake for 30 minutes.

d8f274c0df.gt:
Chill the bowl of a stand mixer and the whisk attachment in the freezer for 10 minutes.
Place all of the ingredients in the bowl and whisk on high speed until medium peaks form, about 1 to 2 minutes.
(Alternatively, you can use a hand whisk and a large chilled bowl.
Whisk all of the ingredients until medium peaks form, about 5 to 6 minutes.)
Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, mix together the cream, egg yolks, and vanilla.

Whip with a hand mixer until it forms soft peaks.

Let it simmer for 30 minutes, or until all the vegetables have softened.

Ladle the soup into bowls and grate the fresh Parmesan over top.
Recipe slightly adapted from Cannelle et Vanillecannellevanille.com.

Mince Garlic.

60a456e88d.gt:
In a medium saucepan of boiling water, cook the bulgur until al dente, about 10 minutes.

Spinach, apples, and green onions.

bb41f986c4.gt:

b384c81283.gt:

Crisp topping.

7f9c7a1b1f.gt:
About one hour before smoking, coat both sides of ribs with a little vegetable oil and sprinkle with Chinese 5 spice.
Set aside at room temperature for 1 hour.
Heat charcoal or gas grill for indirect cooking at 230 to 250 degrees F. Add drained wood chips, if using.
Place the ribs, meaty side down, over a drip pan and cook for 2 hours.
Add about 12 coals to a charcoal grill every 45 minutes or so to maintain the heat.
Remove ribs from grill.
Double-wrap each rack in heavy-duty aluminum foil.
Return wrapped ribs to the grill and cook for 1 1/2 to 2 hours more over indirect heat, until very tender.
Add more coals as needed to maintain temperature for a charcoal grill.
Meanwhile, make the glaze.
Combine all ingredients in small saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat; reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove ribs from grill and unwrap.
Place ribs over direct heat on grill and brush with honey red pepper glaze.
Cook for about 5 minutes until the glaze is set.
Turn ribs and repeat with more glaze.
7f9c7a1b1f.pred:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a small bowl, combine the honey, soy sauce, and garlic.
Place the ribs in a baking dish and pour the honey mixture over them.
Bake for 1 hour, basting the ribs with the honey mixture every 15 minutes.
Remove the ribs from the oven and let them cool for 5 minutes.
Serve with rice and a green vegetable.

3d317eada1.gt:
Prepare berry blue jello according to directions on box.
Pour into 13x9 baking dish and place in the refrigerator.
Allow to chill until firm, about 1 hour.
Prepare lemon flavored gelatin using 1 cup of boiling water.
Beat cream cheese slightly and then add the lemon gelatin mixture.
Beat gelatin and cream cheese until smooth.
Set aside and allow to cool to room temperature.
Once the cream cheese mixture has cooled, fold in the whipped topping until mixed thoroughly.
Pour this mixture over the firmly set bottom layer.
Return to the refrigerator and chill until firm, about 1 hour.
Prepare raspberry jello according to directions on box.
Cool this mixture until room temperature and then pour over the middle cream cheese layer.
Return the 3 layers to the refrigerator and chill until top layer is firm.
Cut into squares to serve.
Top with a little whipped topping and a couple of blueberries, if desired.

Stir until dissolved.
Pour into 8 ounce jars.
Refrigerate until set.

e993bcfbe8.gt:
Wash the beans.
In a large pot, cover them with cold water.
Soak for 6-8 hours.
Drain into a colander.
In the same pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat, add the onion and garlic, and saute until soft.
Add the beans and water or stock.
Cover and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low, add the rosemary, and simmer 2 hours or until the beans are tender.
Raise heat to high, add the pasta, and cook until al dente.
Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper, garnish with the chopped parsey.
Serve accompanied by grated Parmesan cheese and the optional extra-virgin olive oil.
e993bcfbe8.pred:
Pasta Fagioli is a traditional Italian soup that is easy to make and very satisfying.
It is made with pasta (usually small shells or ditalini), beans, tomatoes, and a variety of vegetables.
To make Pasta Fagioli, you will need the following ingredients:
1. Pasta (small shells or ditalini)
2. Beans (cannellini or great northern beans)
3. Tomatoes (canned or fresh)
4. Onion
5. Garlic
6. Olive oil
7. Salt and pepper
8. Vegetables (carrots, celery, zucchini, green beans, etc.)
9. Water or broth
10. Herbs (basil, parsley, oregano)
11. Ground black pepper
12. Optional: Parmesan cheese and/or grated Pecorino Romano cheese
To make Pasta Fagioli, follow these steps:
1. Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling water until al dente.
2. While the pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
3. Add the onion and garlic and saute until softened.
4. Add the tomatoes, carrots, celery, zucchini, and green beans and cook for 5 minutes.
5. Add the beans, water or broth, salt, pepper, and herbs.
6. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
7. Add the pasta to the soup and cook for 5 minutes.
8. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
9. Serve the soup hot with Parmesan or Pecorino Romano cheese, if desired.

4eef71a937.gt:

about 6 minutes.

87047dd9ed.gt:
Butter an 8x8 inch (20cmx20cm) pan or line it with parchment paper leaving a 2-inch/5 cm paper overhang on two sides.

5af1409bc9.gt:

6fe5e21aec.gt:

Transfer mixture to a 1 1/2 quart gratin dish, making sure that you dont compress (or squash, or moosh, or squish) it!
Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top.
Bake at 350 F until the top is golden brown, about 30 minutes.

Recipe slightly adapted from williams-sonoma.com via Strip House.
6fe5e21aec.pred:

Saute for about 7 minutes, or until the zucchini is lightly browned.
Add the garlic, olives, cumin, and coriander, and saute for 2 minutes more.
Add the salsa verde and black beans and cook for 5 minutes.
The salsa should reduce a bit so its not soupy.
Mix the ingredients for the Garlic-Lemon Yogurt if your using.
Warm the tortillas in a skillet or wrap in a moist towel & nuke for a minute.
Assembly the tacos by adding the filling, yogurt, and topping with scallions.
Enjoy!
4efef5709b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine black beans, zucchini, olive oil, onion, garlic, cumin, chili powder, and salt.
Mix well and set aside.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the taco seasoning and cook for 1 minute.
Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
Add the beans, zucchini, and olives.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and set aside.
To assemble the tacos, place a tortilla on a plate.
Spoon a generous amount of the beef mixture onto the tortilla.
Top with shredded cheese, if desired.
Fold the tortilla in half and serve.

62880ae3e8.gt:
Place the potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water.
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.
Drain and allow to steam dry for a minute or two.
Return the drained potatoes to the pot.
Pour the vegetable broth, thyme, rosemary, oregano, basil, onion powder, parsley, sage, and garlic over the potatoes; mash with a potato masher.
62880ae3e8.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender.
Drain and mash with butter, milk, salt, and pepper.
Add in cheese and mix well.
Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Serve with your favorite Italian dish.

0e47e93343.gt:
Place pork in a wide nonstick frying pan.
Drain about 1/2 cup liquid from tomatoes into pan.
Bring to a boil over high heat; then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Uncover pan; add onions, celery, oregano, and sage.
Cook over high heat, stirring often, until liquid has evaporated and drippings are browned (8 to 10 minutes).
Add bay leaves.
Cut up tomatoes then add tomatoes and their remaining liquid and stir to scrape browned bits free.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30 more minutes.
Stir in bell pepper and chilies; cover and continue to cook stirring occasionally until pork is very tender when pierced (about 15 more minutes).
If chili is too thin, uncover and simmer until it's as thick as you like.
Skim and discard fat, if necessary.
To serve, spoon chili over rice and garnish with cilantro sprigs.
0e47e93343.pred:
Brown ground beef, add onions, peppers, garlic, and spices.
Cook until meat is browned.
Add tomatoes, beans, and chiles.
Simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve with tortillas.

fa63e5df5b.gt:
Preheat the oven to 425.
Season the chicken breast with 1/8 teaspoon each of sea salt and freshly ground pepper.
In a small pan, heat 1 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil over medium high heat.
Add the chicken and cook for 1 minute.
Turn the chicken, reduce the heat, cover and cook for 8 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat and leave covered for 10 minutes, then shred the chicken with 2 forks.
In a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, water, soy sauce, garlic and the remaining sea salt and freshly ground pepper and whisk to combine.
In an 8-inch-square baking dish, combine the shredded chicken, onion, egg noodles, the cheese, broccoli and the sauce and mix thoroughly.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 10 minutes.
Uncover the dish, stir well and bake for 15 minutes, until the noodles are cooked and the sauce has thickened.
Remove from the oven and let sit for 5 minutes before serving.
fa63e5df5b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix broccoli, chicken, and cheese.
Spread mixture into a greased casserole dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serve with a salad or rice.

917795ebdc.gt:
These are the ingredients.
Chop the chicken into large bite-sized pieces, then season with Magic Salt (or salt and pepper).
Heat olive oil in a frying pan, saute garlic until aromatic, then fry both sides of the chicken, starting with the skin side down.
Once both sides of the chicken are golden brown, add the mushrooms and lightly saute.
Pour in the white wine (or sake), steam-cook for 10 to 15 minutes.
Taste once the broth boils down, and season to taste, add butter, stir until its coated evenly over the chicken and mushrooms, then it's ready to serve.
Garnish with minced green onions or parsley.
917795ebdc.pred:
Chicken, Mushrooms, White Wine (or Sake), and Onions.
Chicken and Mushrooms Steamed in White Wine (or Sake)
Ingredients:
Chicken (1 pound)
Mushrooms (1 pound)
White Wine (1 cup)
Sake (1 cup)
Onions (1/2 cup)
Salt and Pepper
Sesame Oil
Sauce:
Mix the ingredients together in a bowl.
Chicken:
Place the chicken in a steamer basket and steam for 10 minutes.
Mushrooms:
Place the mushrooms in a steamer basket and steam for 5 minutes.
Onions:
Place the onions in a steamer basket and steam for 2 minutes.
Salt and Pepper:
Season the chicken, mushrooms, and onions with salt and pepper.
Sesame Oil:
Heat the sesame oil in a frying pan and add the chicken, mushrooms, and onions.
Sauce:
Add the sauce to the frying pan and mix well.
Serve immediately.

6ea1219c93.gt:
Chop the sweet potato into small cubes, and soak in water to remove the bitterness.
Transfer to a heatproof dish, wrap in plastic wrap, and microwave (for 2 to 3 minutes at 500W).
Heat water and sugar in a sauce pan, and add the sweet potatoes once the sugar dissolves.
Simmer until the liquid boils out.
Bring the eggs to room temperature.
Sift together the almond powder, cake flour, cinnamon, and baking powder.
Microwave or double boil the butter to melt.
Beat the egg in a bowl, add the brown sugar and honey, and mix well.
There's no need to beat until foamy.
Sift in the dry ingredients, stir until smooth, then add the rum.
Mix in the melted butter, a little at a time, then add about half of the boiled sweet potatoes and lightly mix.
Pour into small baking cups, top with the remaining sweet potatoes, and sprinkle black sesame seeds.
Bake for about 20 minutes in an oven at 170C.
6ea1219c93.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut sweet potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes.
Place sweet potatoes in a large bowl and cover with water.
Let stand for 1 hour.
Drain and pat dry.
Mix sweet potatoes with the rest of the ingredients in a large bowl.
Mix well.
Pour into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.

8367b4bf0f.gt:
Cook the onion in a pan with a small bit of butter until soft.
Stir in the flour to create almost a roux for a minute or so.
Stir in the milk, a little at a time, and then bring up to boiling point.
Add the remaining ingredients and wait until the cheese has hit melting point.
Taste and season accordingly, serve warm with bread.
(I only need to add pepper).
8367b4bf0f.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large pot, saute onions in butter until soft and golden.
Add flour and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in broth, milk, and cheese.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

9181bac2c8.gt:
Place the onion, parsley, vinegar, mustard, mayonnaise, honey, salt, pepper, and lime zest in the bowl of a small food processor or blender.
Process until thoroughly blended.
Serve immediately, or place in a covered container and refrigerate until needed.
9181bac2c8.pred:

. 1/2 cup mustard
. 1/2 cup honey
. 1/4 cup olive oil
. 1/4 cup vinegar

. 1/2 teaspoon dried marjoram

2878092da0.gt:
Combine all dry ingredients with a whisk.
In a separate bowl whisk all wet ingredients together.
Combine wet ingredients into dry by using a wooden spoon or spatula.
Batter needs to be very thick and lumpy -- This is correct.
Make sure that you either use a griddle set at 350 degrees or a cast iron skillet over medium heat.
(make sure that you put 2 tsp of cooking oil in the skillet before you start.
Once you start you don't need to add any cooking oil.
Cooking spray may be acceptable.
).
Using a 1/3 cup pour batter onto griddle using a swirling motion to flatten out.
When the batter starts to bubble, flip the pancake.
To keep warm we store them in a tortilla warmer.
For left overs they can be frozen, just place wax paper in between cakes and freeze in a zip lock.
When you want one just pull out and microwave.
2878092da0.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Pour the batter onto a hot griddle or skillet coated with cooking spray.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface and the edges are dry.
Flip the pancakes and cook until golden brown on the other side.
Serve with butter and syrup.

3fff1d1389.gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Cut a 2-inch pocket in the thickest part of each chicken breast.
In a small bowl combine the Feta and the chopped olives, then stuff 1/2 of mixture into each pocket.
In a nonstick skillet, heat 2 Tbs.
olive oil on medium to high heat.
Season the chicken with pepper and add it to the skillet, cooking 2 minutes on each side or until brown.
Transfer to an oven safe baking dish, drizzled with 1 Tbs.
olive oil and bake for 18 minutes.
In a bowl mix tomato, kosher salt, onion, garlic, basil and parley.
When chicken is 5 minutes from being finished, put the remaining olive oil in the skillet, add tomato mix and heat through.
Serve chicken with tomato mix on top.
3fff1d1389.pred:
Chicken breasts, olive oil, lemon, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, and tomatoes.
I used a chicken breast, olive oil, lemon, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, and tomatoes.
I started by seasoning the chicken with salt and pepper.
Then, I cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Next, I put the chicken in a bowl and covered it with olive oil.
I squeezed the juice of a lemon over the chicken.
I added garlic, oregano, and tomatoes to the bowl.
I mixed everything together and let it marinate for 20 minutes.
I heated a pan over medium heat and cooked the chicken for 10 minutes on each side.
I served the chicken with lemon wedges and fresh oregano.

3d81546407.gt:
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in gin, lemon juice, lime juice, simple syrup, and dash of bitters.
Cover and shake rapidly.
Strain into a highball glass full of ice.
Pour in lemon and lime spritzer and stir.
Garnish with the lime slice.
Unleash the monkey.
3d81546407.pred:
Mix together all ingredients in a bowl.
Mix well.
Form into 12 balls.
Roll in powdered sugar.
Store in an airtight container.
Store in the refrigerator.

caf3797f1b.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Butter and flour 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Combine flour, sugar, ground ginger, baking powder, cinnamon, 3/4 teaspoon salt, nutmeg, allspice, and cloves in large bowl; whisk to combine.
Whisk eggs, oil, milk, and 1 teaspoon vanilla in medium bowl to combine.
Pour egg mixture over dry ingredients; stir until just combined.
Stir in parsnips and walnuts.
Transfer batter to prepared pan.
Bake until tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 25 minutes.
Cool cake completely in pan on rack.
Beat cream cheese and butter in large bowl until smooth.
Beat in fresh ginger and remaining 1/8 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla.
Gradually add powdered sugar and beat until frosting is smooth.
Spread over cake.
(Can be prepared 1 day ahead.
Cover and chill.)
caf3797f1b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix together flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and allspice.
Beat together sugar and eggs.
Add the oil and vanilla.
Stir in the dry ingredients.
Add parsnips and mix well.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Cool.
Beat together cream cheese and butter.
Add powdered sugar and ginger.
Spread on top of cooled cake.

7384993dda.gt:
Mix gin, rum, vodka, tequila, triple sec, Midori, blue curacao and sour mix together.
Shake well and pour into Hurricane glass.
Then add a splash of 7-up to the top and serve.
7384993dda.pred: Mix all ingredients together and cook for 10 minutes.

bf6be1f473.gt:
Drain tuna.
Combine mayonnaise & pepper relish, stir into tuna.
Place spinach & diced onion in the bowl and top with tuna, shredded cheese & crumbled bacon.
bf6be1f473.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Wash and dry spinach.
Cut up tuna into bite-sized pieces.
Cook tuna in a nonstick skillet over medium heat until it flakes easily with a fork.
Remove from heat and drain.
Place tuna in a bowl and add the spinach.
In a small bowl, mix together the dressing ingredients.
Pour dressing over the tuna and spinach and toss to coat.
Spread the salad on a baking sheet and bake in the oven for 10 minutes.
Serve immediately.

fd78cf3ab6.gt:
Cut the tortillas into quarters.
In a large skillet, heat the oil and fry the tortilla pieces until crunchy.
Lower the heat to low.
Add the red chile sauce and mix gently through the tortilla pieces.
Top with the shredded cheese and cook until the cheese just starts to melt.
Remove from the heat and serve with your choice of eggs.
Garnish with chopped green and red onions.
For the sauce: Remove the stems, seeds and veins from the chile pods.
Rinse with cold water.
Add the chiles to a pot and add enough water just to cover them.
Bring to a boil and simmer covered for 20 minutes.
After 10 minutes turn the chiles over to cook evenly.
Drain and cool.
In a blender, mix 3 cups of water, half of the cooked chile pods, 3 Tablespoons flour, 2 cloves garlic and half the salt.
Blend until smooth.
Strain the sauce removing any seeds.
Repeat this process with the rest of the ingredients and set aside to cool.
Recipe from Muy Bueno Cook Book.
fd78cf3ab6.pred:
Chilaquiles Rojas is a Mexican breakfast dish that is easy to make and can be made with a few simple ingredients.
The dish is made up of fried tortilla chips that are then topped with salsa, red sauce, and cheese.
To make Chilaquiles Rojas, you will need: 1. Fried tortilla chips 2. Salsa 3. Red sauce 4. Cheese 5. Salt and pepper 6. Avocado 7. Sour cream 8. Lime 9. Cilantro 10. Onion 11. Tomato 12. Green chiles 13. Fried eggs 14. Bacon 15. Black beans 16. Corn tortillas 17. Green salsa 18. Lime wedges 19. Salt and pepper 20. Avocado oil 21.
In a large skillet, heat the avocado oil over medium heat.
Add the tomato, onion, green chiles, and bacon, and cook until the onion is translucent.
Add the black beans, corn tortillas, and salsa.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Top with the red sauce and cheese.
Cook for 2 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper, and serve with sour cream, lime wedges, and cilantro.
Chilaquiles Rojas is a versatile dish that can be made with a variety of ingredients.
The dish can be made with fried eggs, black beans, corn tortillas, and green salsa.
It can also be made with green chiles, sour cream, and lime.
The possibilities are endless, and the dish is always delicious.

9fd2cdfff6.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Toast almonds in oven for 10 minutes or until brown.
Dissolve coffee in 2 tablespoons hot water.
In a separate small mixing bowl mix flour, baking soda and salt.
Beat butter and sugar in an electric mixer at a medium speed until fluffy.
Pour coffee, vanilla and eggs into the butter mixture; mix well.
Reduce mixer's speed to low and slowly pour flour mixture into the butter mixture.
Fold chocolate chips and almonds into the dough.
Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet, 3 inches apart.
Bake for 10 minutes.
9fd2cdfff6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, salt, and cocoa.
In a separate bowl, cream together butter and sugar.
Add eggs and vanilla to the butter mixture.
Mix in the dry ingredients into the butter mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop dough by tablespoonfuls onto a cookie sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes.

3a1d0d3143.gt:
chop bacon into small pieces and fry
unroll the cressant creations, apply a thin layer of ranch dressing
sprinkle the cooked bacon and cheese
tightly roll into a log and cut into half inch sections
bake in over at 350 for 15 minutes
enjoy!
!
3a1d0d3143.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut bacon into 1/2-inch pieces.
Cut cheddar cheese into 1/2-inch cubes.
Mix bacon and cheese together.
Spread mixture on pineapple slices.
Place pineapple slices on a baking sheet.
Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Serve warm.

ec8f7992cb.gt:
Cover a large flat surface with waxed paper.
In a large bowl, stir together the popcorn, cereal, corn chips, almonds, and pretzels.
Melt the confectioners' coating in a glass bowl in the microwave for 1 minute.
Continue to cook at 30 second intervals, stirring between each one, until the coating is smooth.
Pour melted coating over the cereal mixture.
It's best to use a large metal spoon, and pour 1 or 2 spoonfuls at a time then mix to ensure even distribution.
(A second person can be useful here - one to pour, one to mix.)
Once everything is coated, spread the mixture out onto waxed paper in a thin layer.
Let stand for about 1/2 hour, or until coating is dry.
Transfer to a bowl to serve, or store in an airtight container.
ec8f7992cb.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix together popcorn, sugar, butter, and cinnamon.
Spread mixture on a cookie sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Stir and bake for another 5 minutes.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with chocolate chips.
Stir and return to oven for 1 minute.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Store in an airtight container.

dfbfe8732e.gt:
Mix water and sugar in a saucepan.
Bring water to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook, stirring regularly, until sugar is dissolved completely into a simple syrup, about 5 minutes.
Stir 6 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling, cinnamon sticks, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, vanilla extract, and pumpkin pie spice into the syrup.
Bring liquid again to a simmer and cook until the syrup is well-spiced, 8 to 10 minutes.
Strain the mixture through a sheet of cheesecloth.
Return liquid to the saucepan over low heat.
Stir sweetened condensed milk and remaining 2 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling into the spiced syrup and cook, stirring regularly, until the pumpkin dissolves into the liquid, about 5 minutes.
