68fd9e5935.gt:
In a large resealable bag, toss pork meat with the taco seasoning mix until coated.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Fry the seasoned pork in the hot oil, stirring occasionally until pork is no longer pink.
Stir the beans, salsa and apricot preserves into the skillet with the pork.
Reduce heat to low, and simmer until heated through, about 10 minutes.
Spoon 1/3 cup of the pork mixture into each taco shell, and top with sliced olives.
68fd9e5935.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Cut up the meat and place in a large bowl.
Add all other ingredients and mix well.
Serve on a plate with taco shells.

1873e358d7.gt:
Slice hard stem off the mushrooms and shred accordingly.
Rinse the ginger and mince or julienne.
Add the prepared ingredients (Step 1) into a small pan.
Also add water, and cover the pan to cook over medium heat.
After the mushrooms are slightly soft, add soy milk and curry powder.
Bring it to a boil.
*But don't boil it too much after adding soy milk!
Turn the heat down to low.
Dissolve the miso thoroughly to finish.
Sprinkle in some parley and cinnamon if you'd like.
1873e358d7.pred:
Combine all the ingredients in a large pot and bring to a boil.
Boil for 2 minutes.
Add the miso and soy milk and bring back to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

55412fa6ca.gt:
Combine butter, sugar, corn syrup and spices in a saucepan.
Over low-medium heat, stir ingredients constantly until ingredients look like they are about to boil.
Remove from heat and transfer to a mixing bowl.
Allow sugar mixture to cool to room temperature.
Stirring occasionally might help speed up this process.
Stir eggs into cooled sugar mixture.
Sift flour and baking soda together and add to sugar mixture.
Mix well.
Roll dough into a ball.
Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 8-12 hours or overnight.
Split dough into 2 parts; Roll dough about 1/4-inch thick on a clean, floured surface.
Cut into desired shapes.
Bake in preheated oven at 350F for about 10-15 minutes, or until firm to the touch.
Cookies can be left plain, or decorated with pipped icing.
NOTE: This makes a crisp cookie, if a softer cookie is desired you may substitute brown sugar for the granulated sugar.
55412fa6ca.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together flour, sugar, ginger, baking soda, and salt.
Add in butter and mix until a dough forms.
Roll out dough to 1/4 inch thickness.
Cut out shapes using cookie cutters.
Place cookies on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool on a wire rack.

7e8b44a915.gt:
Mix chicken, carrots, broth, ginger root, brown sugar, soy sauce, allspice and pepper sauce in a 4-5 quart crock pot, slow cooker Cover and cook on low heat setting 7-9 hours or until veggies are tender and chicken is no longer pink in centre.
Mix cornstarch and reserved pineapple juice, gradually stir into chicken mixture.
Stir in pineapple and bell pepper.
Cover and cook on high heat setting about 15 minutes longer or until slightly thickened and bubbly.
7e8b44a915.pred:
Chop pepper and pineapple into small pieces.
Place chicken in crock pot.
Mix pepper and pineapple with a little oil and pour over chicken.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours.
Serve with rice.

72a1d68c4d.gt:
Slice the jalapenos longwise and carefully remove all the seeds and veins.set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix up the Cornbread batter according to the box instructions, add in the Corn and 1 cup of the Cheddar.
Fill each Jalapeno half with some batter!
Careful, dont over fill them!
Sprinkle them all with the remaining 1/2 cup of Cheddar.
Place them on a baking rack & sheet pan, bake them at 350 for about 15-20 minutes, or until the Cornbread is firm and cooked through.
They will be puffed and cheesy too!
Alternatively put the dough in mini muffin tin and then place a slice of jalapeno on top or sneak it in the middle and put more cheese on top.
This is a milder approach.
72a1d68c4d.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Mix cornmeal, flour, baking powder, salt and pepper in a large bowl.
Add milk, eggs and oil and stir until smooth.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with jalapenos and cheese.
Bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

e91cf4e18b.gt:
Pour bean with bacon soup into a large saucepan and cook over medium-low heat until warmed through, 5 to 7 minutes.
Stir tomatoes, sausage, onion, mushrooms, and hot sauce into the soup.
Reduce heat to low and cook soup at a simmer, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are breaking down, about 1 hour.
e91cf4e18b.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large pot, saute sausage and onion in olive oil until sausage is browned.
Add beans, water, tomatoes, garlic, and seasonings.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Serve with crusty bread.

5de42f87b0.gt:
Whisk garlic powder, salt, black pepper, oregano, and turmeric together in a bowl.
Store in an airtight container.
5de42f87b0.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl and mix well.
Store in an airtight container.
Use 1 teaspoon of seasoning per 1 cup of rice.
For example, if you are cooking 2 cups of rice, use 2 teaspoons of seasoning.

09fc954006.gt:
For dressing, blend everything in blender and slowly add 1/2 C oil.
Add celery seed.
Pour dressing over salad ingredients and toss gently.
Cooked chopped chicken breast can be added to make a complete meal.
09fc954006.pred:
Combine lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, cheese, and eggs.
Dress with dressing of choice.

fc76b776c7.gt:
Pre-heat oven to gas mark 2/300F/150C.
Prepare a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
First of all, beat the butter in a bowl with a wooden spoon to soften it.
Beat in the sugar, followed by the sifted flour and semolina.
Work the ingredients together with the spoon, pressing them to the side of the bowl, then finish off with your hands until you have a smooth mixture that doesn't leave any bits in the bowl.
Divide the mixture into 9, and shape each portion into a ball (dust the work surface with flour if you find the mixture too sticky to work with).
Flatten each one slightly and prick the centre with a fork (but not all the way through).
To make it look pretty, make a 1 cm crinkly border on the top by lightly pressing a fork making a slight indent working all the way around (working for the edge towards the centre).
Make sure that the biscuits are at least 1/2 inch in thickness (with the indentations at the edges).
Place onto the prepared baking sheet, very well spaced out as they will spread out quite a bit during baking.
Bake them for 50-60 minutes on the centre shelf of the oven (keep an eye on it after 45 mins - the edges seem to colour more easily than the top) it should have turned pale gold and feel firm in the centre.
Remove from the oven and dust the top with caster sugar.
Leave it to cool for 5 minutes on the baking tray before transferring them onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Store in an airtight container.
fc76b776c7.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar.
Add flour, salt, and baking powder.
Mix well.
Roll out dough on a floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness.
Cut into 2 1/2 inch rounds.
Place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack.
Melt chocolate in a double boiler.
Dip half of each cookie in the chocolate.
Place on wax paper to set.
Store in an airtight container.

199261e80a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Grease and flour a 10 inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and cream cheese until well blended.
Add sugar, and beat until light and fluffy.
Blend in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the coconut extract.
Mix in flour and baking powder until just moistened, then stir in coconut.
Spoon batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until a knife inserted into the cake comes out clean.
Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before inverting onto a cooling rack.
199261e80a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture alternately with milk, beginning and ending with flour mixture.
Pour batter into prepared pan.
Bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Frost with your favorite frosting.

bf025fd805.gt:
Break up the chocolate bars into small pieces with your hands and put in a heat resistant bowl.
Microwave for 3-4 minutes to melt.
Add the vegetable oil.
Put the eggs and sugar in a food processor, then process for 2 to 3 minutes on full strength.
Add the yogurt to Step 2 and blend for 2 minutes.
Pour the mixture from Step 3 into a rice cooker bowl, sift in the combined ingredients.
Fold in with a rubber spatula, while turning the bowl.
When the batter is no more floury, place in the rice cooker and turn the switch!
Press "Cook" 2-3 times and let the batter bake through a couple cycles until a bamboo skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean.
When it's done, remove the cake from the rice cooker bowl and cool on a cooling rack.
The cake comes right out of the bowl if you run a rubber spatula between the cake and bowl to loosen it.
You can eat it straight a way, but it tastes even better the next day.
It's also delicious decorated!
bf025fd805.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Cool completely before removing from pan.

46d50a0c1e.gt:
Mix all together.
Pour into 8 X 8 baking dish.
Lay bacon across the top.
Bake at 350* until bacon is brown and beans are bubbly.
46d50a0c1e.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large pot, combine beans, tomatoes, onions, brown sugar, molasses, ketchup, mustard, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, and chili powder.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Add bacon and cook until crisp.
Serve hot.

3986074ac9.gt:
In a large bowl, mix together cottage cheese, caraway seed, sugar, monosodium glutamate (MSG), white pepper, chives and celery salt.
Allow the mixture to chill in the refrigerator 8 to 12 hours, or overnight, before serving.
3986074ac9.pred:
Cut the cottage cheese into small pieces.
Add the seasonings.
Mix well.
Serve.

02a2ef367b.gt:
Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat, about 6 min.
Add spices, cook an additional 1 min.
Add onions, dressing, and garlic; cook 3 min.
Pour in tomatoes; simmer 5 to 6 min., stirring occasionally or until slightly thickened.
02a2ef367b.pred:
Brown beef, peppers, onions, and tomatoes.
.
.
.

4ebe6235f7.gt:
Combine cheese and salsa over low heat until melted.
Stir in sour cream.
Pour over split hot baked potatoes.
4ebe6235f7.pred:
Mix all ingredients together.
Cut potatoes into 1/2 inch cubes.
Add potatoes to a large bowl.
Add all other ingredients and mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Serve with tortilla chips.

09eb954485.gt:
Rinse and debeard mussels, discarding any with open shells.
Place oil and butter in a large saute pan and place over medium heat until butter has melted.
Add onion and saute until transparent.
Add the remaining ingredients (except the basil).
Cover and cook over medium-high heat for 8 minutes, or until all the shells have opened.
Add basil and stir, until it has wilted.
Divide mussels into 4 bowls, top with broth and serve with lots of crusty bread for dipping.
09eb954485.pred:
Put the mussels in a pot with a little water, cover, and steam for 5 minutes.
Add a little olive oil and butter to the pot and saute the onions and garlic until soft.
Add the wine and let it reduce by half.
Add the tomatoes, clam juice, and seasonings.
Bring to a boil, add the mussels and cover.
Cook for 5 minutes.
Serve with crusty bread.

c5f32e3595.gt:
Rinse a Collins glass by swirling absinthe inside it, just enough to coat the sides; discard excess.
Combine gin, jam, fennel syrup, lemon juice and bitters in a shaker with ice, and shake.
Add ice to the prepared glass, and into that strain the contents of the shaker.
Top with the soda, and serve.
c5f32e3595.pred:
Shu Jam Fizz is a dish that is made with shrimp, jam, and fizz.
In a large pot, combine the shrimp, jam, and fizz.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve the Shu Jam Fizz in bowls.

f6c8102a5b.gt: Combine all ingredients in a food processor and process until desired texture is achieved.

119cbf367b.gt:
In a glass, muddle sugar and lime together.
Fill the glass with ice, add juice and Cachaca.
Enjoy!
119cbf367b.pred:
Mix all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and serve.

e6d3f4cc2c.gt:
Cream butter and sugar together.
Mix in beaten egg yolks, cherry juice, flour and baking powder.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into mixture.
Grease mini muffins tins and sprinkle bottom with chopped pecans.
Place 1 teaspoon dough in each and place cherry on top.
Add another teaspoon full of dough and sprinkle top with pecans.
Bake at 350F for 10 minutes.
Remove from muffin tins and roll in powdered sugar while still warm.
Makes 24 mini muffins.
e6d3f4cc2c.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and spices.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, eggs, and oil.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Fill muffin cups 2/3 full.
Bake for 15-18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Allow to cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

05010dda12.gt:
Place all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well with a spoon.
Sift mixture twice.
Store in a tightly covered container, as it keeps well for several weeks at room temperature.
05010dda12.pred:
Mix flour, sugar, butter, eggs, and vanilla.
Mix together until well blended.
Roll into balls and place on a cookie sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes.

51cc9f173e.gt:
Mix the egg, sugar and shiro-dashi in a small bowl.
Place some oil in a heated frying pan and pour in the egg.
When it is half-cooked, move it over to one side of the frying pan, and shape it into a log.
Turn the heat to low.
When it is browned, flip it over and cook the other side.
Place the cooked egg onto cling film.
Wrap it up and fold over the edges.
Remove it from the cling film after about 2 minutes and slice.

f105f448a6.gt:
Prepare all the ingredients first!
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Fry chili and spring onions and for two minutes.
Add tomato puree, garlic and ginger; stir and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add prawns and cook for five minutes until they change color and turn pink.
Add lime, coriander, 2 tablespoon creme fraiche and garam masala, let it all bubble for 2 minutes.
Top with the last tablespoon of creme fraiche, garnish with cilantro leaves and serve and eat immediately.
f105f448a6.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine prawns, onion, garlic, ginger, cilantro, and chili powder.
Add in the juice of 1 lemon and 1/2 cup of water.
Mix well and set aside.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add in 1 tablespoon of oil and saute the prawns for 2 minutes.
Add in the onion, garlic, and ginger and saute for 2 more minutes.
Add in the cilantro and chili powder and saute for 1 more minute.
Add in the lemon juice and water and stir well.
Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until the prawns are cooked through.
Serve hot.

7dc021d68f.gt:
Peel the potatoes and slice them really thin, dropping the slices into a bowl of cold water as you go along.
When they are all sliced, drain and pat dry.
Melt 2 tbls.
of the butter in a 10" nonstick skillet.
Swirl the butter to coat the surface; then remove the skillet from the heat.
Arrange 1/3 of the potato slices in a spiral, starting in the center and overlapping, so that the bottom of the skillet is covered.
Cut 2 tbls.
of the butter into small pieces and sprinkle them over the potatoes.
Then sprinkle the potatoes with 1/2 teaspoons of the rosemary,1/2 tsp of the parsley, 1/4 teaspoons of the thyme, and salt and pepper.
Repeat, making 2 more layers of potates, butter, and seasonings, pressing each layer down with a spatula.
Place the skillet over medium low heat, and cook until the bottom is crisp and golen brown, 45 minutes.
Then invert the galette onto a flat plate and slip it back into the skillet.
Continue cooking until the other side is golden, 10 to 15 minutes.
Invert the galette agaiin onto a serving platter.
Cut it into wedges and serve immediately.
Enjoy!
7dc021d68f.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine potatoes, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Mix well.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a 12-inch round.
Transfer the dough to a 9-inch pie plate.
Evenly spread the potato mixture over the dough.
Fold the edges of the dough over the potato mixture, leaving a 1-inch border.
Brush the border with egg wash.
Bake for 20 minutes, until the crust is golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes.
Serve warm.

255666c11a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 325F.
In a bowl, cover the chipotle with hot water and let stand until softened, 30 minutes.
Bake the halved apples cut side down on a rimmed baking sheet for 30 minutes, until tender.
Let cool.
Scoop the apple pulp into a food processor and discard the skins.
Stem, seed and chop the chipotle; add it to the food processor and puree.
Meanwhile, spread the bread in a pie plate and bake the pieces for about 10 minutes, until golden.
In a saucepan, boil the hard cider with the vinegar, sugar and apple puree.
Simmer, stirring, until reduced to 3/4 cup, 10 minutes.
Remove from the heat and season with salt.
Light a grill.
Grill the sausages over moderate heat, turning, until lightly charred on both sides and cooked through, 12 minutes.
Transfer to a plate and tent with foil.
In a skillet, heat the oil until shimmering.
Add the broccoli and season with salt.
Cover and cook until browned, 2 minutes.
Stir in the mustard, caraway, cider sauce and 1/2 cup of water and bring to a boil.
Remove from the heat, stir in the butter and season with salt.
Serve the sausages with the broccoli and sauce, garnishing with the bread crumbs and apple matchsticks.
255666c11a.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large skillet, brown sausage and onion.
Add apples, cider, and seasonings.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Place sausage mixture in a casserole dish and bake for 30 minutes.

776b79b2b7.gt:
Toss the romaine lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and parsley together in a large bowl; season with salt.
Drizzle the lemon juice and olive oil over the salad; stir.
Add the sour cream and mix until evenly coated.
776b79b2b7.pred:
Put the lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, and olives in a bowl.
Add the dressing.
Mix well.

25cf1f8952.gt:
Add the oil to the pan and put heat on to medium high.
Add the rice and saute until golden brown approximately 10 - 15 minutes.
Add the onion and bell pepper and saute another 5 - 10 minutes.
The important thing is to make sure the rice is toasted to a nice golden brown.
Using a garlic press, add the minced fresh garlic by squeezing the press and cutting off
the garlic as it comes out, with a knife.
Continue to saute for an additional 3 minutes.
You will notice a wonderful garlic aroma.
Add the tomato puree, chicken broth and salt.
Stir and turn heat up to high.
Bring to a full boil while stirring.
Continue to boil for 2 minutes.
Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
When it's done, turn off the heat, remove the lid and stir in the peas.
wait 5 minutes before serving.
25cf1f8952.pred:
Brown rice, black beans, tomatoes, onions, cilantro, and lime.
. Brown rice: cook rice according to package directions.
. Black beans: rinse beans, cover with water, and bring to a boil.
. Tomato: chop tomato and add to rice.
. Onion: chop onion and add to rice.
. Cilantro: chop cilantro and add to rice.
. Lime: squeeze lime juice over rice.

158484cb44.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Beat reduced-fat cream cheese and sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Add egg whites and cinnamon; mix well.
Gradually beat in milk.
Spread bread cubes onto bottom of 8-inch square baking dish; top with chocolate and cream cheese mixture.
Bake 30 to 35 min.
or until center is set.
Cool slightly.
158484cb44.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, sugar, cocoa powder, flour, and cinnamon.
Stir in bread cubes and raisins.
Pour into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 45 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

159b22acbe.gt:
In 1 1/2- to 2-quart container with cover, mix all ingredients; cover tightly.
Store at room temperature.
Kitchen Tip:.
For cute gift bags, buy some small snack-sized bags and black pipe cleaners at the party or craft store.
Cut 5 pipe cleaners in half (makes ten 6-inch pieces).
Cut 14 pipe cleaners into 4-inch lengths (3-lengths per pipe cleaner).
To make each spider hold four 4-inch lengths together and twist a 6-inch length around the middle of the bundle to secure.
Bend 4-inch pieces to resemble spider legs.
Use 6-inch piece to seal gift bag.
Two 4-inch pieces will be left over.
159b22acbe.pred: Goblin Good Gorp: 1. 1 cup of goblin blood 2. 1 cup of goblin ears 3. 1 cup of goblin eyes 4. 1 cup of goblin teeth 5. 1 cup of goblin hair 6. 1 cup of goblin saliva 7. 1 cup of goblin spit 8. 1 cup of goblin sweat 9. 1 cup of goblin urine 10. 1 cup of goblin feces 11. 1 cup of goblin slime 12. 1 cup of goblin slime 13. 1 cup of goblin slime 14. 1 cup of goblin slime 15. 1 cup of goblin slime 16. 1 cup of goblin slime 17. 1 cup of goblin slime 18. 1 cup of goblin slime 19. 1 cup of goblin slime 20. 1 cup of goblin slime 21. 1 cup of goblin slime 22. 1 cup of goblin slime 23. 1 cup of goblin slime 24. 1 cup of goblin slime 25. 1 cup of goblin slime 26. 1 cup of goblin slime 27. 1 cup of goblin slime 28. 1 cup of goblin slime 29. 1 cup of goblin slime 30. 1 cup of goblin slime 31. 1 cup of goblin slime 32. 1 cup of goblin slime 33. 1 cup of goblin slime 34. 1 cup of goblin slime 35. 1 cup of goblin slime 36. 1 cup of goblin slime 37. 1 cup of goblin slime 38. 1 cup of goblin slime 39. 1 cup of goblin slime 40. 1 cup of goblin

a884010613.gt:
Combine all ingredients except toast.
Cover toast slices with mushroom mixture & grill (broil) until melted & golden.
a884010613.pred:
Mushrooms, salami, olive oil, onions, garlic, bread, cheese, salt, pepper, and a grill.
Mushrooms: 1 pound
Salami: 1/2 pound
Onions: 1/2 pound
Garlic: 1/2 pound
Olive Oil: 1/4 cup
Bread: 1/2 loaf
Cheese: 1/2 cup
Salt: 1/2 teaspoon
Pepper: 1/2 teaspoon
Grill: 1/2 hour
Preheat the grill to medium heat.
Cut the salami into 1/2 inch slices.
Cut the mushrooms into 1/2 inch slices.
Cut the onions into 1/2 inch slices.
Cut the garlic into 1/2 inch slices.
Cut the bread into 1/2 inch slices.
Cut the cheese into 1/2 inch slices.
Place the mushrooms, salami, onions, garlic, bread, cheese, salt, and pepper on a plate.
Brush the bread with olive oil and place on the grill.
Grill the bread until golden brown.
Remove the bread from the grill and place on a plate.
Place the cheese on the grill and grill until melted.
Remove the cheese from the grill and place on the plate.
Place the mushrooms, salami, onions, garlic, and bread on the plate.
Serve immediately.

68ce5e6dca.gt:
Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a soup pot and lightly saute 4 or 5 chopped tomatoes, 2 finely chopped cloves of garlic and a few thin slices of onion for a few minutes, or until the onion and garlic begin to soften.
Feel free to mash the ingredients a little while cooking if youd like a less lumpy texture.
But personally I quite like lumpy, broth-like soups and I wanted to avoid using the blender.
Add a few chopped fresh basil leaves and a cup of vegetable broth, some freshly ground black pepper and a little sea salt.
If you are using regular (not low sodium) broth from a can, taste before adding salt as it may have enough already.
Ideally Id recommend using low sodium or homemade broth.
Bring the soup slowly to the boil, give it a stir, put on the lid and reduce the heat to a simmer.
Leave to simmer for about 20 minutes.
After 20 minutes, taste the soup and add more salt and pepper if needed.
Add a few drops of Tabasco sauce, tasting as you go, until you get the flavour you want.
I find that of all things, soup needs to be continually tasted throughout the cooking process to make sure its turning out right.
Leave the soup to sit with the lid off and heat still at a low simmer while you lightly brush a few slices of fresh bread with olive oil and lightly grill them.
You can do this outside if so inclined, or inside in a stovetop grill pan.
When the bread is done, spoon the soup into bowls and serve with the bread.
You can add a dollop of creme fraiche to the soup if youre feeling particularly extravagant.

6ae95ca0b8.gt:
Knead on a lightly floured surface, as little as possible.
Roll to 1/2 inch thickness.
Cut into desired shapes.
You can also drop by spoonful onto a cookie sheet and flatten slightly.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes at 450.
Note: Dried fruits or nuts can be added to batter if desired.
6ae95ca0b8.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in milk, egg, and vanilla until dough is moistened.
Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead gently 10 times.
Roll dough out to 1/2 inch thickness.
Cut into 2 1/2 inch rounds.
Place rounds on ungreased baking sheets.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.
Cool on wire racks.

107091523c.gt:
Put a large heavy baking sheet in middle of oven and preheat oven to 425F.
Bring piloncillo, water, zest, spices, and 1/8 teaspoon salt to a boil in a small heavy saucepan, covered, stirring occasionally until piloncillo has dissolved.
Remove lid and boil over medium-low heat until syrup is thickened and reduced to about 3/4 cup, 6 to 10 minutes.
Discard zest and cool syrup slightly.
Meanwhile, peel and core apples, then cut into 1/2-inch-wide wedges.
Toss apples with flour, then with syrup.
Roll out 1 piece of dough (keeping remaining piece chilled) on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 13-inch round, then fit into a 9-inch pie plate.
Trim edge, leaving a 1/2-inch overhang, and chill shell.
Roll out remaining piece of dough on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 16-by 11-inch rectangle.
Cut dough crosswise into 11 (1 1/4-inch-wide) strips.
Stir apple mixture, then spoon evenly into pie shell.
Weave a tight lattice pattern over pie with pastry strips.
Trim all strips flush with edge of pie plate.
Fold bottom crust up over edge of lattice and crimp.
Brush lattice (but not edge) with milk and sprinkle with sugar.
Bake pie on hot baking sheet 20 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 375F and bake until crust is golden and filling is bubbling, 50 to 60 minutes more.
Cool pie to warm or room temperature, about 1 1/2 hours.

10935178ed.gt:
1.
Bring stock to a simmer in a saucepan (do not boil).
Keep warm over low heat.2.
Heat a Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add olive oil; swirl to coat.
Add pancetta; saute 6 minutes or until crisp.
Using a slotted spoon, remove pancetta from pan; drain on a paper towel.
Add shallots to drippings in pan; cook 2 minutes (do not brown), stirring frequently.
Stir in rice, rosemary, and garlic; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add wine; cook 2 minutes or until liquid is absorbed, stirring frequently.
Stir in 1 1/2 cups stock; cook 4 minutes or until liquid is nearly absorbed, stirring constantly.
Add remaining stock, 3/4 cup at a time, stirring nearly constantly until each portion of stock is absorbed before adding the next (about 22 minutes total); reserve 1/3 cup stock at the last addition.
Stir in pepper, truffle oil, and salt.
Remove pan from heat; stir in reserved 1/3 cup broth.
Top with pancetta.
10935178ed.pred:
Pancetta, truffle oil, and risotto.
Pancetta Risotto:
1.
Heat a large pan over medium heat.
Add the pancetta and cook until it is crispy.
Remove the pancetta from the pan and set aside.
2.
Add the onion and cook until soft and translucent.
3.
Add the rice and stir to coat with the onions.
4.
Add the white wine and cook until the wine has evaporated.
5.
Add the chicken stock, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly.
6.
Continue adding stock until the rice is cooked al dente.
7.
Add the pancetta and truffle oil and stir.
8.
Serve immediately.

4f53760524.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Grease and flour a 8x8-inch baking pan.
Dissolve instant coffee in hot water.
Mix coffee with remaining ingredients together in a large bowl, until just moistened.
Spread into prepared pan.
Bake 25 minutes.
Cool in pan and cut into 9 bars.
4f53760524.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut zucchini into 1/4 inch slices.
Mix together the almond flour, coconut flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add the eggs, coconut oil, and vanilla extract to the zucchini slices.
Dip each slice into the flour mixture, then into the egg mixture, and finally into the flour mixture again.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.

9c987e0b4b.gt:
Saute sauerkraut and caraway in a skillet over medium-high heat.
When most of the moisture has evaporated and sauerkraut begins to brown, stir in lemon juice and set aside.
Arrange an egg roll wrapper on a work surface with a corner towards you; brush edges with egg wash.
Place a strip of cheese on the wrapper, about 1 inch above the bottom corner, then top with strips of beef and about 3 tbsp sauerkraut mixture.
Drizzle with mustard.
Fold the bottom corner up over the filling to enclose, fold in the sides, then roll to the top corner of the wrapper.
Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat to about 360*.
Add half the egg rolls and fry on all sides until brown and crisp, 5-7 minutes.Drain on paper towels while frying remaining rolls.
Serve Egg Rolls with Thousand Island Dressing for dipping.
9c987e0b4b.pred:
Combine the flour, salt, and pepper in a shallow bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and 1 tablespoon of water.
Dip the egg roll wrappers in the egg mixture, then in the flour mixture to coat.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the egg rolls and cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to drain.
Serve with Reuben Egg Roll Wraps Dipping Sauce.
Essential ingredients: egg roll wrappers, flour, salt, pepper, eggs, milk, water, oil, 1 tablespoon of water, 1 tablespoon of oil, 1 tablespoon of flour.

35bc02319c.gt:
To make doughnuts: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Mix the flours, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon in a mixing bowl.
Set aside.
In another bowl, combine the melted butter, milk, vanilla and maple syrup.
Then add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until combined.
Put the mixture into a piping bag or a Ziplock bag with the tip cut off, and pour into a pre-sprayed doughnut pan.
Bake doughnuts for 20-25 minutes or until browned and slightly firm to the touch.
Once done, let stand to cool for 20 minutes.
To make glaze: stir together 1/2 cup confectioners sugar, 2 tablespoons cocoa powder, and 1 tablespoon milk.
Once mixed well, distribute the glaze generously onto doughnuts.
35bc02319c.pred:
Cake Batter, Flour, Sugar, Eggs, Milk, Butter, Baking Powder, Salt, Vanilla Extract, and Cinnamon.
Cake Batter Doughnuts:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, combine cake batter, flour, sugar, eggs, milk, butter, baking powder, salt, vanilla extract, and cinnamon.
Mix until well blended.
Drop batter by tablespoonfuls onto a greased and floured doughnut pan.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

df67994fb9.gt:
Cream the butter and sugar.
Beat in the egg, vanilla and almond extracts.
Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt.
Mix until well blended.
Fold in the almonds and coconut.
Cover dough and refrigerate for at least one hour.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C), and grease cookie sheets.
Roll dough into 1/2 inch rolls and cut into 1 1/2 inch lengths.
Bake 18 to 20 minutes, or until golden.
Dip in confectioners' sugar and let cool.

3da31e6530.gt:
Preheat oven to 275.
Mash bananas in a small bowl add lemon juice and set aside
Sift together flour, salt and baking soda in medium sized bowl set aside
In large bowl cream butter and sugars until completely combined
Add eggs 1 at a time beating well each time, stir in vanilla

Cool cake completely
For the frosting cream together cream cheese and butter beat in sugar and vanilla frost cake and garnish with nuts.

66711973a2.gt:

Candy Corn Gooey Cake Bars:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.

196e701d35.gt:
Heat about 2 inches of peanut oil on medium high.
Chop green onions, coarsely chop crab meat and combine well with cream cheese.
Lay out wonton wrappers and place about a tablespoon of the mixture in the center.
Brush egg wash along all four edges.
Heres the kicker: some places will just fold it in half (diagonally) and call it a day.
Ive found that these tend to become oily and they dont give you the nice, crispy bite that compliments the creamy filling.
So, take the tip of one edge and the tip of the edge diagonally across and pinch together.
Take the other two edges and bring them up to meet the already pinched edges so you create a little square with the edges pinched up in the air.
Drop a few at a time into the oil.
If you use a big frying pan and dump everything in at the same time, youll cause the oil temperature to come down and they wont fry nicely.
The rangoon will float to the top after a minute; flip over when its a nice golden brown.
Fry on the other side for another minute and remove, placing on some paper towels to absorb the oil.
Total cooking time is only 2-3 minutes, so stay nearby!

6aecc26678.gt:
1 Prepare millet corn meal: Pour whole grain millet into a grain mill and mill to a cornmeal-like consistency.

Process all ingredients in a blender until smooth, stopping to scrape down sides.

; set aside.

or until completely dissolved, stirring constantly.

Saffron Aioli: 1.
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
2.
Add the saffron to the bowl, and mix well.
3.
Cover the bowl and let sit at room temperature for 24 hours.
4.
Strain the aioli through a fine mesh strainer.
5.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
6.
Serve with your favorite bread or crackers.

91eb1e20fb.gt:
Put the rice in a small sauce pan.
I like to rinse my rice by placing in a sieve and running under cold water.
This rids the rice of excess starch powder and broken rice which makes the cooked rice mushy and sticky.
Add just enough water to cover the top of the rice by 1/2 inch (approx.
3 cups) Cover the pot with the lid.
Place over medium to medium high heat and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low.
Simmer, covered, for at least another 10 minutes, until the water is completely absorbed.
Turn off burner and allow rice to sit, covered, for at least another 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with half of the salt and pepper and stir to fluff.
IN THE MEANTIME, sprinkle the fish with the rest of the salt and pepper, and dredge in flour.
Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add fish to pan; cook 2 1/2 minutes on each side (less for thinner filets) or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.
Add wine, juice, and capers to the pan; cook one minute.
Add butter to pan, stirring until butter melts.
Remove fish and sauce from pan; keep warm.
Wipe pan clean with paper towel, add spinach and saute one minute or until wilted.
Place 1/4 of the rice on each of 4 plates.
Top each serving with 1/4 of the spinach, one fish filet, and 1/4 of the sauce.
91eb1e20fb.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut up halibut into 1-inch cubes.
In a large skillet, saute onion and garlic in olive oil until tender.
Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Add wine and cook until liquid is reduced by half.
Add lemon juice and cook until halibut is cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour spinach mixture over halibut and serve.

a5c8eb3798.gt:
Cook the pasta in large pot of the boiling salted water until al dente.
Using a mortar and pestle, mash the salt and garlics together into a paste.
Warm the yogurt slightly in sauce pan.
Remove a small amount of warm yogurt from the pan, and stir together with garlic paste.
Stir this mixture into the remaining yogurt.
Drain the pasta and rinsed in cold water.
Place in caserol or deep serving dish, tosh with 1 table spoon of butter or margarine.
Tosh with half of the garlic - yogurt sauce.
Spread the remaining sauce over the pasta.
Garnish with the parsley.
For a very special dish, brown the pine nuts in two table spoon of butter or margarine.
Pour over the parsley.
Serve immediately.
a5c8eb3798.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together 1 cup of all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.
Make a well in the center of the flour mixture and add 2 cups of warm water.
Using a fork, stir the flour mixture until it forms a ball.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for 5 minutes, until it is smooth and elastic.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
Add 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese and stir until melted.
Add 1 cup of yogurt and stir until smooth.
Add 1/2 cup of water and 1/2 cup of heavy cream.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Roll out the dough on a floured surface to a thickness of 1/4 inch.
Cut out 2-inch squares.
Place 1 tablespoon of filling in the center of each square.
Fold the dough over the filling and press the edges together to seal.
Place the pasta squares on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, until golden brown.
Serve immediately.

eadbe5886e.gt:
In a small saucepan, bring 1 quart of water to a boil.
Add 1 teaspoon of salt and the eggs and simmer over moderately high heat for 5 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the eggs to a bowl of cold water and let stand for 3 to 4 minutes.
Keep the pan of hot water on the stove over low heat.
Meanwhile, put the spinach in a large bowl.
In a medium skillet, combine the olive oil, sherry and balsamic vinegars, shallots and thyme, and boil for 1 minute.
Crack the eggs all over and gently peel them under warm running water, keeping them whole.
Using a slotted spoon, slip the eggs in the hot water for 30 seconds.
Pour the warm dressing over the spinach, season with salt and pepper and toss.
Mound the salad on plates, top each with an egg and serve.

33aa48e240.gt:
In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil with the garlic, salt, chile powder, ground cumin, paprika, sugar and fresh lime juice.
Set aside.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the tomatillos to the dry pan and cook for 3 to 5 minutes on each side or until slightly charred all over.
Remove from pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add the oil and then stir in the chicken.
Cook for 2 minutes or until the chicken is lightly browned.
Stir in the onion and bell pepper and cook with the chicken for 3 to 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in the spice mixture and cook for another 2 minutes or until everything is well combined and heated through.
Fold in the cooked tomatillos.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with tortillas and optional toppings.

48b55fcddd.gt:

Pour puree through a sieve into a bowl, pressing on solids, and discard seeds.
Return juice to blender and blend together with ice, almonds, and garlic (in batches if necessary) until smooth.
Add bread, vinegar, salt, and pepper to taste and blend, adding oil in a slow stream, until smooth.
Top with diced watermelon.

Add the watermelon cubes to a blender.
Add the tomatoes, onion, cucumber, jalapeno, and cilantro.
Puree until smooth.
Add the watermelon juice, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Puree until smooth.

03b718988e.gt:

Stir onion and garlic into bacon; cook and stir until onion is tender, about 10 minutes.
Add green tomatoes, vegetable broth, celery salt, bay leaf, and black pepper to bacon-onion mixture; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer until tomatoes are tender, about 40 minutes.
03b718988e.pred:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
Cut green tomatoes in half and place on a baking sheet.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Bake for 1 hour or until tomatoes are soft.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Cut tomatoes in half and scoop out the seeds.
Place tomatoes in a blender with 2 cups of water and puree until smooth.

Cook over medium heat until bacon is crisp.
Add tomato puree and 2 cups of water.

2ae1ab4527.gt:

Add onions and cook until softened.
Then add pork, gravy, and crushed red pepper flakes.
Stir to make sure all ingredients are well combined, and heated through.
2ae1ab4527.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine 1 lb. pork, 1/2 cup onion, 1/2 cup flour, 1 egg, 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/2 tsp. pepper.
Mix well.
Form into 4 patties.
In a large skillet, heat 1 Tbsp.
oil over medium heat.
Cook patties until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side.
Remove from skillet and place on a baking sheet.
Bake in oven for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a saucepan, combine 1/2 cup onion, 1/2 cup flour, 1 cup milk, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/2 tsp. pepper.
Cook over medium heat until thickened, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in 1/4 cup water.
Add 1/2 cup of the sauce to the baked pork patties and return to the oven for 10 minutes.
Serve with mashed potatoes and gravy.

ce64c17852.gt:
In blender, combine soymilk and orange juice; add papaya, strawberries, and, if desired, protein powder and honey.
Cover and blend until smooth.
ce64c17852.pred:
Place the papaya, strawberries, and soy milk in a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour the mixture into glasses and serve immediately.

e910d0b6fc.gt:
Stir together the potato flakes, pancake mix, onion, Cheddar cheese, milk, egg, olive oil, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper in a bowl until well combined.
Grease a griddle or large skillet, and place over medium heat.
Drop pancakes, 1/4 cup at a time, onto the hot griddle, and cook until the edges look dry and 1 bubble appears in the center, about 3 minutes.
Flip the pancakes, and cook until browned on the other side, about 3 more minutes.
e910d0b6fc.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together potatoes, flour, eggs, salt, pepper, and baking powder.
Mix well.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
Add 1 tablespoon of butter and 1 tablespoon of oil.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter into the skillet and cook until bubbles form on the surface.
Flip and cook until golden brown.
Repeat with remaining batter.
Serve with sour cream, applesauce, or maple syrup.

a0ea3e1280.gt:
Combine sugar, cream, half-and-half, milk, and instant espresso in a bowl and stir until sugar is completely dissolved.
Turn on your ice cream machine before pouring the ice cream mix into it.
Then pour it in and churn according to the manufacturers instructions.
Add toffee and chocolate chips about 2 minutes before the end of the churning cycle.
Serve right away if you want it soft or transfer to an airtight container and store in the freezer for at least 2 hours.
Use within 3 days.
Recipe makes about 1 1/2 quarts.
a0ea3e1280.pred:
Cream, sugar, coffee, chocolate, ice cream, toffee bits, and mocha sauce.
In a saucepan, combine the cream, sugar, and coffee.
Bring to a boil and stir until the sugar has dissolved.
Remove from the heat and stir in the chocolate and toffee bits.
Pour into a bowl and let cool to room temperature.
Once cooled, add the ice cream and mocha sauce.
Serve immediately or freeze until ready to serve.

d25661eadd.gt:
Place your pork tenderloin in an oven proof pot.
Grate your garlic cloves and rub it into the pork tenderloin.
Rub smoked paprika powder into the pork tenderloin.
Dice the onions and place them in the pot with the pork tenderloin.
Cover with bbq sauce.
Put on the lid and make sure it is closed.
Cook in the oven at 125F celsius/255F for 5,5 hours.
Take out your pot and remove the lid.
Using to forks, pull the meat apart.
Serve with tortillas, vegetables and a sauce of your chosing.
d25661eadd.pred:
Combine all ingredients in a large pot and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours.
Remove the meat from the pot and shred it.
Return the meat to the pot and simmer for an additional 1 hour.
Serve with your favorite sides.

96de2fb2f9.gt:
Cut broccoli florets into small bite-sized pieces.
Combine with grapes, celery, raisins, and sunflower seed kernels.
Mix mayonnaise with remaining ingredients, stirring with a whisk.
Pour dressing over the broccoli mix, and toss well.
Chill for 1 hour minimum.

0eeb43444a.gt:
Steam the cauliflower florets for 10 minutes or until tender.
In a small skillet over medium heat, saute garlic in hazelnut oil or coconut oil, just until fragrant.
Add all of the ingredients into a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Serve over gluten-free noodles, spaghetti squash, veggie sticks, spuds, kale chips or Vegan Shepherds Pie On The Fly.
0eeb43444a.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large saucepan, melt butter and saute cauliflower florets until they are soft and slightly browned.
Add cauliflower to a food processor and pulse until it resembles a rice-like consistency.
Add cauliflower to a medium bowl and stir in the flour, salt, and pepper.
Add milk and stir until combined.
Place cauliflower mixture in a 9x13 inch baking dish and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and stir in the cheese.
Return to oven and bake for 10 minutes more, or until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbly.
Serve hot.

e834a54d65.gt:
Bring 2 medium saucepans of salted water to a strong boil.
Add the squid to 1 saucepan and the shrimp to the other and boil until just cooked, about 1 minute for the squid and 3 minutes for the shrimp.
Drain the squid and shrimp and immediately transfer to a bowl of ice water to cool.
Drain again and pat dry.
In a large bowl, mix the lemon juice with the peanut oil, parsley, cilantro, garlic and jalapeno.
Add the mushrooms, shrimp and squid.
Season with salt and pepper and refrigerate until chilled, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, using a sharp knife, peel the oranges, removing all the bitter white pith.
Working over a bowl, cut in between the membranes to release the sections.
Squeeze the juice from the membranes over the chilled seviche.
Arrange the orange sections and avocado wedges around the edge of a platter.
Using a slotted spoon, spread the seviche in the center.
Spoon some of the marinade over the oranges and avocados and serve immediately.
e834a54d65.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the mushrooms, onion, garlic, and 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper, and toss to coat.
Spread the mushroom mixture on a baking sheet and roast for 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and set aside.
In a small bowl, mash the avocado with a fork.
Add the lime juice, salt, pepper, and cilantro.
Mix well.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
Add the mushrooms and onion and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the roasted mushrooms and onion and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the mashed avocado and cook for 1 minute.
Add the lemon juice and cook for 1 minute.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

fd3e9f4f9e.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Combine sugar, butter and cream cheese in large bowl.
Beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until creamy.
Add milk, eggs and vanilla.
Continue beating until smooth.
Stir in flour and coconut.
Spoon into paper-lined or greased muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Bake 32-38 minutes or until light golden brown.
Serve warm or at room temperature; top with fruit preserves or jam.
fd3e9f4f9e.pred:
Coconut, flour, sugar, eggs, butter, vanilla extract, and baking powder.
Coconut Pound Cake: 1.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2.
Combine coconut, flour, sugar, eggs, butter, and vanilla extract in a large bowl.
3.
Stir in baking powder.
4.
Pour into greased and floured 9x13 inch pan.
5.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
6.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes.
7.
Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack.
8.
Serve with fresh coconut flakes and whipped cream.

8afb640d04.gt:
Wash the sweet potato.
Bake the wet sweet potato in a toaster oven for 10 minutes.
Turn it 90 degrees, and bake for another 10 minutes.
You can also boil or microwave.
Mash the sweet potato with a masher.
Add katakuriko, and water, and knead briefly.
Preheat the oven to 180C / 350F, and set the baking time for 15 minutes.
In the meantime, roll the dough into bite-size balls, and lay on a sheet of parchment paper.
Bake in the oven for 15 minutes at 180C / 350F, then it's done.
8afb640d04.pred:
Sweet potatoes, baby carrots, and baby spinach.
Sweet Potato Baby Biscuit Baby Snack: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together mashed sweet potatoes, baby carrots, and baby spinach.
Add in flour, baking powder, and salt.
Mix well.
Form into small balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.

c1a30da967.gt:
Mix all ingredients except oil and dressing until well blended.
Shape into 8 patties.
Cook patties in hot oil in large frying pan on medium heat 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown on both sides.
Serve with dressing, if desired.
c1a30da967.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Mix together the turkey, stuffing, and 1 cup of bread crumbs.
Shape into 12 cakes.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
Serve with gravy.

c1c23779c6.gt:
Heat the cider, syrup, sugar and cinnamon sticks in a saucepan over medium heat.
Cook until the mixture is simmering, reduces by half and starts to thicken, about 15 minutes.
Remove from the heat, stir in the butter and let it cool completely.
Remove the cinnamon sticks, then pour over pancakes or use as desired.
c1c23779c6.pred:
Mix together the apple cider, sugar, and cinnamon.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and allow to cool.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

50ae7ae60c.gt:
For this soup, I use 1/2 lb button, 1/4 lb cremini and 1/4 lb shitake mushrooms.
In a large pot, sautee mushrooms in olive oil until browned.
Add onions, carrots, celery and garlic and sautee until tender.
Add flour and thyme and cook for 3-4 mins until flour is cooked into the vegetables.
Add stock, bay leaf and rice and bring to a boil.
Simmer soup covered for 45-60 mins until rice is tender.
Add salt and pepper to taste and balsamic vinegar if desired.
50ae7ae60c.pred:
Mushrooms, Wild Rice, and Broth.
I used a mushroom and wild rice soup recipe from a cookbook and modified it to be low fat.
I started by sauteing the mushrooms in a little olive oil until they were tender.
Then I added the wild rice and cooked for a few minutes until it was just starting to brown.
Next, I added the broth and brought it to a boil.
I simmered the soup for about 15 minutes, or until the rice was cooked through.
I added some salt and pepper to taste and served it up.

c7e6c70205.gt:
In a medium bowl place first 7 ingredients up to lemon juice.
Stir until combined.
Set aside.
In a medium saute pan place 1/4 cup oil and heat to medium hot.
Fry each tortilla for 15 seconds, or until softened.
Drain on paper towels or paper bags.
In a large, heavy pan place 4 cups of oil and heat over high heat until very hot.
Loosely roll each tortilla and deep-fry it for 1-2 minutes, or until crisp.
Drain on paper towels or paper bags.
Stuff reserved vegetable mixture inside each tortilla.
Cut the taquitos in half, crosswise.
c7e6c70205.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, mix together the corn tortillas, feta cheese, blue corn meal, egg, and salt.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Roll the tortillas into 1-inch balls and place them in the skillet.
Cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
Serve with salsa and sour cream.

1282ffb964.gt:
Cook onion rings as directed on package.
When onions are almost done, grill franks 7 to 9 min.
or until heated through, turning occasionally and adding buns to the grill to toast for the last few minutes.
Spread rolls with barbecue sauce.
Insert each frank through 3 onion rings; place in bun.
Top with cheese.
1282ffb964.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut the Angus beef into 1/2-inch cubes.
Mix the beef with the rest of the ingredients.
Form into 1/2-inch thick patties.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Flip the patties and bake for another 10 minutes.
Serve with your favorite toppings.

21b8be21c5.gt:
Place all ingredients together in roasting pan.
Bake, uncovered, in 325 oven, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Stir often.
This recipe can be made in a crockpot, as well.
Mix all ingredients together in crockpot, set temperature dial to low setting, cook 4-6 hours.
Stir occasionally.
21b8be21c5.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large pot, combine the beans, tomatoes, onions, garlic, and bacon.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour.
Stir in the brown sugar, ketchup, and Worcestershire sauce.
Cover and cook for 1 hour longer, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and let cool.
Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, for 1 hour.
Serve hot.

b9040d1858.gt:
Place salted caramel sauce into the bottom of your mug and slowly add in the shot of espresso whilst stirring the mixture together.
Set aside.
Place cocoa powder, milk and sugar into a small saucepan over low-medium heat.
Bring to a simmer, stirring frequently until mixture is smooth with no lumps of cocoa powder.
Remove from heat and gradually pour into the mug with your caramel and coffee mixture, stirring to combine as you pour the milk mix in.
To garnish (optional): Squirt desired amount of cream on top of your mocha, then drizzle some extra salted caramel sauce on top.
Finish with some chocolate sprinkles and serve immediately.
b9040d1858.pred:
Combine the milk, chocolate, caramel sauce, and ice in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and enjoy!

663548f6ad.gt:
Do not peel potatoes.
Cut potatoes in long, uniformly shaped sticks.
Fry in hot oil(approx 325F)to desired doneness(dark & well done is the way they do them at the stands on the boardwalk).
Remove fries to paper towels and generously salt right away.
Serve in a paper cup or cone with plenty of malt vinegar.
663548f6ad.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, and pepper.
Add the potatoes and toss to coat.
In a separate bowl, combine the egg, milk, and oil.
Pour the egg mixture over the potatoes and toss to coat.
Spread the potatoes out on a baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
Raise the oven temperature to 450 degrees F.
Rub the potatoes with a little oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Place the potatoes on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes, until golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
Serve with ketchup, mayonnaise, and/or hot sauce.

6a483319ff.gt:
Wash the enoki mushrooms, cut off the stem ends and put on a plate.
Put a pat of butter (or margarine) on top.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Top with cheese (I used sliced cheese) and cover loosely with plastic wrap.
Microwave for about a minute and it's done.
Add a little soy sauce or ponzu sauce before eating.
Enjoy piping hot!
6a483319ff.pred:
Microwave Enoki Mushrooms and Cheese:
Ingredients:
1. 1 cup of enoki mushrooms
2. 1 cup of grated cheese
3. 1/2 cup of butter
4. 1/4 cup of soy sauce
5. 1/2 tsp of garlic powder
6. 1/2 tsp of onion powder

18. 1/2 tsp of dried chervil
19. 1/2 tsp of dried parsley
20. 1/2 tsp of dried oregano
21. 1/2 tsp of dried basil
22. 1/2 tsp of dried thyme
23. 1/2 tsp of dried rosemary
24. 1/2 tsp of dried sage
25. 1/2 tsp of dried marjoram
26. 1/2 tsp of dried savory
27. 1/2 tsp of dried tarragon
28. 1/2 tsp of dried chervil

30. 1/2 tsp of dried oregano

32. 1/2 tsp of dried thyme
33. 1/2 tsp of dried rosemary

f01aec104c.gt:
Let the chopped tomato drain in a colander while preparing the rest of the guacamole.
Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a small saucepan.
Add the frozen lima beans and cook until tender and creamy, about 5 minutes.
Drain the beans and rinse under cold water until cool.
Pat the beans dry with a paper towels then remove the skins by pinching the beans so the skins slide off.
If using baby limas, you can skip this step.
Scoop out a quarter of the avocado flesh, then process it with the lima beans, lime juice, mayonnaise, and 1/2 teaspoons salt in a food processor until very smooth, 1-1 1/2 minutes, stopping to scrape down the bowl as needed.
Cube the remaining 3/4 of the avocado into 1/2" pieces.
Gently stir the cubed avocado, pureed lima mixture, drained tomato, cilantro, jalapeno, onion, garlic, and cumin together.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Enjoy!
The guacamole can be refrigerated, wrapped tightly in plastic wrap, for up to 48 hours.
(the lima beans help keep it very green).
Make sure the plastic wrap is touching the surface of the guacamole.
Bring to room temperature and season with additional fresh lime juice, salt, and pepper before serving.

3b5d73be72.gt:
Add butter and sugar into a bowl, and mix until the mixture becomes white (If it's hard to blend, add oil in small amounts).
Add egg and remaining vegetable oil, and mix some more.
Sift the ingredients.
Add milk and dry ingredients alternately in 2 batches to the bowl, and mix.
When the batter is ready, it's really smooth.
Pour the batter into muffin cups.
Bake in the oven for 25 ~ 30 minutes at 170C (340F).
It's done.
These are also great as presents.
3b5d73be72.pred:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a bowl, mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
In a separate bowl, combine milk, egg, and melted butter.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
Fill muffin cups 3/4 full and bake for 15-20 minutes.

b801079396.gt:
In a small pot simmer the green garlic in the olive oil for 5 minutes.
Cool completely (this is very important, if the oil is still warm, the aioli will break).
When the oil is cold, combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl and whisk until frothy.
Slowly drizzle the green garlic olive oil in drop by drop until an emulsion is made.
Continue to add the oil and green garlic until you aioli is thick and creamy, season with salt to taste.
b801079396.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Cut green garlic into 1/4-inch pieces.
Place in a small baking dish and drizzle with olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until tender.
In a food processor, combine the garlic, mayonnaise, lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste.
Puree until smooth.
Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator.

b53489fe80.gt:
Pre heat oven to 180c/350F.
Grease a 6" cake tin or 1 lb loaf tin, and line with greaseproof paper.
Rub the butter into the flour so that it looks like breadcrumbs.
Add the sugar, ground nuts, chopped nuts, dates and the spice.
Mix well.
Add the egg and milk stir with a spoon, do not beat the mixture.
Transfer the mixture to the tin and top with a few nuts.
Bake for 1.5 hour or until a tooth pick inserted into the centre comes out clean.
Allow to cool in the tin for 10 mins and place on a wire rack.
When cool peel off the paper.
b53489fe80.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the dates, walnuts, 1 cup of sugar, and 1/2 cup of water.
Mix well.
Add the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Mix until well combined.
Pour into a greased 9x13 inch pan.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool completely before serving.

fa8f24e9ab.gt:
Stir together dry ingredients.
Mix liquids and fruit or nuts together and add to dry mixture, stirring lightly.
Fill 6 oiled muffin tins 1/2 full and bake 15 minutes at 425 degrees F.
fa8f24e9ab.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a bowl, combine oat flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and oil.
Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
Add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients and stir until just combined.
Fill greased muffin tins 3/4 full.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the tins.

00b1995e31.gt:
Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Season pork ribs with salt and pepper.
Working in two batches, sear the pork until light golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
As each batch of pork is seared, place it in the bottom of the crockpot.
Pour out all but 1 tablespoon of the drippings.
Add shallots and garlic to the pot.
Saute until the shallots are light golden brown.
Add tomato paste and cook until the paste becomes dark red, approximately 3 minutes.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, red wine, and fish sauce.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Pour the tomato sauce into the crockpot.
Add cannellini beans to the crockpot.
Cook on low heat for 6 to 8 hours, or until the pork is tender.
Remove the pork from the crockpot and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Return the pork to the crockpot and keep warm until ready to serve over rice or pasta (I use egg noodles).
Garnish with chopped fresh Italian parsley and grated Parmesan cheese.
00b1995e31.pred:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the ribs, onion, garlic, salt, pepper, and 1/2 cup of the tomato sauce.
Stir to coat the ribs and onions.
Place the ribs in a crockpot and cover with the remaining tomato sauce.
Cook on low for 8 hours.
Remove the ribs from the crockpot and place on a baking sheet.
Bake in the oven for 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and serve with the remaining tomato sauce.

14273bf5f9.gt:
Trim most of fat from pork loin, and place in crock pot, fat side up.
Sprinkle with garlic powder, pepper, salt, and red pepper flakes.
Top with onion.
Cook on high for 45-60 minutes.
Switch to low.
Cook on low for about 4 1/2 hours.
Mix all sauce ingredients together.
Separate pork loin into big chunks.
Pour sauce mixture into crock pot, making sure to mix in juices from pork loin.
Cook for one more hour, then shred pork with two forks.
Barbecue can be left simmering for another 2 hours on low, or switched to"keep warm" setting instead.
Serve on buns.
14273bf5f9.pred:
Slice the chicken breasts into 1/2 inch strips.
Add the chicken, onions, peppers, and garlic to the crock pot.
Mix together the barbecue sauce, brown sugar, and spices.
Pour the sauce over the chicken and vegetables.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours.
Serve over rice.

07f2c36b9b.gt:
Heat bacon for 30 seconds in the microwave between two pieces of paper towel to soak up excess grease
Spread honey mustard on tortilla then lay cheese on top of honey mustard, then add chicken, then add the bacon.
Spread the guacamole on top of the bacon then lay lettuce leaves on top of guacamole
Roll up and devour!
07f2c36b9b.pred:
Chicken, Bacon, Avocado and Swiss cheese.
Chicken: 1 pound
Bacon: 1/2 pound
Avocado: 1/2 pound
Swiss cheese: 1/2 pound
Whole wheat tortilla: 1

Sliced plums: 1/2 cup
Sliced peaches: 1/2 cup
